prompt: Some people think that robots are important for humansâ future development. Other think that robot have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Some people would argue that robots are imperative for the future and enable people to save more time; however, some think robots negatively impact society and make people less social. Although robots may have made people technology-dependent, I believe that the quality of work will improve and be error-free with robotics.

On the one hand, using robotic technology, people become more dependent on machines and lazy. People spend more time watching TV or browsing the internet rather than doing their day-to-day work as robots work for them like a robot vacuum cleaner. As a result, people become more reclusive, less social, and lazy and will potentially get into several health concerns such as obesity and overweight related health diseases.

On the other hand, some people believe that robots enable people to work effectively and provide error-free results. Robots are programmed which minimize the errors humans usually can make. That degree of error can be minimal, like a typo error or massive during some surgeries, which can be fatal. In my opinion, I agree with this viewpoint as robots minimize mistakes; therefore, one can save time and energy to rectify the error. For example, recent research found that humans perform some surgical procedures that take 5-8 hours; when experimented with robots, scientists found a reduction in time by 1-2 hours with almost zero errors.

In conclusion, although robots make people lazy and less social, I believe robots save time and minimize human errors; therefore, they are beneficial for the future.

prompt: Some people think that children should not watch television because it has negative effects, while others believe that televison helps children. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
The diagram illustrates information on the production of waste in six  states from 1980 to 2000. Overall, the US produced more in 20 years whereas Ireland and Portugal did less.

First and  foremost, in 1980, the US and Korea had the highest number of waste production with 131 and 28  million tonnes respectively. However, during the same period, Portugal and  Ireland produced less with 2 and 0.6  million tonnes  respectively.  Korea had no figures recorded for the year 1980.

A decade later, 5 countries had a rapid increase in their manufacturing with the US still leading and having a greater rise  from 131 to 151 million tonnes. In the same year, both Portugal and Poland increased by 1 million. However, Ireland had no recorded numbers in the same period.

In the last 10 years,  5 countries continued improving their manufacture except for Korea which plummeted from 31 to 19 million. In the same year, the US  had the greatest increase in production from 151 to 192 million .

prompt: Holding International games such as The Olympic Games is an exciting event. Some people think that it has positive effects while other argue that it is a waste of money. Discuss both sides of view and give your own opinion.
essay:
Major international events are fascinating. The city host usually has their once in a lifetime experience as being the worldâs spotlight.  On the other hand, several people tend to believe this leads to unreasonable financial expenditure. As far as I concerned, although International games are overpriced, they are satisfactory to a long-term cityâs legacy. This essay will present a discussion of both sides of view. 

Firstly, when a country wins the bid to host an Olympic Games is the chance of being broadcasting worldwide and becoming the spotlight. Media coverage before and during the games is undeniable and this fact leads to an exposure that will bring more visitors. For example, Rio 2016 Olympic and Paralympic games held in Brazil had increased 40% touristâs visits through 2 years after the Games. Therefore, hosting international events can be remarkable to  economic growth through the tourism industry. 

However, hosting the Olympic Games can be catastrophic if not well planned. It is crucial to plan a long term and map out all the sports venues on how they can be used after the games, otherwise, several venues can become white-elephants stadiums.  To illustrate this, the Athenaâs Olympics Games in 2004 was an outstanding event, notwithstanding, it was not well organized and most of the arenas nowadays are destroyed due to time. Thus, a plethora of money can be spent when a country receives the bid of a Games and the return of investment can be pointless if not well-planned. 

To conclude, from the arguments presented above, it is inconceivable to believe that financial expenditure does not exist. Nevertheless, there is positive effects as well as drawbacks when hosting any mega event.

prompt:
Some believe that people should make efforts to fight climate change while others think it is better to learn to live with it.

In conclusion, I strongly agree with the opinion that climate change should not be ignored and it is high time humans saved the world they living in. I would suggest that the government should step in and launch some environmental policies for the citizen to follow.

prompt:

To conclude, music has by far and large more benefits than problems to influence young people because it can change emotions or tell experiences, even though some type of music could have a negative impact.

prompt:
Some believe that people should make efforts to fight climate change while others think it is better to learn to live with it.
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
There are many natural disasters happening around the world as an effect of climate change. Some people suggest that global warming should be combated, whereas others think people should accept the current fact and adapt to changes. In the following paragraphs, both of these viewpoints will be discussed in detail before a conclusion is reached.

Some people think that climate change is acceptable and people should be adaptable to all kinds of situations. In the last few decades, there were different natural disasters happened in different parts of the world such as floods, sea-level rise, the melting of the polar ice sheet, droughts, extreme weather and earthquake which are the effects of global warming that cannot be avoided to encounter in some countries. For example, Japan is a country that earthquakes occur the most, however, Japanese people still live in their country and learn how to live with it. In addition, their houses and buildings have been built with resilient structures to withstand earthquakes.

On the other hand, many activists around the world try to urge people to stop behaviours that cause the greenhouse effect. Many people contribute finding strategies to mitigate climate change; however, this is unable to be successful without governmentsâ support ; therefore, governments need to deliver effective climate policies such as carbon footprint reduction, clean energy, sustainable lifestyle and so on to all organisations, factories and individuals to be able to follow them in order to prevent the increase of the worse situations.

In conclusion, people should be adaptable to unexpected natural disasters, in a meantime, I believe that this phenomenon cannot be ignored and allowed to get worse in the future by human behaviours. Both government and individuals should take actions to tackle this problem and mitigate carbon emissions to order to make our world the best place to live.

prompt: Some people believe that we should do our best to mitigate the effects of climate change, while others believe that we should learn how to live with it. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay:
It is considered by many that people should do their best to lessen global warmingâs effects, but others believe that we should get used to living with it. I think, despite  being the irreversible effects that global change brings about, we exactly seek to solve this problem rather than accepting.

First, without taking precautions, the condition of the world can become  worse or deteriorate by only learning how to live with climate change. Therefore, we should make people more conscious of its effect and take some measures to mitigate it. For example, government and conservation organizations promote people to get about using biodegradable materials instead of using disposable ones such as plastics. Hence, we might contribute to this change positively to be a reversible effect. 

However, many scholars think that this situation becomes an irreversible matter, which does not help people to stop this change. So, ones which encounter problems related to climate change must get used to situations, resulting in decreasing its harm and damage and thus saving peopleâs lives. For instance, in northern Turkey because of global change towns flood with heavy rain and landscapes occur more often compared to the past. Consequently, inhabitants readjust to new conditions by changing town plans or the location of their houses.

In my opinion, although climate changeâs effects are rising day by day, this problem only solves by humans. Nevertheless, it comes out with humanâs mistakes, it will simply be sorted out by people. If the government and all people cooperate with each other and people are educated about its adverse effects, I think we cope with that situation.

In conclusion, even if people prefer to spend their time getting used to the worldâs extraordinary conditions, they must tend to be cared to stop these conditions by being increased their awareness.

prompt: Some people believe that time spent on television and computer games can be valuable for children. Others believe this has negative effects on a child. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
A highly controversial issue today relates to children being too much time on tv and video games is good for them or this implies on not good influence for them . In this essay, I am going to examine this question and explain why I believe the argument of their negative effect on them is stronger.

There are people who argue that spending time on electronics like computer games considerably outweighs its disadvantages. The main reason for believing this is that the television stimulates their imagination and creativity solving computer games. It is also possible to say that these little daily challenges improve their intelligence as they progress inside the game. One good example here is the increasing difficult in each phase of the Super Mario game.

On the other hand, others believe that TV and computer activities are passive actions for children. People often have this opinion because since the first months of life up to 10 years old, the children does need to practice physical activities like run, walk, touch new objects. A second point is that their development depends on direct interactions with people and other infants. Their interactions of touching, tasting, smelling, hearing, visioning will have a significant impact on their development while screens will mainly interact with visioning. A particularly good example here is when is compared a child who frequents kindergarten versus a child who does not. The first one usually has more abilities as they interact with others at school.

In conclusion, both arguments have their merits. On balance, however, I feel that spent time on screens like TV and video games is not a valuable time. This is because the interactions with other human beings have more impact to their early development.

prompt: Some people believe that time spent on television, video and computer games can be beneficial to children. Others believe this has negative effects on the child. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
It is widely believed that the uses of the tv, video and computer games might have a positive impact on children. However, some people argue that using these devices might not be beneficial after all. This essay will discuss both these views and will provide my own opinion of the matter.  

On the one hand, these tools can be used to boost  brain development in children. It has been scientifically proven that some children can potentially learn topics of different subjects by watching tv. For instance,  some tv channels educated kids by showing them programs related to history or geology, thus, helping them become more familiar with it. Secondly, when kids play either video or computer games, they are working out their brain. In other words, some brain' parts need to be active in order to understand the plot and the goal of the game. At the same time, they can acquire new skills. For instance, a study from the University of California showed that kids who played Tetris games can develop better spatial vision in their later life.

On the other hand, children could be at risk when they spent time using these tools.Â A lot of parents advocate and refuse their kids to watch tv. They believe that there are many inappropriate tv programs showing adult scenes or people having bad habits that can directly influence kids' behaviours. Moreover, there is a great risk of children becoming dependent on these devices. As a result, they spent countless hours indoors, thus, isolating themselves from family and friends. Lastly, there is a high likelihood of children becoming violent when they spent time playing action games. These games can easily influence their behaviours and in some cases, it can even encourage them to be violent in real life.

In conclusion, these tools bring a lot of advantages for children, as long as they are used in the right way. In my opinion, there should be limits in the use of these devices in order to avoid kids being negatively impacted. In the future, parents should be more vigilant with their kids, checking upon their habits, especially watching tv and gaming.

prompt: Some people think competitive sport is important for a childâs education . Other think it has negative effects on children. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
A few people believe that playing competitive games by students plays a vital role in their studies, whereas others assert involvement in these activities is not beneficial for the children. I intend to discuss both the views followed by my own opinion.

On the one hand, advocates of latter view opine that competitive sport can adversely impact the studies of the pupils. In order to participate at a level which requires consistent practice, students need to spend enough time in the field to participate in it. Due to this, they often fail to spend time in their academics, thereby negatively affecting their studies. For example, a child who practices in the morning and evening for sports gets tired and generally skips the classes and self-study hours to recover. This situation clearly depicts the effect on the education of  sports students as they do not get time for studies.

On the other hand, proponents of the former notion assert participation in competitive sport enhances certain skills which can assist the young ones to imitate these characters in their academic life. To explain, players are not only trained to bear pressure, but also to hold their nerves in any competition by the sports coaches. These qualities are generally required in taking competitive examinations as well, which are not easily provided through teaching in classes. Thus, students who are equipped with these skills through competitive sports activities are more likely to get succeeded in the examinations which require competition such as entrance exam for various prestigious universities and so on.

In my perspective, sports activities can aid the students to perform better in their education unless they spend a large share of time in the sports field only. It is primarily due to the fact that outdoor activities increase oxygen content in the body, which can make students more sharp and active. This is imperative for their studies because it can help them to raise their concentration while learning as the fresh and active mind is more focussed according to various studies as well.

To conclude, in my opinion, students ought to dedicate some time to competitive sports as it can help in terms of building character which can assist them in their education as well as refreshing their minds to increase concentration in studies.

prompt: some people think advertisements may have positive economic effects whereas others think there are negative social effects because individuals are not satisfied with who they are and what they have. discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:

On the other hand, a part citizen also shows drawbacks of the advertisement industry since it may lead to an unhealthy lifestyle and exaggerate the benefits of certain goods. For instance, the model wears the latest dress with the limited handbag seems to be a shining diamond in the sun. As a consequence, customers especially the young generation become discontented with what they already have and are likely to waste time and money on trying fancy things. 

All in all, judged by a detailed analysis of both sides, I think that the efforts of manufactures to promote their goods are not to blame. Additionally, related laws should be launched to ensure that there is no deception in any advertisement and promote healthy competition among producers.

prompt: It is common for people to travel long distances for work and study.Some argue that longer commute times negatively affect people while others disagree.Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:

prompt: some people think watching TV is bad for children,while others think that watching TV has more beneficial effects on children. Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay:
Television has become an indispensable part of day-to-day life. Although it is thought that spending time watching television is detrimental for children, some people believe this has more advantages in their development. In my opinion, I strongly consider that media has a negative effect in shaping children's behaviour and character and on the long run has damaging side-effects.

On the one hand, some people voice that screen time is quite harmful for children, and I agree. In other words, spending a considerable amount of time watching programmes reduces the time that is spent on studies, and as a result, they tend to score low grades in academics. Adolescents, for instance, are glued to television spending hours together, thereby lose interest and struggle to concentrate in their studies. Consequently, they end up with poor academic performance and failing to succeed later in life. Moreover, cartoon and animated series target young children, and eventually affects their health as the time spent outdoors is considerably less.

On the other hand, it is believed by some that watching useful programmes has beneficial effects on children. One reason why it is helpful is that it gives them quality leisure time from the highly demanding various subjects. This gives them the chance to take their mind out and enjoy some fun time, and also cultivate their interests by watching suitable series. Another reason is that they could relax at the comfort of their home by watching their favourite shows or scientific programs, rather than venturing out, thereby managing time efficiently.

In conclusion, while people may vary in their opinions, I completely believe that spending time before the big screen has harmful effects on children's life.

prompt: Some people regard video games as harmless fun, or even as a useful educational tool. Others, however, believe that video games are having an adverse effect on the people who play them. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Nowadays, people are using the internet everyday to work, study and leisure activities. Some people hold the belief that playing video games is help they to chill out safely and have benefit on educational. On the other hand, other people think that playing video games could make negative effect on the player. From my point of view, although some games would help you feel better, playing games could have value detrimental impact. This essay will discuss positive and negative of video games. 

There is a wide range of positive effect from video games. First, playing video games could make people happy, especially children. Video games are a fake life and people can do what they want in the fake life. Children can play with their friend or their brothers and sisters. People will do some mission to can earn money, buy anything they want or pass the level. Many celebrities are playing video games with their fan and it can attract more fan. Second, some video games are valuable on educational. Children could keen on studying and it gets more benefits than traditional teaching. Moreover, video games could help children know what to do in real life. 

On the other hand, there is a host of negative impact from video games. Some people keen on playing video games because they can not do what they want in real life. Therefore, they pay a lot of time and money to play. That is why some teenagers do bad behaviour to can have money. They can do society's vices like video games, do not obey their parents. When play games, your information can leak by crime but you could not know. In my opinion, government need to do something to can make internet safely. We should remove video games related violence or society's vices. Teenagers should to get 1 or 2 hours to relax the internet. School and family need to organization of outdoor activities, do not children spend more times to playing video games although it related their lesson.

essay:

prompt: Some people believe that the time spent on television and computer games can be valuable for children. Others believe that this has negative effects on child. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Some argue that PC gaming and television are beneficial for adolescents, while others advocate that they are detrimental. This essay will present both views of this contentious argument and argue why I believe parents' supervision is crucial.

Advocates believe that television and computer games yield positive effects on young children. Firstly, they emphasise that these pastimes could have a tremendous educational impact on young people. There are various tv channels that offer diverse programmes that go beyond the school's curriculum, and children are attracted to watch and merrily expand their knowledge. My nephew, for instance, views the Discovery Channel to experience the lives of the Amazon tribes. Another benefit is that children can develop cognitive abilities. Online games such as the Civilisations, require to build an empire and battle to survive, and when played in groups, users have to communicate and collaborate to achieve their goals. As such, spending more time on computer games will assist these young group to cultivate essential problem-solving and teamwork skills that are necessary for their adult life.

Nevertheless, others highlight the worry impacts of digital gaming and television on young people. Their primary concern is health. Adolescents face difficulty with moderation and they can watch television for 6 hours on end. This will lead them to breed a sedentary lifestyle which results in obesity, diabetes and posture problems. Additionally, opponents contend that spending lengthy hours on screens will stall their social skill development. Games such as Suki are also played solo and the lack of engagement might lead them to be self-centred and less expressive. In this regard, my consent lies with this group as socialisation should be the key ability that needs to be cultivated in their early childhood.

To conclude, while the educational and cognitive benefits of children playing computers and watching tv are immense, I believe that parents should strictly discipline their children from using these devices as their health conditions may deteriorate and they might not be able to learn social skills.

prompt: Some People believe that Robots play an important role in future societies, While other argue that robots might have negative effects on societies give often. discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Being part of a world where technology has been changing how we live, some individuals defend that machines have a positive impact on our future. Although, there are those who state the opposite, believing that robots will bring an undesired outcome for our society. In my point of view, these technological tools are beneficial for us, as we can adapt them to our needs, which will make our lives easier. 

On the one hand, some people strongly believe that technological machines will improve our way of living, as it can help us with repetitive daily tasks. Nowadays we have seen hotels in Japan, for example, using robots to take dirty plates from the door of the rooms. Indeed, during times of pandemics, for instance, this is an amazing tool to protect clients as well as employees. Besides, it has been used to clean houses, as well, thus, when you finish working, you do not need to take care of it anymore. Furthermore, places that are facing a labour shortage can try to use it and still deliver the desired service. As we can see, these machines can solve some of our problems, making our life less stressful. 

On the other hand, this discussion brings a group of people that do not believe in the positive contribution of these robots. They defend that these machines can be used to replace humans, hence, reducing human interactions. A great example of this is the smartphones, as they are already negatively impacting on our sociability. In recent times, people are avoiding meet friends in person, staying always in touch using social media or video calls. Consequently, with smarter machines, this change will be bigger and can bring some health problems. Indeed, this is an important point to be taken into consideration, however, I believe that some measures need to be put in place to avoid it. 

In conclusion, the use of robots in our societies has been concerning part of the population who do not believe in its benefits, however, there are those who think that this is an important improvement in our lives. Even considering both sides, I still believe that there are ways to avoid the drawbacks of this technology and take advantage of its benefits, which for me are bigger than the negative impacts.

prompt:
Some people think the increasing business and cultural contact between countries brings many positive effects. Others say it causes the loss of national identities.

Discuss both view and give your opinion.
essay:
The growing international trade activities and interactions among countries has boosted economic development and better cross-cultural understanding on a global scale. However, some people argue that such developments are the biggest culprit behind the degradation of cultural identity in many countries.

On the one hand, there is no question that many developing countries have experienced a surge in employment opportunities and unparalleled economic gains by virtue of globalization. While businesses can reap the benefits from drop in trade barriers such as reaching potential customers beyond national borders, competent employees would be able to work overseas in multinational corporates. Furthermore, globalization has also encouraged the tourism industry; thereby, promoting a better understanding of other cultures. Experiencing different ways of life, discovering new food and customs and visiting cultural sites will eventually help people gain their knowledge bank and respect for other cultures.

On the other hand, the general complaint about globalization is that it represents a deadly threat to the national culture. The constant stream of marketing campaigns by international firms has led to the dominance of certain eating habits and fashion trends, whereas the traditional lifestyles become less favorable amongst young generations. In addition, there is mounting evidence that a large number of minority languages are on the verge of extinction as people prefer to conduct businesses and communicate in widely used tongues like English or Chinese.

In conclusion, although globalization may result in a certain loss of cultural identities, there are still more benefits of increasing trade and cross-cultural activities among countries. From a broad perspective, international business should be regarded as a positive development and encouraged by all nations.

prompt: Some people think that robots are important for humanâs future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay:
One of the most interesting topics to discuss in current times is how automatic machines are taking over the future inventions. While Scientist's from across the globe argue that this is a right time for Artificial Intelligence to start control the world. However, others argue that giving complete authority to the machine can have some serious drawbacks, which will risk human's life at workplace. I strongly believe that there should be balanced automation technology for better future, which human can control if it is necessary. However, I will explain the both sides of the question with examples. 

There is an ample evidence to show that automated machines can produce significantly more amount of production when compare to humans. Which means, automated machine can do 5 people's work in one hour with less manpower. In the same way, R&D departments form various industries providing more employment opportunities for graduates to develop advance machines. For example, economically developed countries like the USA, Germany and UK already deployed automated machines in manufacturing industries. As a result, more production can be done in short time. 

On the other hand, some commentators suggest that too much of automation technology at workplace can lead to serious outbreaks. For instance, machines have no control of taking decisions on their own, unless someone can programme them to do so, mistakenly, if a person is standing at the machine operated location, he can be injured. While recent study from the University of Melbourne states that, if automation technology started expanded, unemployment rate will increase more likely to 25 percent in Australia. 

In conclusion, I strongly recommend that automation machines at industries will provide large amount of production in short time. However, too much of automation will make humans lazier in future. There should be balanced workload where machine and human can do.

prompt: While some people consider air pollution to be the most dangerous environmental problem, others believe that soil pollution has a more serious effect on our world. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Nowadays, environmental pollution is one of the most devastating impacts of human activities on the Earth. There are four types of pollution, namely, air pollution, water pollution, soil pollution and noise pollution. Some people believe that air pollution is the most pressing problem while others are convinced that soil pollution has an implicit threat. This essay will discuss both statements and give some justifications for why I advocate the former.

   On the one hand, soil pollution consists of damaging long-term effects. Soil fertility will no longer remain if this kind of pollution constantly continues. Inorganic waste and the overuse of chemical fertilizers, which are attributed to the cause of soil deterioration, can affect harmful to local people's health such as cancer from chromium, damages in the nervous system from lead, etc. Soil that has been contaminated should no longer be used to grow food, because the chemicals can leech into the food and harm people who eat it.

   On the other hand, I totally believe that air pollution creates much more detrimental issues. Long-standing impacts on inhabitants' health stemming from air pollution include heart disease, lung cancer, and respiratory diseases such as emphysema. Air pollution can also directly contaminate the surface of bodies of water and soil, which will kill crops or reduce their yield. Air pollution will certainly contribute to the greenhouse effect which can lead to a series of environmental problems such as Increase in average temperatures and temperature extremes, polar ice melting, rise of sea levels, etc.

   By means of conclusion, although some people think that soil pollution contains hazardous impacts, I am firmly convinced that air pollution causes more toxic effects. It is vital that governments should do something from now to prevent the development of environmental pollution.

prompt: Some people say that playing computer games is bad for children in every way. Others say that playing computer games can have positive effects on the way children develop. Discuss both view sides and give your opinion
essay:
The computer game industry has an intrinsic role in our daily life. This enormous increase has lead to two opposite opinions on the effects of playing computer games on children. A certain people claim that computer games are detrimental to the youngstersâ health being while a few thinks it has some positive impacts on the childâs growth. In this essay, I will shed lights on these boons as well as analyze the negative aspects of playing games in front of computer screens.

Firstly, the most notable advantages of playing computer games is skills improvement. Playing computer games help enrich the young generationâs reflexion and logical thinking by providing practise in problem solving and tactical situations. In addition, the juvenile are able to meet and strike up a friendship with like minded people and share ideas with them.

Despite those benefits, spending a great amount of time playing games will face climbing rate of deleterious health issues; including obesity, heart diseases and so on. With their leisure time mostly spend on playing games in front of computer screens, the youngsters will lack sufficient physical activities; this lifestyle tendency absolutely cause gaining weight. Furthermore, violent contents in computer games could have egregious impacts on childrenâs behaviour since the young people would imitate the ferocious acts in the games

In conclusion, no doubt there are some pros involved in playing video games. However, parents should limit the playing time and take a proper care to overcome such issues so that children can enjoy their leisure time.

prompt: Some people think that illegal Internet downloads are having a negative effect on the music industry. Others feel that they have little or no impact on artists. Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay:
Nowadays, it is a very common to download from the internet and it is becoming a topic of debate whether it is legal or not. However, while many advocates that music piracy doesnât effect on the music industry, I side with those who believe that it does affect the music industry as a whole.
On one hand, it could be argued that download music from the internet is not illegal and it doesnât affect the music industry because they have multiple sources of income. Many artists create videos or songs just as a hobby. Likewise, many artists do live shows or advertisements, their main income sources are not just music. Hence, supporters of this claim that download from the internet doesnât affect much to them.

On the other hand, I hold the opinion that download music from the internet is illegal and it significantly affects the music industry because to make any song is expensive. Many people work behind to make an album and artists needs to pay for the staff, advertisement fees and rent. If people do not buy their album legally, artists will not able to pay them and in the end artists will get bankrupt. In other words, they will stop making music albums and people might lose great artists.  Thus, in my opinion, people should not download music from the internet illegally.

To conclude, although some musical artists make albums as a hobby or they do not rely on one source of income, Music downloading from the internet without paying for, it causes the whole industry will not survive in the future. Therefore, on balance, I think people should avoid music piracy.

prompt:
Some people think that the range of technology currently available is increasing the gap between rich people and poor people. Others think that it is causing the opposite effect.
Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Some people believe that technological progress these days have increased space between poor and rich people while others disagree with this idea. In my opinion, a large section of machinery is available that decreases gap between poor and rich people. On the contrary, there are novel technological innovations and gadgets that are accessible only for affluent people.
To begin with, automation is a powerful issue which has covered the whole world for last decades. As we can see, it is required for carrying out majority of daily and routine chores and all services should be linked with computers and internet. Moreover, for attainment wide ranges of information in different fields, such as universities, healthcare services and other enterprises, technological tools and websites are needed. Owing to this dependency, main parts of automation should be existed for all sorts of people in society that this matter decrease the gap between them.
On the other hand, some technological discoveries and devices are merely for affluent because of financial matters. For a sample, there are several approaches of treatments for chronic diseases such as cancers or HIV virus which are extremely lethal for human. These methods include high cost of drugs and emergency cares which only rich people can afford them. In addition, there are some appliances and machines like last update of different brands of Microsoft or car companies which poor people can only dream about them. Therefore, this is the basic reason to increase the space between both types of people.
In conclusion, according to the text, using of technology has a couple effects on the community that can declines or increases the gap between rich and poor people because of monetary issues. Finally, there is a devout hope for all kinds of societies that any technological innovations will be available regardless of their money worries.

prompt:
Many people believe that the priority of the government should be to ensure a growing economy. While others believe that the government should focus its efforts on uplifting the less fortunate?
Discuss both views.
essay:
A government, whether it is democratic or republic, should aim on the good will of their citizens, have vision to fulfil and responsibilities to carry on. Thus, economic headway is the key to success for a prosperous future. Many, including the regime think that, the priority should be given to ensure the promotion of economy while others disagree with this notion and opine that they should focus its efforts on the progress of  the less privileged. In this essay, we can discuss both sides.

To begin with, economists  betterment is a policy intervention endeavour aiming to improve the well-being of people.  Economic advance is required to ensure a better life standard for the civilian. For instance, to control the crime rates, corruptions, better hospital facilities, etc. So, it is important for a state to assure the stability of austerity. Without economic stability, an administration cannot ensure advancement in education, defence, healthcare, international trade and social safety. Moreover, without economic success, a country cannot defend itself from external threats, fight with epidemic diseases and cannot ensure proper health care facilities to its inhabitant.

On the other hand, even though economic prosperity plays an essential part, governments must ensure a better living standard and green environment. They have to pay attention to create a more advanced educational system, business ventures, job opportunities and thereby creating better life standards and comfort and then, the ministry can collect more funds through taxes. The authorities should provide blue sky and clean air to their taxpayers, as their right. Therefore, the hike of the economic sectors should be aligned with other important sectors. In addition, many people would also argue that it is better to bestow a prosperous country to the new generation rather than leaving them a broken economy.

To sum up, it is undeniable that economic expansion plays an important role in the development of a nation. More than half the people of the world are living in conditions approaching misery. Thus, the officials must consider many other aspects which are equally important. However, I personally believe that besides economic improvement, better education, social welfare, security and political stability are equally important for the sustainable development of a nation.

prompt: Some people think that providing many TV channels is a great thing, but others think that this may affect the quality of TV programs. Discuss both views and give own opinion.
essay:
With an increasing demand for TV programs, nowadays, there are more options to watch TV programs than in the past.  Some people insist that it is not beneficial to have many TV channels. Although I understand this point of view, I would argue that widening choices to watch TV programs has a positive effect on individuals and society.

Admittedly, there are some disadvantages to providing many TV channels. Some people might find it easy to see unreliable news. This is because broadcast might find it difficult to survive in competition as there are so many different TV channels. Therefore, people working in broadcast may need to attract peopleâs attention, using exaggerated information. As a result, the situation lead worker engaging in broadcast to making low-quality of TV programs. 

However, I still believe that providing many TV channels can bring about positive consequences. Many different kinds of TV programs can be creative by people. People working in broadcast may have more opportunities to participate in TV programs. Therefore, many people dose their best to get the opportunities. As a result, people can invent different types of TV programs and make high quality of TV shows. Furthermore, the employment rate will increase as broadcast companies need people who can work with. The situation can help broadcast industry to thrive

In conclusion, according to the aforementioned reasons, there are some harmful effects to expend broadcast industry while I still believe that this should be seen as a positive development.

prompt: Some people think that holding olympic Games has positive effects for a host country while others believe that it has a negative effect.Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay:
Hosting the  olympics is such an honour for a country,  with certain advantages and disadvantages.  Countries bid to host the event.There are two sides to the debate,  and the sides wil be discussed shortly.
The entry of the participating teams and their fans boosts the tourism sector of the chosen country,  they are able to visit various tourist attractions and boost the businesses.

prompt: Some people think that climate change could have a negative effect on business. Other people think that climate change could create more business opportunities. Discuss both views give your own opinion.
essay:
It is irrefutable that climatic change is one of the major concerns across the globe today. While one section of the society consider this as an opportunity for creating and expanding businesses, others see this as a drawback for them. This essay will juxtapose both these views, and finally conclude with my opinion.

With the dramatic change in the weather patterns, the tourism industry has been harshly hit. Owing to unexpected rise and fall in temperatures in most of the parts of the world, such as extreme weather conditions in India, where summers are as warm as 50 degrees Celsius and in winters mercury level drops to nearly freezing 0 degrees Celsius, tourists do not prefer to visit such places. Consequently, local businesses and overall economy dependent on tourism gets detrimentally affected.

On the contrary, few businesses such as air conditioner manufactures, fans and heaters manufacturing companies see this as a good time to boost their business as the demand of their products shoot up due to climatic change and consequently they have to increase the supply as well. Their agenda becomes very clear and their business potentially increases in such conditions.

In conclusion, though few businesses gain from the climate change, I believe the majority has a perilous effect on them. Climate change is a very dangerous issue which will negatively affect each one of us, even those who are gaining profit from it today. Hence, we all should have a provident approach towards it and be solicitous about our future.

prompt: Some people believe that schools should include competitive sports as a subject while others believe that it has negative effects on children. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Sports, nowadays have become an integral part of the young generation. The society has been discussing about the consequences of competitive sports in schools for youngers. This essay will discuss why I strongly believe that all kinds of sports should be teach at school. 

First of all, the main idea behind the sports is that they maintain the body moving. As a result of it, sports make us healthier and happier. Second of all, especially for children these kinds of practice are really necessary to develop theirs muscles, bones, and even mind. For example, if they practiced regular activities more often, such as, soccer, basketball or volley, their health will be improved a lot, also they could live more and more years.

Moreover, working as a team, some young people develop the ability to understand how the world works, while some are the first, others could be the last. For instance, when I was a child, I used to play soccer with my friends during the high school, and it was an amazing experience for all of us, because sometimes we won, and others we lost, but we never gave up. Consequently, this period taught us an important lesson for entire life, that is "no matter the final result, always give your best".

In conclusion, I totally agree with it that there are more pros than cons of teaching competitive sports for children, they could rise mature and being better people, facing challenges no matter how big they could be.

prompt: Some people believe that time spent on television, video and computer games can be beneficial to children. Others believe this has negative effects on the child. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
There is an ever increasing use of technology, children are spending more time on television, video and computer games. It's often argued that this is a positive phenomenon while others disagree and think it will make children pay less attention on study and outdoor activities. This essay agrees that spending time on electronic devices are an advantage to children. This essay will discuss both point of view.

It's clear that electronic devices not only gives children a better way to entertain themselves, but also have a huge benifit to children. Wikipedia is a good example, children can learn whatever they want to learn on Wikipedia with very convenient operation by just typing what they want to know, and also video games, children can learn other countries's langueges,  practice reflexs, some school also use video games to teach their students too.

prompt:
Some people think that competitive sports are important for a child education, others think that it has negative effects. 
Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Sports are the key to physical and mental health. Every school around the world has a dedicated period for physical training. There are two schools of thought, one believes that competing in games is favorable for child learning, while others think that there are negative consequences. I believe that sports competition encourages the child to be strong, and courageous, however, there are some adverse effects.
Competitive sports, such as football, baseball, cricket e.t.c. train a child to analyze, plan and execute. They bring out the best in a person. Children tend to perform better and at a higher rate if they are made to compete with one another. Take cricket, for example, players tend to analyze the goal, come up with a strategy, and try to achieve it. Such sports have a positive effect on child education. Physical activity increases the thinking capacity of youngsters that can be take advantage of during studying. 
On the contrary, others believe that making children compete with one another can have adverse effects. Every player in a game aims to win, this can put a lot of stress on a young mind that can lead to mental trauma. Moreover, sports focus on winning and not being productive, therefore, a young athlete if losing, tries to use false methods to achieve a goal. As a result, this develops a negative perception among the kids. Furthermore, such sports also increase the risk of injuries. 
To conclude, I think that competitive sports can have a positive outcome on child schooling as it teaches to perform accurately, not be fearful, and make the most. On the other hand, it also has some negative effects, such as stress and a misconception that a goal is to win no matter what.

prompt:
Some people believe that robots will play an important role in future societies, while others argue that robots might have negative effects on society.

Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Robots are likely to become as ubiquitous as the smartphone computers we all carry in our future society. While some people argue that robots might have negative impacts on the future society, I believe that the benefits of the robot are likely to outweigh the negative aspects of it.

On the one hand, there are two main reasons why it could be argued that robots might have adverse effects on society in the future. Firstly, some people believe that robots will harm the human workforce. The people will be replaced by machines and this will increase the unemployment rate. As a result, many other problems may emerge such as poverty and increased crimes. Secondly, people will become more dependent on robots in their daily life and this may harmfully affect their skills like cooking and driving. So people become less active and this may result in some health problems like obesity.

On the other hand, I would agree with those who argue that robots will play important positive roles in future society. The first role is that robots could operate in locations that humans cannot reach such as exploration of the outer space. They can act as extended eyes for humans enabling them to look beyond their visual boundaries. Moreover, robots will be used inside human bodies for monitoring their health and undertake surgery. The second role that will be played by robots is the helping of elderly and retired people with their daily life activities like cooking and cleaning. Finally, robots could do normal jobs quickly unlike human beings. Robots don not complain or get distracted or tired. They readily work twenty-four hours and require minimal maintenance.

In conclusion, there are convincing arguments both for in and against the role of robots in our future would, but I believe that robots will add many benefits to the future society.

prompt:
Some people think the increasing business and cultural contact between countries brings many positive effects. Others say it causes the loss of national identities.
Discuss both of these views and give your own opinion.
essay:
There are approximately 196 countries in the world, each following their own business strategies and a unique culture. It is the duty of everyone to appreciate and respect their cultural diversity in order to maintain peace and harmony across the globe. Increasing trade and cultural exchange between countries has both advantages and disadvantages. Let me discuss both aspects and conclude with my personal opinion.

To embark with the advantages, trade connection between the two nations promote a smooth and friendly relation among them. It assists in setting up a mutual collaboration and foreign investment in our province, thereby increasing the job opportunity for the graduated youngsters. The country's economic status is greatly improved through these marketing relations and is one of the better ideas in assisting a nation's progress in development. Also, by allowing cultural contact, their diversity can be familiarized worldwide, where everyone can know about the different traditions followed across the globe.

To view the negative aspects, a country's identity starts to fade through these type of commerce as the other nation might dominate us. For example, the business collaboration between India and China has resulted in loss of former country's identity, wherein most of the population prefers to buy the products made in China. This has greatly resulted in depreciation in value for the native products due to the preference given to foreign articles. Also, there are high chances of some particular culture or tradition getting extinct due to their over  diversification.

By summarizing the above said points, the advantages overweigh the disadvantages of such business and cultural relations. So I deeply agree that developing trade collaboration can greatly influence the nation's economic level in a positive way other than improving cultural diversity across the globe.

prompt: Some people think that the range of technology available to people is increasing the gap between the rich and the poor. Others think it has an opposite effect. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Some people often think that the availability of the technological advancements nowadays are raising the distance between the wealthy and the poor, while others believe it has an opposing effect. In the following essay, I will discuss about both views.

On the one hand, with the introduction of newer and better versions of current technologies, the older models would become cheaper. For example, almost everyone owns an iron, washing machine or a mobile phone even if they are not the latest models with the best options. Also, due to the internet being accessible everywhere, online shopping facilities, e-learning opportunities and social networking sites have no discrimination and are accessible by both the affluent and the poor and therefore decreases the gap between the wealthy and the poor.

However, On the other hand, certain cutting edge innovations may not be available to everyone due to their costs.  For instance, certain medical diagnostic scans like MRI and certain anticancer drugs, as well as organ transplants are very costly and inaccessible to the poor, whereas the wealthy people just have to spend a portion of their income to access these treatments and become healthy. Poor people, nevertheless, have to spend all of their expenses on conventional treatments and yet there is no guarantee that their condition will improve.

To conclude, most of the current innovations decrease the gap between the affluent and the poor, while certain developments make society more polarized. In my opinion, in the near future, most of the technologies would continue to be affordable by everyone regardless of their economic status.

prompt: Some people believe that time spent on television, video and computer games can be beneficial to children. Others believe this has negative effects on the child. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
In recent years, leisure time spent by the younger generation has become debatable. Some individuals share the opinion that time spent on activities such as watching television, playing video or computer games can be profitable while others are of the opinion that these activities causes more harm than good. I am of the latter opinion. This essay will discuss both views as well as state the effects of these activities on the younger generation.

On the one hand, individuals are of the view that time spent on activities like television, video and computer games are beneficial mainly because these activities keep the youths occupied during their leisure time. The belief is that instead of younger peers joining bad gangs and associating with the wrong crowd they would rather benefit from such activities. Take for instance, a high school student after the dayâs activities join friends in smoking and drinking instead of going home and enjoying a TV show. Thus, itâs believed that such activities keeps the younger generation occupied. In addition, these activities relaxes the mind and body. According to a research carried out by the famous Dr Odumosu Bunmi in the early â80s which suggested that children are likely to excel in school activities, if they engage in activities at home that relaxes the mind and body such as watching TV shows or playing games.

However, despite these undeniable benefits I am of the opinion that the cons outweighs the pros. The main reason for this is addiction. Young individuals these days get addicted to such great activities. A research was published by the National Health Institution in 2017. This showed that about 80% of youths are addicted to both video games as well as computer games and about 20% to television. Furthermore, these activities makes the youth very lazy. They would rather than help their society or communities and parents, watch or play video games. These cons have overshadowed the benefits of these activities.

Overall, while there are great benefits such as relaxing the mind and body and occupying time, there are also great consequences. prompt: Some people think that in order to improve the quality of education, high school students should be encouraged to evaluate and criticize their teachers, but other people maintain that such evaluation and criticism may cause loss of respect for teachers and discipline. What do you think?
essay:
It is obvious that education plays an indispensable role in shaping future of each individual and the society. Whether students should have the right to make evaluation and criticism towards their teachers has become an intense debate. I am of the opinion that while evaluating may be beneficial for learning experience, it is crucial to maintain the assessment to a respectful and constructive degree.

On the one hand, allowing students to evaluate their teachers can bring certain benefits. One of those is promoting the student-centered teaching method, which is highly appreciated in todayâs education. As students have the chance to provide feedbacks, the teachers also have the opportunities to gain more valuable insights into their teaching as well as realizing areas which they have to improve. Moreover, constructive criticism fosters a collaborative learning environment. By having positive communication, both studying and teaching experience will be substantially enhanced.

Nevertheless, it is worth noting that there are also a few potential drawbacks may occur. This approach can lead to the loss of respect between students and teachers. Reverence and collaborative attitude are necessary in conversation of evaluation. If those are not ensured, it will result in a disrespectful and inefficient learning environment. Furthermore, a number of alternative approaches can be implemented in order to prevent unwanted consequences, namely peer evaluation, professional development programs. By doing this, not only avoiding the loss of respect but also addressing teacher performance issues.

To recapitulate, while allowing students to criticize their teachers may contribute to a better academic quality, it is vital to strike the balance to maintain efficiency and reverence during the learning progress.

prompt: Some people think that in order to continue improving the quality of high school education, students should be encouraged to evaluate and criticize their teachers. Others, however, believe that this would result in the loss of respect and dignity for teachers. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
High school education always plays a significant role in people's life. There has arisen a heated debate about whether students should be give evaluation and criticism about their teachers for better education quality.

Those who support students' right to evalugate and criticize their teachers may claim that students' feedback can help teacher improve teaching. Understandably, there is a significant variations in each teacher's performance, sometimes even an experienced teacher will make some mistakes. Students giving constructive opinions to their teachers can help them be aware of the weaknesses in their teaching and make necessary improvements. A further argument is that teachers can develop better relations with their students who like to express criticism. Students who think they have some say in the quality of education they reveive will also engage more activily in class.

However, there is an opposite view that allowing students to evaluate and criticize their teachers may encourage disrespenctful behaviours towards teachers. If some students publicly and bluntly criticise their teachers, such as posting unkind remarks on social media complaining about their classes. As a result, their teachers will be offended losing authority and control their students. What is more, if students are premitted to freely disturb their teachers at class, pointing teachers' mistakes, then the class will be disrupted, resulting in other students being distracted and poor learning effects of all students. 

My opinion is that there is truth in both views. Affording students freedom to evaluate and crisitize their teachers can help improve teaching and motivate learning. However, it will also cause problems of teachers feeling disrespected and class being disrupted. Given these potential problems, it is important that schools create opportunities for students to give feedback on their teachers and classes, such as doing regular surveys and also make proper rules to discourage disruptive and disrespectful behaviors of particular students.

prompt: Some people think that in order to continue improving the quality of high school education, students should be encouraged to evaluate and criticize their teachers. Others, however, believe that this would result in the loss of respect and dignity for teachers. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Some people argue that to improve the teaching standards of a school, students are urged to provide feedback to their teachers, while others say that this might create indiscipline and might be regarded as disrespectful. I believe that allowing pupils to provide feedback to the tutor is unacceptable. 

On the one hand, some institutions encourage their students to encourage and criticise their teachers, so that they can determine the strengths and weaknesses of those tutors. Since students are the ones who have the most access to teachers, they are the best options for the schools to draw an insight of how they can improve their education, and the school can assess the academic staff from different criteria such as punctuality, teaching quality and interaction. For instance, I am an example of this, my school always handed out an evaluation form at the end of the semester for the scholars to provide feedback regarding the study contents, and evaluate how those teachers deliver the contents.

On the other hand, schools should not ask their students to fill in the evaluation forms, as they do not have the qualification to provide feedback or criticise the tutors. The academy principals and their recruitment team know best which candidates are the best fit for the institute, and the recruitment team went through several rounds of interviews to choose the best candidates to ensure that they can improve  their learning facilities. In addition, since students at this age are still growing physically and mentally, therefore, they often use their emotions to decide, rather than focusing on the details. For instance, a study conducted by the University of London shows that high school students are very emotional due to changes in their hormones. Thus, their emotions influence their decision-making.

In conclusion, although giving feedback to their tutor can provide insights on how the institutions can do better, the students are not the right judgment in this case, as they do not have the quality to criticise and their emotions often lead to their decision-making outcome.

prompt:

Recently, thanks to the influence of  globalization, the phenomenon of students are allowed to express their opinions on teachers' performance has aroused concerns among various circles. Although there are compelling arguments in favor of making a criticism would impact the conduct of students, I concur with the view that making criticism on a teacher's performance can bring more positive effects.

Of all the reasons why criticism could bring negative impacts, probably the most significant one is that not only should educational schools teach students on academic subjects, but also teach them to be all-rounded individuals. According to Confucianism, it is of paramount importance that pupils should always respect their mentors by all means. Worse still, students would not listen to their teachers anymore, that in turn would lead to misconduct behaviour or even violence, due to the loss of discipline.

Despite the aforementioned negative effects of making comments to the teachers, I am personally of the opinion that it could facilitate the learning progress of students. Regarding the roles of a teacher, they are responsible to understand the needs of every student and, hence, develop individualized learning materials for students to make their own answers in their assignments. By giving feedback on the teaching performance of teachers from students, as a result, teachers can able to modify their teaching styles or plans in a bid to improve the student learning process. For example, most of the students are required to fill out the evaluation form regarding the teaching material, in different high schools, in order to improve the educational quality of the classroom to better examination results. And therefore, by having appropriate feedback from students, the teaching quality can be effectively improved.

To summarise, although making criticism on teachers' performance may lead to student misconduct behaviour, it is of uttermost significance that this could enhance the teaching quality of a school in an efficient way. It is hoped that this topic could be made worldwide in order to increase  public awareness.

prompt: Many people argue that in order to improve educational quality, high school students are encouraged to make comments or even criticism on their teachers. Other thinks it will lead to loss of respect and discipline in the classroom. Discuss both views

prompt: Some people think the main benefit of international cooperation is in the protection of the environment, while others think that the main benefits are in the world business. Discuss both views and give your opinion.

prompt: In the past, people stored knowledge in books. Nowadays people stored knowledge on the Internet. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
Today's, cutting-edge technologies change human being life significantly. subsequently, This matter affects storing way of books. Although some communities believe that e-book destroys the nature of the book, others think that this technology gives a new and better meaning to the book. In this essay merits and demerits of both points of view will be discussed.

New tools and inventions in the last century, give people improved methods to store data like text. This way of storage is more intelligent because we can transport these very easily. To illustrate, the transportation of 1000 reports in the past was a really huge work to be done but now we can move them on a CD. Moreover, disasters such as war, flood, earthquake, and fire could destroy libraries and consequently millions of reports in a fraction of a second. To clarify, keeping bills on hard disks is safer. In addition, using hard disks for storing statements eliminate neccecety of cutting trees to write  books. 

On the other hand, from the readers' point of view, reading bills on paper is more comfortable. for example, they claim that e-book affects human eye health. Additionally, they say electronic books do not have the same good feeling as paper books. Also, researches show that concentrating on a subject is more when you read it on paper.

In conclusion, like other technologies, keeping reports on hard disks or reading them on the screen has both negative and positive sides. However, I think its advantages are more than its advantages.

prompt: In the past, people stored knowledge in books. Nowadays people store knowledge on the internet. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantage?
essay:
It is hard to deny that the internet is still a new-born technology compared to paper and books which have existed for hundreds of years. Such a fact leads impressionable people to generate the opinion that keeping knowledge on the internet has many drawbacks. However, as far as economy, environment and educational standards are concerned, I strongly hold that we benefit more from information that is put on the internet. 

First and foremost, storing knowledge on the internet could increase public educational standards as information can be spread more easily over the internet. To be more specific, you can store as much as information you want on the internet and all of it can be checked on any electronic device as long as it is accessible to the internet, there is no constraint on location or time. While the more knowledge is contained in a book, the thicker and heavier it will be. And people can only access the knowledge in that book if they buy or borrow it. Thus, it would be much more convenient to share and spread knowledge through the internet as people are more willing to store and access information on the internet.  

Furthermore, the fact that keeping information on the internet does not require the use of paper indicates that it is very eco-friendly. Take the case of my friend as an example, who shifted the way of studying last year. Starting from then, he made all his notes on a laptop and read electronic books instead of real books. As a result, his personal consumption of paper has declined by over 95%. Therefore, storing knowledge on the internet enables people to reduce their usage of paper, which could save large amounts of water in paper production as well as prevent deforestation to some extent. 

However, a voice arises that storing information on the internet prevents poor people from accessing knowledge as they might find it hard to afford electronic devices. This viewpoint ignores the reality that smart phones have already become a necessity in our every life. People who is not able to buy these devices would also face difficulties in purchasing books or other forms of learning. Besides, once people have their own devices, they can attain all of knowledges in the internet, which saves large amounts of money to buy books every year. Therefore, accessing knowledge through internet could in fact be a more economical option. 

In conclusion, I believe the whole society could be influenced by the online conservation of knowledge in a positive way.

prompt: In the past, people stored knowledge in books. Nowadays people store knowledge on the Internet. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:

Although storing information in books is preferred by some people, I strongly believe that storing knowledge online will be more beneficial.  This essay will highlight those views and reasons behind my thoughts.

On the one hand, some people argue that storing information or knowledge on paper has its own merits. They are likely to love the smell of paper and the texture when they read. Those who prefer carrying books to searching online tend to think it has the value of owning a book. Also, those who love books love to collet them as a hobby. It reflects personal tastes and choice.

Nevertheless, storing knowledge on in the Internet has plenty of positives which allow people to store information permanently.

Unlike paper, online information does not require any physical or chemical maintenance work to preserve it for a long time. It even does not disappear for good. For example, back in the past, we have been through a tremendous loss of valuable and historical books due to the terrible accidents such as war, fire, or natural disaster. In this regard, people are aware of the significance of storing information safely and permanently. 

Moreover, online information or knowledge is accessible by everyone and everywhere. All we need to do is just searching the Internet to look for the information that we want rather than going to book shop or libraries. It allows us to save physical time and effort to travel and get it.  Even though I need a particular knowledge, it is available anytime and anywhere if there is connection with Internet. This easy accessibility to knowledge can enable us to improve the quality of life.

In conclusion, those beauties of storing knowledge or information on the Internet makes it possible to live more convenient and effective world.

prompt: Some people think scientific research should focus on solving world health problems. Others think that there are more important issues. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:

However, some people hold a belief that scientists should turn their focus to more urgent problems. From my perspective, both notions come with some noticeable merits, which will be discussed in the following essay.

To shed light on the benefits of concentrating on other issues across the globe, an improvement to the world ecosystem should be mentioned. For instance, as global warming is currently a devastating obstacle for the destructive effect that it caused on the surrounding environment, the fauna and flora will be ensured better living conditions if governments choose to invest in solving it. This decision will not only recover the biological circle but also maintain the diversity of wildlife, which contains many unfolded mysteries for a potential breakthrough in future scientific research. Thus, making the previously mentioned statement a worthwhile initiative to consider.

On the other hand, pouring time and money into resolving global health problems plays a threshold role in allowing safety for another research to be proceeded. To be more specific, a number of innovative experiments contain dangerous substances that pose a threat to scientistâs survivability. Additionally, society will also benefit from these developments since remedies for incurable diseases will definitely be in top priority. Take cancers as a prime example, our orbit has been suffering from this illness for centuries, making an effective antidote the ultimate outcome that the current era needs. Because of this aforementioned importance, I personally believe the merits that further analysis of health issues will eclipse that of other important troubles. 

To reiterate, although both ideas provide concrete evidence about why they should have more privilege, the benefits that solving health problems will utterly outweigh the opposite opinion in terms of significance toward the general public.

In conclusion, manifesting an observation on other fields might be beneficial to solve the world hunger yet public health ought to be the major attention to tackle some of the deadly viruses like coronavirus, variola, or Ebola.

prompt: Fewer young people choose to work in farming. What are the reasons? Should young people be encouraged to do farming work?
essay:
It is true that there is a declining number of young people who opt to work in the field of agriculture. There are a number of reasons for this, and I believe that the idea of whether to encourage more of the young to do farming work should depend on the goals of each country.

Two main factors are to blame for the shift away from farming among the young generation in many parts of the world. Chief of these is the adoption of machinery in farming activities. In fact, most labor intensive tasks in farming are now done by machines such as trucks, forklifts, automatic sprinklers, and even airplanes. This means that fewer workers are needed to run a farm. Added to this is the fact that the income of farmers is notoriously unstable due to the unpredictability of weather conditions. As a result, more young people are moving to cities to look for jobs with more stable streams of income rather than doing farm work.

There are countries that should incentivize young people to do farming work more, while others should not. Regarding the former, if these countries wish to become independent regarding their food supplies or if agriculture is the key sector driving their economies, they should encourage more of their young to get involved in farming. However, as for countries that wish to develop other sectors such as science, technology or tourism, there is little point in having more young people involved in agricultural activities. Instead, they should be encouraged to develop their skills and gain knowledge related to the target driving forces of the country. 

In conclusion, the main causes of the waning popularity of farming work among the young are primarily the adoption of machinery in farming and the unstable nature of such jobs. I feel that it depends on each country to decide whether to motivate more of their young citizens to work in this field.

prompt: It is argued that the parents of children who break the rules should be punished in some ways as parents are responsible for the children's actions. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

In conclusion, even though parents are responsible for their childrenâs offences, the lawbreakers ought to be solely answerable for their crimes. Therefore, I strongly believe that children should be punished according to the justice system.

prompt: In recent time economic growth has made some people richer in both developed and developing countries. While studies show that people in developing countries are happier now than before, people in developed countries are no happier than they were before.
