 Discuss both opinions and give your own opinion.
essay:
It is commonly thought that schools are the main educational place for teaching students how to recycle materials; other opinions express that the family environment has to educate to recycle properly.
Schools are considered as the first educational background in our society, so for this reason teachers cover an important part: they have to teach from common subjects, such as geography and history, to the introduction of everyday topics in our daily life, as recycling. This phenomenon has been discussed a lot during this decade and it is fair that teachers speak about this argument with their pupils in order to learn how to treat our environment. Furthermore, it is a possibility to inform children, how much recycling is an important action in our society.
On the other hand, families have to be a good role model for their children and consequently parents should start to show them how to recycle from the earliest stages of their lives.
I believe that both of these two environments have a key aspect in teaching how to avoid waste: first of all, they are the main two backgrounds where the youngest spend their time. As a consequence, each educator is responsible for an adequate education as regards recycling. Secondly, if they do not cooperate together, children will not be motivated to recycle then.
Teachers and parents should discuss about a specific project in order to introduce pupils to such a delicate argument as the environmental sustainability together with the positive impacts that will create if everyone respects nature in our everyday life.
Teachers could introduce leisure activities during the lessons, like quizzes and games that teach how to recycle, while parents should buy the right containers for recycling every material at home.
In conclusion, educational institutions and families have the same level of importance for teaching to children how to recycle. These environments should introduce daily habits and fun activities in order to offer a deep knowledge about avoiding to waste materials along with a reliable role model to follow in the future.

prompt:
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.
 Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay:
Many people consider that it is important for children to learn art at school, however, there are others who opine that it is totally a wastage of student's study time. In my opinion, art is certainly as important as any other subjects because it helps younger children in learning history and in expressing themselves.

On the one hand, art is considered a useful skill as it allows children to learn about the history and cultural heritage of their nation. It is a well-known fact that the children better learn through images than text, therefore teachers use various art pieces to explain them many historical events. According to a survey, it was found that children who learned the story through snapshots were able to retain that information for longer duration as compared to others. Additionally, children learn to express themselves via creativity. Art helps children in communicating many concepts which they otherwise find difficult to explain.

On the other hand, many people believe that art is not an important subject to be taught at school because it does not add any value to their profile as other subjects such as math and science does. Simple mathematics calculations are always used in later stages of life, so it is important to learn the math at school level, but this is not the case with Art. Moreover, art does not help children in finding a job when they reach adulthood. This skill is not given much weightage by any employer.

In conclusion, art may not help children in getting a good job or may not be used in practical life when they reach adulthood, but in childhood it helps children immensely by encouraging them to learn about their culture.

prompt: Some people think that art is essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time. Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay:
There is an opinion that studying art in schools is one of the fundamentals, meanwhile there are those who disagree and consider that teaching art is loss of time. In this essay, I will discuss both sides of the argument and then I will give my own opinion.

On the one side of the argument are those who believe that a schoolâs curriculum should include the art as one of the compulsory disciplines. This is because one of the crucial milestones in a childâs development is evolving creativity and a non-standard approach to solving problems.  While learning the art is a great tool stimulating a creation process.  For instance, the youngsters drawing on a daily basis have well-developed imagination and ability to express emotions through creation. 

On the other side, there are people, who argue that the subject of art is necessary at school; by contrast, these individuals assume that studying it is meaningless activity. Nowadays, there are more important subjects to focus on at school, especially, exact sciences such as biology, chemistry, physics and mathematics. The main reason of it is that the humanity required much more high-teach engineers, qualified doctors and other STEM specialities. Thus, concentrating on the deepest teaching of a hard science will probably encourage the younger generation to choose this path for their careers. 

However, in my opinion, despite the fact that STEM specialists in a high demand in modern society, I believe that the art is one of the core disciplines. Owing to the fact that the art creation boost a personâs imagination and it is understood that engineers should be able to look at ordinary things from a different angle. 

In conclusion, both sides have their merits. On balance, however, I consider that it is necessary for an educational program to include art as one of the essentials.

prompt: Some people think that secondary school children should study international news as one of the school subjects. Other people think that it is a waste of valuable school time. What do you think? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
Having studied abroad, I strongly agree that learning international news should be made mandatory in secondary schools. This is because general grasp of global knowledge is vital in improving communication while overseas. These international news can also be used as precedent studies and even lessons for students to reflect upon.

Studying abroad is slowly becoming a norm, particularly for students who graduated from secondary school. Therefore, basic grasp of general knowledge about other countries are essential, in which the easiest way to acquire them are through international news. Every individual arriving at a new country would want to instil a sense of belonging and be accustomed to the local culture. When I first arrived in Australia from Singapore, I often used international news as conversation starters with my coursemates. I received good impressions and were therefore warmly welcomed by my fellow Australian mates. After all, being familiar with the foreign countryâs affairs is a significant sign of an individualâs willingness to integrate with the local community.

Moreoever, students can extract abundance of lessons from international news alone, be it a positive or negative aspiration. To illustrate, students from a rote learning education system can draw inspiration and knowledge from countries that offered alternative pedagogy methods such as vocational or elite sports school. In addition, secondary school students are at the critical age group where every moment is the deciding factor of their future. If these teenagers can learn from other countriesâ goods and bads and apply the lessons well, then the countryâs future is in safe hands of their youth.

To conclude, the claims of international news subject in secondary schools as a waste of time is preposterous. This is because students need these knowledge not only to bridge the communication gap with other countries, but also to reflect and apply the lessons for the betterment of everyone.

prompt:
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it a waste of time.
Discuss both sides and give your opinion
essay:
There is no doubt that art education can play a vital role in the overall development of a child. Although some believe that including art in their curriculum is not worth their time. I would argue that it is a necessary subject that enhances the learning experience.
On the one hand, those who believe(think) studying(learning) art is time-consuming and worthless might argue that it does not lead to a successful career. This is because many artists struggle to make a living. For instance, a painter may find it troublesome selling a single piece of his art. In contrast, if the same time is utilized for learning other more important subjects at school, it will likely result in a fruitful profession such as medicine, engineering, law or architecture.
 
On the other hand, my view is that it is imperative to teach art at this stage because it imparts(communicate) different life skills. The reason for this is that by practicing arts children can develop skills like patience, improved motor ability, eye-hand coordination, creative thoughts and many more. Hence, if these skills are not taught at school, it may hinder the overall development of children.
In conclusion, while it is true that teaching art at school may seem to be a worthless and time-consuming pursuit, it is my firm belief that the time spent on it will foster life skills crucial for success in the future.

prompt:
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.
Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay:
The inclusion of the subject of Arts in the school's curriculum has been a controversial topic. While some people believe that adding this is futile, others believe that teaching Arts are crucial and should be taught in the school. This essay will shed light on both the views and put forward reasons why I agree with the latter view.

To begin with, one of the reasons why people argue that the Arts should be excluded is that this will be a burdensome task for the children. This is because the syllabus of other subjects is so vast that tutors often struggle to complete it in the allotted time. For instance, the schools usually run only for 6 hours a day, where the entire time is occupied in teaching subjects like Math, Science, History and Languages. Another reason is that people fear that this might digress students from focusing on  other important STEM subjects. This means that performance in other subjects will get impacted.

Nevertheless, there are also benefits of teaching Arts at the institution. One of the merit is that students learn how to express themselves. There are various forms of art which helps students discover their in-borne talents and abilities. To illustrate,  singing unleashes emotions and paintings demonstrates imaginations and creativity put down on a paper. Besides this, some forms of art offer great career opportunities. This means that if any student shows interest in any form of art, this can pave the path to build a career out of it. Needless to say, today the artist in the film industry, especially in India, is as successful as any other profession.

In conclusion, although the incorporation of teaching Arts subject in the school burdens the students and poses a risk of diversion, the identification of unique abilities and prospect of bright career is of more eminence. Therefore, I opine that this subject should be a part of teaching module.

prompt:
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.
Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay:
Although art is recognized as a versatile subject around the world, there are people who think that it is important subject for children at school, others argue that it is a waste of their time. I agree with former argument that art is impeccable for holistic mind growth in children.
On the one hand, it is often argued that there is no tangible benefit of studying arts. This is because there are very limited career prospects for people who study arts. For example, people with a qualification in arts often find it difficult to secure a job which is permanent and well paid. In contrast, people with a credential in other disciplines such as business, engineering or medical, conveniently find jobs which are not only permanent and well paid but also recognized highly in the society.  
On the other hand, I would disagree that since art is a useless subject because it does not offer a well awarded career. Teaching art at school level is essential for a holistic mind growth in children. Art allows children to not only explore their creativity but also enable them to express their ideas and emotions. This not only improve their communication skills but also enhance their emotional quotient which helps them substantially later in their future careers.
In conclusion, while other peopleâs opinions may vary, I think that art plays an inevitable role in the overall mindset development of children which helps them to enhance their communication skills and emotional quotient for their future challenges. Therefore, art should be taught to children at school.

prompt: Some people claim that many things that children are taught at school are a waste of time. Other people argue that everything that children study at school is useful at sometime. Discuss the both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Some people in the society state that the knowledge and skills developed by children taught process are completely squandered at the time of their education. While, others disagree with this statement by saying that the way of thinking is pivotal to their higher education which helps them in future. This essay intends to analyse both perspectives. Personally, I think every lesson we learnt from our school is a  foundation to our vocation.

Nowadays, there are  lot of extracurricular activities in the school curriculum that include sports and cultural activities. Because of these, students are not only involving in lectures but also participating in those events. Owing to all, these are responsible to increasing the knowledge and thinking abilities of the children. But in some educational institutions, they are only preferring sports ratherthan studies which causing lot of time wasting for them.

On the other hand, everything that children studied from the school are useful to them in their academics. Furthermore, if we want to compete with this global education, our ideas that gained from our knowledge are very important. For instance, in certain educational institutions, it is necessary to complete aptitude and reasoning courses from secondary education onwards which helps them to achieve good scores in any competitive exams.

To sum up with, I reiterate my statement by saying that each and every concept that children studied in the school are useful to developing the way of approach to any situation .

prompt: Some people say that economic growth is the only way to end hunger and poverty, while others say that economic growth is damaging the environment so it must be stopped. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay:
While few individuals have arguably put forward the statement that economic broadening is the only solution to put a halt to hunger and penury. Although, another group suggest that this growth will have a negative impact on the environment. The following essay will decipher both the viewpoints of this argument and outline my opinion.

On one hand, A country's gross domestic product (GDP), since it is linked with the economic widening, if improved, can lead to a decline in famine and poverty. Although a lot of factors contribute to the economic success of a country for example, if a person gets a quality education, it will lead to the self-advancement of that individual which in turn can be aligned towards the developing the economy by creating value through productivity like manufacturing and sale goods, services, etc. As a result ,this  will lead to a better standard of living for an individual and increased purchasing power which in turn saves he/her from sufferings like poverty.

On the other Flank, adverse effects can be reflected by economic development. for instance, in a recent ,study it was highlighted that due to increased purchasing power and living, a vast majority of people have occupied a lot of land, food, etc. which in turn creates a depletion of resources.furthermore because of the rapid growth, companies that have shared this growth have started deteriorating  nature through the release of harmful gases and pollutants from big industrial factories. this all makes the government officials as well the general public  rethink  the economic widening.

Having discussed the dichotomy, what I opine is that economic development is essential. As if an economy improves a lot of suffering can be mitigated. Although there are few worse effects that give a  bad reputation for this growth,  still it leads a country towards innovation.

To sum up, it can be rightly reiterated that economic growth is vital even though the demerits of this exist it should be considered equally and improving the lives of individuals will lead to prosperity and happiness instead of starvation.

prompt: Some people say that economic growth is the only way to end hunger and poverty, while others say that economic growth is damaging the environment so it must be stopped. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Some masses admit that economic development is the only solution to eliminate world's poverty and hunger. While, other believe that economic revolution is demolishing the environment and should be stopped. In my opinion, economic growth is the better for any country's overall development and it helps to prevent poverty and hunger by generating employment opportunties. I shall discuss both the views further in the subsequent paragraphs.

To begin with, some people think that there is only one way left to eradicate the poverty and hunger by doing economic progress. Firstly, economic enhancement creates more jobs for people in the country. Due to this, they can easily afford their expenses and stay away from poverty and hunger. Secondly, profits made by the corporations who are responsible for this financial growth will be converted into the financial benefits to be enjoyed by the straving and needy. 

On the contrary, there are countless examples to support this view that economic growth results in environmental destruction. To increase the industrialisation in the developing countries, many lowland rainforests have been cleared and plethora of unsustainable agriculture practice introduced to produce cash crops for export. What is more, there are many factories  developing in countries to increase the international trade and it also enhance air pollution, which damages the enviornment at extreme level. For instance, continued use of fossil fuels, which provide energy for growing industrialisation, is causing global warming. It can lead to a rise in sea level, which will make millions of people in Bangladesh homeless.

To recapitulate, i would like to opine that economic growth must not be stopped unless, it is based on damaging the environment.

prompt: Some people say that economic growth is the only way to end hunger and poverty, while others say that economic growth is damaging the environment so it must be stopped. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
While the developed economy is believed as the sole solution for the alarming status of hunger and poverty. It is also considered as the main cause of environmental destruction. In this essay, both views will be discussed and from my perspective, I strongly agree with the former statement.

On one hand, economic growth enriches the budget for society. As a result, those unlucky people can give more support such as food or money. That helps them a lot in improving their daily life. In addition, developed economy has the high demand in the number of employees. In other words, providing a huge amount of jobs which would reduce the unemployment state. Thus, the poor now not only get job but also have chance to change their life.

On the other hand, increase in the number of factories is an evitable consequence of economic growth. That causes harm to the environment because factories are the main source of exhausted emission and other kinds of contaminated trash. Polluted air, water and soil are the outstanding examples for environmental damage by the factories. Moreover, to expand the industrial area aiming to serve the development of economy, forest will be destroy to make use of land. That leads to series of negative effects such as increase in the amount of CO2 in the atmosphere, green house effect,â¦

In conclusion, the developed economy brings both pros and cons. In details, the positive results in eliminating hunger and poverty. In contrast, negative consequences on the environment. However, I suppose we should take advantage of growth economic rather than reject it. Even we can apply it in protecting the environment.

prompt: Some people say that economic growth is the only way to end hunger and poverty, while others say that economic growth is damaging the environment so it must be stopped. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
In the contemporary world, more than half of the population is suffering from hunger and poverty. Some people are saying that the rapid growth of the economic development is the only way to end this situation while others are arguing that this should be stopped immediately as itâs destructing the environment. Following essay will discuss both aspects of this argument and outline my opinion on this matter.
To begin with, economic boost shows a certain countryâs wealth, hence itâs really important for everyone in the country.. Proliferation of economic growth will mitigate unemployment, hence it will boost peopleâs standards of living. For example, most of the developing countries are suffering from hunger and poverty, the only way to diminish this problem is that the authorities should take necessary actions to bring up the countryâs economy up to a standard where no one can suffer without having basic necessities.
On the other hand, rapid growth of a nation could bring detrimental impacts to the environment. For instance, waste comes out from industrial zones increases greenhouse gas emission which will be a direct impact to the global warming. Contemporary climate change situations throughout the globe is one good example of this state therefore this should be stopped.
In conclusion, even though the tremendous commercial boost can end hunger and poverty of a nation, I strongly believe that the governments should take necessary steps to minimize or prevent side effects which could happen along with this as that is how a country can protect the environment while improving their economy up.

prompt: Some people believe that the best way to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other private vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In recent years, climate change is one of the environmental problems. some people insist that increasing the price of fuel for private vehicles can assist solving this problem. I partially agree, rising price can help reducing people to utilize their private transportation, however, the most important is how the government provides reliable public transportation so people would be more interested to use and help solving the environmental issues. In this essay, I will examine all the relevant arguments based on factual premises.

It can be argued that increasing the fee of fuel can cease people to utilize their cars, however, increased fuel prices might not significantly reduce consumption because of the lack of alternatives in transport. Moreover, it will create new problem especially for low-income individuals who rely on vehicles to comute everyday. Therefore, increasing the cost without improving public trasportation is not the best solution.

prompt:
People think that government should increase the cost of fuel for cars and other 

vehicles to solve environmental problems. Give your opinion.
essay:
it is believed that government should increase the price of fuel for cars and other vehicles to tackle environmental issues. In my opinion, I partly agree with this point and give some reason for this.

on the one hand, it is undeniable that, the consumption of fuel for private vehicles has become increasingly large which leads to a huge number of carbon dioxide emitted into the environment. This makes a direct impact on human health and especially the atmosphere where humans and animals reside.  Therefore, increasing the cost of fuel can be the one solution to address this environmental problem. People will limit their need in utilizing their personal vehicles that required fuel. Instead, people have the tendency to commute by public transportation and take advantage of their car to travel to work if the distance is not too far or use a vehicle that consumes renewable or economical energy such as a electric car, or motorbike. In recent years,  some corporates have launched some kinds of vehicles that use renewable resources for example electric motorbikes and cars to encourage people to protect the environment. For example, in Vietnam, Vinfast have had a line of electric cars and motorbikes that are supported and used on a large scale of Vietnam. This is a good signal for the bright future of zero gas emissions in Vietnam.

On the other hand, the increase in the price of fuel makes it tough for some people that have low and medium incomes. This  can be a burden on their shoulders when they mainly rely on these gasoline vehicles to work and have no choice for another option. When the cost of fuel rise, they are the most vulnerable ones and have barely enough sum of money to pay for it for  an extended period. Therefore government also take it into consideration and issue the best resolution for this problem.

In conclusion, while increasing the cost is considered to be the way to mitigate the environmental issue, however, there are some circumstances that should be affected by this trend.

prompt:
Some people think the best way to solve global environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel. 

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
At one point in time, the government tried to solve global environmental problems by way of increasing the cost of diesel and petrol. While some people argue that it is an efficient way to solve environmental issues, I believe this effort is not the best solution for the environmental problem based on the following reasons.

Firstly, increasing fuel costs is not an efficient way to combat environmental pollution. This is because, by increasing the costs of fuel, people still be able to choose other means of transportations to travel such as trains and buses. It doesnât deter or decrease the use of transportation which ultimately will still contribute to pollution. 

On the other hand, there are other ways that can contribute to resolving the issues. One of the solutions is to increase taxes for oil and gas companies for drilling oil. With the increment of taxes, it will leave the company with no choice but to shut down drilling projects and stop any oil productions. Secondly, the government can work on providing incentives for the companies who contribute to renewable resources spending.  By providing the incentives on the company annual spending, the company will start exploring other options such as renewable or waste-based energy. 

For instance, organisation like Woodside has started to move away from oil and gas drilling to renewable energy and resources projects after the Australian Government announced the incentive for companies who promote renewable resources spending. 

In conclusion, I reiterate my statement above and disagree that increasing oil prices is the best solution to solve environmental issues. I believe there are other alternatives such as increasing taxes for oil productions and giving out incentives for renewable energy and resources to deal with the issues.

prompt: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve enviromental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay:
At the present time, we are suffering from threats from the environment, clearly seen from air pollution, water pollution and probably more. prompt:
Some experts suggest people a method to solve the environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel and all vehicles.
To what extent do you agree with this point? And make comparision where relevant
essay:
It is suggested by experts that the cost of fuels and all vehicles should be increased in response to the increasing severity of environmental problems. As far as I am concerned, I tend to believe this method definitely can benefit the whole society while potential negative influences bring about by this can not be ignored. 

On the one hand, it is obvious that increasing the cost of fuel and all vehicles can resolve the issue of environmental preservation to some extent. Firstly, with the increasing price of fuel, working people who usually drive private cars to commute between workplaces and home will be more likely to take public transport alternately. Therefore, the exhaust gas released by private cars will be reduced, which somehow is a way to respond to air pollution issue. Secondly, the adjustment of car prices will potentially influence individuals' determination on purchasing a car. If they figure out the price of owning a car and additional expense is much more expensive than taking public transport, they would more likely to choose public transport such as trams, and buses, in order to avoid additional expenditure. And as a result, fewer cars running on roads means less exhaust air release.

On the other hand, the disadvantages of increasing fuel costs and vehicles price cannot be ignored. The main reason for this view is that this kind of method will potentially lead people who regarded private cars as a must to experience financial burden, especially for those working individuals who live far away from workplaces and earn low income, as their disposable income is limited. Another reason for this view is that it is a fact that people who owned cars already will still choose to commute by car if the adjusted fuel price is still affordable. As they have already gotten used to commuting by car and insist on it, and as a result, it does not make any difference to this group of people

To sum up, I tend to believe this method is a feasible solution in response to air pollution. However,  some people will disadvantage from it and other appropriate methods such as subsidising people to take public transport and hybrid cars users would probably be an alternative in responding to this topic.

prompt: People think that government should increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles to solve environmental problems. Give your opinion.
essay:
It is widely believed that nobody can deny that one solution to environmental problems would be for the government to raise the price of petrol. To a certain extent, I agree that this measure would be effective. However, I also believe that other measures might have an even better impact.

If states raised taxes on petrol, this would deal with two environmental concerns. First of all, regarding private vehicles, drivers would limit the number and length of their journeys due to hesitation in paying increasing expense. Simultaneously, national authorities would introduce the upgrading and expansion of public transportation, so that people could conveniently travel to work, to school or to travel to shops and hospitals, for instance. Moreover, from the freight services perspective, goods and products would have to be distributed from one place to another by rail rather than by truck. Both these mentioned methods contribute to cut down emissions from vehicle and hence help to reduce the greenhouse gases. 

On the contrary, despite the fact that the rise in fuel cost might be an effective stopgap measure, governments could introduce and adopt transport policies or regulations which could be more efficient in long-term period. Take local authorities in London as an example. They introduced a congestion charge on all big vehicles visiting the city centre. The money raised from this policy are used to subsidize the cost of fares and to enhance transport infrastructure. This, in turn has remarkably decreased exhaust fumes, and as a result improved the air quality in the city. Furthermore, introducing and encouraging the use of electric vehicles which could greatly reduce the pollution level, and help to combat global warming. 

In conclusion, increasing petrol cost would be a useful environmental-friendly transport measure, although in long term other methods would have more influence.

prompt: ; Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuels for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The past 50 years have seen a dramatic increase in the occurrence of environmental problems. Some individuals claim that this issue could be solved by raising the cost of fuel. While I partly agree with this statement, I do believe that there are many other ways to deal with this issue, instead of looking at only one aspect of the problem.

To begin with, it is an indisputable fact that after the industrial revolution, the number of car factories  increased. As a result, nowadays, the air is adversely affected by  car exhaust gases which cause a harsh climate. To explain, these gases contain a huge amount of toxic substances, chief among them is Co2. To illustrate, Tehran- the capital of Iran- is a salient example of a polluted city. I suggest that by raising the pay for gasoline and petroleum, presumably, people tend to use less their private cars. Nonetheless, reaching this aim needs pivotal infrasturactions like a good public transportation system as well as implementation such cultivation as car/bike-sharing schemes.

Equally importantly, the Earth suffer from some other problems more than just weather issues. Firstly, in recent days, more and more pollutants are discharged into the oceans. Thus, the lives of marine animals have become under threat of extinction. A salient instant is mass-stranding  in whales. Secondly, another major contributing factor is nature challenges. To explain, it might have been seen that more woodlands are recently destroyed by builders to build more houses and villas.

By way of conclusion, I once again reaffirm my position that whereas increasing the expense of fuel can be beneficial for the sake of air pollution,  there are a number of other problems which are pivotal as much as air contamination.

prompt:
Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Nowadays, it is perceived that the effective way to remedy issues relating to the environment is to increase the pump price of gas for vehicles generally. Although some people believe that this move would resolve the environmental crisis, however, I vehemently disagree with that statement. This essay will elaborate that petroleum products such as fuel is not the major cause of climate disasters and increasing the cost price will not yield their intended purpose.

To start with, research has shown that harvesting  trees without replacing them, mining and poor waste management  are the major causes of environmental problems. Besides, if we fail to address  

the aforementioned  causes and concentrate on fuel alone, I am afraid that the situation will be worse in the future. For instance, the government should legislate a law that prohibits the cutting of trees, wrongful disposal of waste and regulate mining companies. Despite the fact that increasing the prices of gas would to some extent aid in protecting the environment, nonetheless, it will not have tremendous a benefit as one may think. 

Moreover, even though an uptrend in the prices of gas to some extent will curb about 10% of environmental problems, that in itself is not sufficient, as it will cause hardship on the people as most of them will resort to other activities such as coal mining which will be detrimental to the environment. To exemplify, in 2021, the authorities in Sierra Leone  increased the cost of fuel from 10,000 Leones to 20,000 Leones per litre in order to discourage vehicle owners from using their cars. Sadly, the transport fare for public transport shot up and the prices of groceries and other goods became a big challenge for its citizens. In addition, curbing fuel in isolation will not be beneficial to the climate. 

In conclusion,  even though some people believe that increasing the cost of fuel for vehicles in my estimation, I totally disagree with that position.

prompt:

  As a starting point, undoubtedly, the situation on our planet is worrying as many specialists urge governments to act expeditiously to contain this problem. Not only we will save our planet if we minimize the carbon dioxide in the atmosphere but also our air will be clean and refreshing. Although, this move requires thinking about other clean resources and how to make them practical for the customers.

prompt: Some people think the governments should increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles in order to solve environmental problems. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The growing world of automobile industry has created several environmental issues, and thus, raised the concerns to hike the fuel prices to combat these problems. In my own perspective, I disagree with this notion of the rise in the petrol or diesel cost.

On the one hand, there is no significant improvement seen in the air quality index from the past strategy of hiking the petrol prices. In fact, raising its costs will put the financial burden on the community, and along with that, it will also increase the price of other essential commodities such as transportation, and food items. Thus, it makes the life of especially poor and middle income families more difficult. However, the other expenditure can be increased in the form of insurance policy, service and maintenance charges, and paid parking spots to limit the number of cars on the highways and roads.

On the other hand, the government should launch some reforms to decrease the emission of carbon footprints and air pollution levels. For instance, the use of the renewable energy resources such as solar, wind and tide should be promoted instead of non renewable products such as coal and petrol. Additionally, the public transportation through trains and buses should be made highly accessible with the frequent timings, issuing the cheaper monthly passes, and the economical ticket prices. Moreover, the use of bicycles for a shorter distance within the cities should be encouraged by making different rider tracks and free parking facilities. 

To recapitulate, I opine that inflating the fuel prices does not make such significant effect on the improvement of air pollution. It requires more sincere efforts in the form of using the biodegradable products, convenient public transportation system, and the bicycles.

prompt: Some people think that the best way to solve environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In recent decades, environmental issues has never failed to draw publicâs attention. Some people stated that a rise in cost of fuel is the only way to improve this problem. From my perspective, increasing in petrol price may be reasonable to some extent; however, this solution remains several drawbacks.

On the one hand, setting a higher cost for fuel will be beneficial in some aspects of alleviating severe pollution problems nowadays. Firstly, the rate of air pollution will improve significantly as the amount of carbon emission decreases. Since people are restricted to traveling by vehicles, they would commute on foot or by bicycles more often, which, in turn, reduces a considerable amount of carbon footprint released per day. Secondly, the solution also assists in preventing the dramatic degradation of renewable resources. As less fuel is consumed, the frequency of exploitation of natural resources will gradually lessen over time, allowing them to renew faster. 

On the other hand, there will doubtlessly occurs some problems when establishing fuel price escalation. It is evident that the decline in petrol consumption will result in a loss of profit for petroleum industry. As the number of fuel consumers decreases, it will be a daunting task for companies to maintain due to the lack of operating expenditure; some may even undergo bankruptcy. Moreover, higher costs of fuel may bring about shrinkage in daily expenses for people, especially those who accommodate in rural areas. Consequently, they will have to cut down on the money spared for other basic needs; hence, their life standard may be negatively impacted.

In conclusion, concerns on the surrounding environment can be mitigated by increasing price of petrol; nevertheless, some existing disadvantages should be taken into great consideration for the sake of a balance society.

prompt:

prompt: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extend do you agree or disagree?

Rather than buying expensive fuel, people will seek for sustainable means of transporting themselves. For instance, means such as electric cars and bicycles that produce little undesirable effects on the environment. As a result, there will be a reduction in the deleterious consequences of climate change.
In conclusion, when the cost of fuel for automobiles is increased, there will be reduction in road congestion and pollution, which will go a long way in solving environmental problems. This will ensure a suitable earth conditions for the future generation.

prompt:
Some people believe that one of the best ways to solve environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. 
You should write at least 250 words
essay:
The number of cars and the usage of fuel is increasing dramatically every day which causes environmental issues. Some argue that if the price of fuel is increased, then the environmental issues can be controlled. I completely disagree with this statement, because this is not a practical solution for all environmental issues.

Few people think the usage of fuel is the main reason for all the environmental problems which may be because of some propaganda. Primarily, the inflated usage of private vehicles leads to the release of carbon monoxide into the air which leads to the greenhouse gas effect as well as gradual global warming. Secondly, the utmost utilisation of natural resources to produce fuels is an irreversible one and it causes irreparable damage to the earth. For example; the amount of coal mines is decreasing exponentially.

On the other hand, the reasons for environmental problem are not only because of  fuel usage but also many others. For instance; water pollution, the construction of large buildings in sensitive areas and deforestation are examples of other causes of environmental issues. So, it is not possible to control environmental pollution only by reducing fuel usage. Despite it is a sum of many activities on different areas of the earth. In addition, if the cost of the fuel increases, people will buy the fuel by giving that price.

In summary, some comment that environmental problems can be controlled by escalating the fuel cost of vehicles. Whereas I entirely disagree with this, because the reduction of fuel usage is not only a reason for all the environmental problems.

prompt: Some people believe that one of the best ways to solve environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
Raising the price of petrol for vehicles and other transportation modes is considered by some people as one of the best ways to solve the environmental problem. I believe there are positives and negatives to this approach which I will analyze in this essay.

First of all, I agree that increasing the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles is one of the best ways to solve the environmental problem, because nowadays there are too many cars running on the roads. Almost everyone has a car and do not like to use public transportation because it is difficult to go to work by bus or metro especially from the suburbs. However, if the government raises the price of petrol and make their public transportation systems more enticing, it will make citizens more likely to utilize it.

There are multiple methods that the government could implement to persuade people to make more use of public transport and stop using their own cars. For example, if people can get a discount for taking public transportation, they will be willing to do it from time to time. The government could also implement and build infrastructure and systems for people to ride their bicycles. If it is convenient for everyone to rent bikes from one place and return to another, it will become more popular for people to use it and will reduce the amount of time they spend driving their cars which will have a positive effect on the environment.

On the other hand, it is not only because of people driving cars and the resultant carbon dioxide emissions that the human-race is having a negative impact on the environment, there are a plethora of other factors which are also contributing to this impact. According to many studies, climate change is caused by many different factors which include(s) making (processing meat) products related to meat, manufacturing factories, agricultural fertilization to grow crops...etc. Therefore, all of these factors and different areas of human activity cause environmental problems which results in climate change.

In conclusion, though there are many issues which contribute to the environmental problem, I believe increasing the price of fuel will have an overall positive effect by encouraging people to utilize different modes of transport and consequently reduce the negative impact on the environment.

prompt: Some people believe that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Green issues have become increasingly popular among some demographics of our society. Some people strongly believe that one of the most efficient ways of resolving such problems would be a significant rise in fuel prices. This essay will discuss that such change could only be a partial resolution. The reasons supporting this opinion will be discussed below. 

To start with, a lot of people consider that if we put up the price of petrol and gas for automobiles, we would end up with a much lower number of vehicles on the streets. This in its turn would lead to cutting the number of exhaust fumes, which admittedly are one of the main reasons for causing environmental dilemmas. Furthermore, in case of high gasoline prices, people not only drive less but will generally travel smart, try to stay closer to home for shopping, combining various errands to be more efficient. And this potentially would reduce an average carbon footprint and contribute to conserving nature. Thua these few instances have bolstered an opinion that upsurge of an upsurge in fuel costs would help to tackle the green issues. 

However, regardless of the benefits above, the idea that environmental challenges could be eradicated only if fuel prices are higher is not completely valid. The rationale behind it is that ecological concerns are caused not only by poisonous car emissions but also by a high number of other factors such as population expansion, pollution of land and water through excessive deforestation, industrialisation and overfilling landfills which emit CO2 and add to greenhouse gas emissions. Therefore, reducing emissions through increasing prices and discouraging people from driving less, will only be an interim solution to the problem. Furthermore, an upsurge in fuel prices will affect transportation-focused industries like airlines and trucking, not only automobiles. Anything that must be shipped or transportedâfrom apples to electronicsâcould cost more as gas prices rise. This is especially true for products, or components for products, that are manufactured overseas. Overall, the idea that increased prices on fuel would resolve the green issues could potentially lead to a far worse outcome for society. 

To conclude, this essay argued that increasing prices on fuel could be only a partial solution to environmental concerns and people who believe the opposite underestimate the real effects of what they believe. In my opinion, solving key issues is vital, however, we should not solely depend on one resolution and try to see more efficient and diverse ways of maintaining the environment clean.

prompt: Crimes committed by young people are increasing in major cities throughout the world. Discuss the causes and how to solve this problem.
essay:
Recently, the number of young people who offend the law is increasing in many big cities. There are many reasons that result in this phenomenon, varying from one country to another. Two main factors and appropriate solutions will be indicated further in the following part of this essay.

To begin with, a negative family environment and pressure from social and school life seem to be two main reasons for the rise of jubilant offenders. Firstly, toxic backgrounds can lead kids to  inappropriate actions that are socially unacceptable or morally wrong. For example, if parents are alcoholics or workaholics and, as a result, they will not spend enough time with their children, kids tend to commit crimes to draw their parentsâ attention. Secondly, due to enormous stress, teenagers commit a felony as a way to get some excitement or feel  control over their life. To illustrate this idea, many youths do vandalism or shoplift useless items just for fun. To sum up, the elevation of youth crimes tends to result from both domestic and social impacts.

To reduce  juvenile delinquency, it is necessary to focus on young peopleâs lives both at home and at school. On the one hand, parents should be considerate by paying more attention to what kids are doing and how they feel. On the other hand, youngsters should be encouraged to learn what they are good at so they can be more confident about their futures. In conclusion, both parents and education staff play an important role to solve the rising number of young law-breakers.

To abridge, the rise of youth crimes can be linked to factors at home and at school. Nevertheless, there are some ways to deal with the apparent problem by focusing on its roots which is why people decided to break the law.

prompt: Some people believe that it is the governmentâs responsibility to provide care and finance to support people after they retire. Others, however, think that individuals themselves should save money in their own when they are old. Discuss both views and give your opinion

prompt: In some parts of the world, it is increasingly popular to research the history of one's own family. Why do people want to do this? Is it a positive or negative development?
essay:
In recent years, family history research has been becoming more popular than it was. In my opinion, I would argue that this trend should be as a positive development.

There are several factors for encouraging the study of our family history. In the first place, curiosity is the main cause that leads to making people intend to dig up about their family traditions. They would desire to know their roots, where our forefathers came from or how they earned their living. In the second place, some people must take in family history because of the fact that they would have health problems and one of them is genetically inheritable medical conditions such as asthma or diabetes. In reality, understand genetic make-up provides an early lifestyle intervention to mitigate the adverse effects of these diseases.

Doing research on family traditions renders countless rewards and this may be an amazing journey which could blows our mind. Firstly, offspring may find it astonishing to dig up the details of their predecessors' lifestyle or some of the achievements that ancestors attained throughout their lifetime. In fact, no other activities can bring an experience like this. Moreover, learning about a family tree would be a means of self-motivation. For instance, we could drive ourselves through any difficulty when we realize that our ancestors overcame the seemingly insurmountable obstacles, to regard our difficulties as trivial ones.

In conclusion, researching the origins of a person is becoming more popular in society and I believe that it is a positive development.

prompt: Employers should give their staff at least a 4-week holiday a year to make employees better at their jobs. To what extent do you agree or disagree to this statement?
essay:
Holidays are deemed  necessary for the employee to rest so they can perform better. The length of days off may vary, but many believe that company should give their workers a minimum of a month per year. I believe that this is important to prevent burnout and improve overall health so they can do their assigned task well.

To begin with, holidays are vital for everyone, including workers. The company should allow their workers to leave the office for up to months per year to prevent burnout. Burnout which commonly occurs in workers, especially in a high-pressure environment, may predispose to bad decision-making and a decline in work performance. Moreover, staff may opt to leave the company that treats them badly by forcing them to work without sufficient days off. For instance, many young workers are resigned from their job in a startup company due to stress in the high-pressure environment. Hence, it is important for  business owners to give their employers several days off to take a good rest and maintain their mental well-being so they can perform well in their jobs.

Secondly, vacations are necessary to maintain the staff's general health. Overworked and tired workers may lead to a decline in work performance and decision-making. Proper sleep and rest are vital in maintaining good health to perform daily tasks. For example, a tired doctor on 24 hours shift may make mistakes in assessing and treating their patients that may lead to malpractice. Therefore, it is important for a company to allow their staff to take time off the office so they can rest peacefully and fully recharge their stamina in order to perform their responsibilities.

In conclusion,  business owners should give their workers sufficient time for a vacation to maintain the employee's mental and physical health as it is vital for people to do their job well.

prompt: There are several factors that motivate people to stay in the workforce, and money is the most important reason/factor. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is understandable that financial stability is a primary concern for many people, and it is often cited as the main reason for staying in the workforce. However, I disagree with the notion that money is the most important factor in motivating people to continue working. While it is certainly a significant consideration, there are other reasons that can be equally, if not more, influential in an individual's decision to stay in their job.

One such factor is a sense of accomplishment. Many people derive a great deal of fulfilment from their work, particularly if they feel that they are making a positive contribution to society. This sense of purpose and meaning can be a powerful motivator, even if it is not directly tied to financial rewards. In fact, research has shown that people who find meaning and purpose in their work are more likely to be satisfied and engaged in their jobs, which can lead to improved productivity and overall job satisfaction.

Personal growth is another factor that can influence an individual's decision to stay in the workforce. Many people find that their job provides opportunities for learning and development, and this can be a strong incentive to continue working. Additionally, the chance to advance in one's career and take on new challenges can also be a motivating factor.

It is also worth noting that the importance of money as a motivator can vary depending on a person's personal circumstances. For those who are in a financially secure position, other factors such as personal growth and fulfilment may become more important. On the other hand, for those who are struggling financially, the prospect of a higher salary or better benefits may be a strong incentive to stay in the workforce.

In conclusion, while money is certainly an important factor in motivating people to stay in the workforce, it is not the only reason. Other factors such as a sense of accomplishment, personal growth, and the opportunity to make a positive impact can also play a significant role in an individual's decision to continue working.

prompt: There are several factors that motivate people to stay in the workforce, and money is the most important reason/factor. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
To motivate and retain skillful and talented people in the workforce of our ever fast changing society, many companies have been contemplating what the most important factors are in their employees' perspectives. Because capitalism and materialism are two of the most significant driving principles of societal growth, one would argue that money must be the most important factor.

It's obvious that tangible rewards such as commissions, bonuses and promotions are always given to individuals based on their performances, all of these rewards are distributed in the form of money. This basic feedback mechanism has been working exceptionally well in terms of productivity for many centuries in Western countries. Progress and advancements in technology and industrial revolution made this case clearer than ever.

Financial gain allows basic working class to put bread and butter on the table, to stay cozy under a roof and provide basic needs for the family. Money is especially important for these grassroot people as it's impractical to pursue other non-monetary goals when you are just trying to make ends meet.

On the other hand, middle to upper class often stride for a more lucrative career path in order to accumulate wealth for other lifelong investments, which can often lead to early retirement and a more fulfilling, enjoyable later life.

There are other factors like workplace relationship, job satisfaction and company social responsibility that can affect employees' prospects. Companies should also consider these aspects in order to maximise the development and retention of their workforce. However, when people have to make a choice in career or job change, money and opportunity of promotion are two of the most significant elements that influence their choices.

prompt: There are several factors that motivate people to stay in the workforce, and money is the most important reason/factor. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is a general perception that monetary gain is the most significant driving force that keeps an employee or an entrepreneur working. However, in my opinion, this is certainly not the only reason to keep it up.

To begin, Happiness and self-contentment while working are the most underrated but paramount measures. For instance, a person who feels truly satisfied carries on with his performance quite consistently and efficiently. On contrary, if he is not content working, money alone cannot put him together any longer and he might switch his current job for a desired one.

Secondly, the nature of tasks and personal moral values should not be contradictory. This means that a person can only carry on with his effort if it falls within his moral limits and virtuous boundaries. For example, A man with the right upbringing and values cannot stay longer on an earning platform which is not legit.  In other words, those banknotes cannot be a consistent motivation in a situation like this.

Thirdly, mental well-being is as important as physical strength. One cannot perform better with compromised mental strength. Moreover, no amount of money can attract him. The working environment matters to some people more than financial values. These are the righteous kind of people who are enough considerate of their mental well-being. They cannot function in a sick or toxic environment where dirty politics is being played and there is no act of justice or fairness served.

To conclude, although, one cannot deny the importance of financial statistics, the attributes like self-satisfaction, happiness, mental fitness and quality of work are equally or in some cases more important.

essay:
The given diagram illustrates 10 different stages of woollen goods production, starting with shearing the sheep and ending with a finished product. 

Overall, it can be seen that there are two different paths of using the raw material. The first path is knitting the wool products to get clothes and the second one is to recycle the strings.

The process starts when the sheep is shaved and its raw material is cleaned to get rid of any bacterias. After drying, it goes to the spinning machine where both wool and string are produced. Then strings go to recycling, while tufts of wool will be made from the wool. 

The second phase begins when these tufts are delivered to the tuft storage. There the balls of yarn will go to the knitting stage after which woollen products such as carpets and jackets will be made.

prompt:

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In the last 10 years, environmental and cultural awareness has led to bringing forth more responsible tourists, while It has been suggested that "responsible tourists" nowadays are far from being responsible. in any case, as a responsible ,tourist you should aim to keep the places you visit clean for others to use, and also respect other people's cultures and customs. in this essay, I will discuss both views and provide my opinion.

On the one hand, responsible tourists pay great attention to the environment and respect cultural differences, thus reducing the economical costs of keeping the environment clean. similarly, eliminating conflict between people. for example, when  responsible tourists keep the environment clean there will be no need for trash collectors to pick up their waste. in addition, responsible tourists respect others' cultures and therefore won't dislike their traditions. to elaborate, in some places in India, people love the street, while responsible tourists dislike street foot they would still respect India's street culture.  

on the other hand, irresponsible tourists are said to be less concerned about the negative impacts of leaving waste wherever they go, and this could cause tensions between local people and tourists.

prompt: In recent years, "responsible tourist" have paid attention to preserving both culture and environment of the places they visit. However, some people say that it is impossible to be a âresponsible tourist" To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
With the increase in the number of visitors to tourist sites, nowadays, It has become a common thing to see used objects and containers thrown around tourist sites. Even worse, some foreigners who come to visit try to brainwash the local people and debunk their culture. Recently, People who have observed this has tried to organize a movement to try to avoid these and be responsible tourist. However, despite  their claim, they are yet to get the trust of the public as many people believe it is impossible for every tourist to be responsible. In this essay, I will give my opinion on how hard it is to generalise for large groups of visitors and how it should be claimed and understood instead. 

There are many visitors who really care and worry about the places they usually go to visit. And they usually come up with innovative ideas on how to improve the system in handling the preservation of culture and environment. For instance, last year 8 Australian tourists who went to visit a historical place in Sudan  found the environment around to be in an alarming state. and Immediately after they went back home they were able to raise funds that will be used to clean the surroundings and renovate the historical area. So, although not every tourist is responsible, there are genuine tourists who want to protect the environment they go to visit.

Needless to say, however, there is a large swath of people who does things that harm the tourist sites. Some don't care about the objects they use and where they throw them. And others are busy trashing the local culture just because it doesn't align with their way of living or the culture they came from. For instance, during the last world cup people were criticizing Qatar for not allowing similar-gender marriage and trying to impose their own culture.

Therefore, saying every tourist will be responsible is impractical. But at the same time, we can not generalize the acts of some bad people to every tourist as there are  many good tourists who genuinely want to protect the culture and environment. So, the narrative that responsible tourists have started to pay attention to protecting the environment should not be taken literally and it should not be understood negatively. It instead should be encouraged and the people who took the initiative to start the movement should be appreciated as this is how things improve and eventually it might become a norm for every tourist.

prompt:
Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate.
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Recently, people have had contrasting views on the purpose of museums. While some individuals argue that its role is to entertain visitors, others believe that it should be an educational role. In this essay, both sides of the argument will be discussed in detail and I will provide my opinion why I support the former view. 

On the one hand, it can be argued that the main purpose of museums is entertainment. Since they are tourist-attraction places, they should exhibit enjoyable objects and programmes. In other words, if tourists have to read too much educational content, they may quickly get bored. Therefore, some museums have interactive activities or even games to encourage people to visit them. The most salient example of this is the Chocolate Museum in Korea and the Cheese Museum in the Netherlands. Thus, museums may be considered mainly as recreational places. 

On the other hand, some people might argue that museums should have an educational role. This is because they showcase the countryâs valuable cultural items. For instance, The Egyptian Museum in Cairo which exhibits plenty of pharaonic objects. Therefore, some museums employ a tour guide in order to explain the history of every piece to tourists. Other places offer CDs or brochures for the same purpose. Indeed, only when visitors are taught this information will it be possible to save such a culture.

In conclusion, although some individuals believe that museumsâ fundamental role is to entertain its visitors, I think the purpose of them should be educational in order to save the culture as well as the history of the country.

prompt: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?

In conclusion, I believe museums are meant for providing knowledge, whether it is art, science, culture or any other theme-based museums, their main motto is to educate the crowd. prompt: In many parts of the world children and teenagers are committing more crimes. Why is this case happening? How should children or teenagers be punished?
essay:

Firstly, parents are working so hard in the office resulting lack of attentiveness to their sweet ones. For instance, fighting each other or stealing in a supermarket as a prerequisite to enter a gangster that they think can engage the love of a family. Secondly, it is mainly because of living surrounded by unsupported environments. Fighting and verbal abuse have been affected their thoughts which enable them to think and live positively in society.

There are two possible solutions to punish the youngers. One way is through physical punishment by sending to children prison. This is intended to do the rehabilitation and teach them moral and ethical behaviour. When they come back to the community, they will have such positive insights as well as new skills that hopefully help them to live in a society. Another way is by giving the love and attention of parents to them. By loving them unconditionally, it would affect the childrenâs psychology that they are loved. In this manner, feeling supportive parents would make them more precious.

To sum up, the main causes of the problem are lack of attention and effected by bad environments. However, the criminal numbers could be decreased by punishing children with physical reinforcement and giving them parentsâ attachment.

prompt: As society changes, more and more people do not want to stay in one career or job. Many people change their careers and jobs. What is the cause of this phenomenon? Can you give some suggestions to solve this problem?
essay:
With the development of our society, there is a noteworthy phenomenon that more and more people do not stay in one job position in all their careers, which means people now change their job frequently. This essay will give several factors that why this happened and will give some suggestions to solve this problem.

The first reason why people changed their job frequently is due to the job market nowadays is much better than it was in the past. Now, there are more jobs for people to choose from in the job market than in the old times. So people will have more chances to join  a new position in the same field or switch to a completely new field due to  society's development.

The second reason is that the cost for people to live  a decent life costs much more than it  used to. So people always want their salary incremented each year. The best way to achieve this is to switch their job to a different company. That's the second reason why employee changed their jobs 

frequently.

The third factor is that the employee are easier to get bored with what they have done in the company, and thanks to the development of the internet. People have a way to find what they are interested in and the internet helps people  learn new knowledge or technology easily. It provides a convenient way for people to switch their jobs. It also causes people  not to stay in one position for a long time.

But this phenomenon may do a little harm to the company because it may lose some expertise employees and if they want to hire  new employees with the same quality, it requires them to pay more salaries to them, which may influence the company's development and profits. So there should have some measures to alleviate this phenomenon happened. The company could provide a clear path for employees to get promoted and give some employees who perform well a good bonus. It will  make employees feel safe and satisfied. What's more, a good work-life balance is also a key factor to reduce the leaving rate for employees.

prompt: As transport and accommodation problems are increasing in many cities, some governments are encouraging businesses to move to rural areas. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
The number of people is considerably rising in metropolitan areas throughout the years. People have differing views with regard to the question of changing the location of bureau from the urban to suburban areas. There are merits and drawbacks in this issue, personally I support that pros are overtaken cons in the topic and I will discuss my point of view in this essay.

Heavy traffic is one of the most concerned for people who lived in the cities. They not only have to experience a rush living, but also a constitutional problem of the pollution which expended from the vehicles. Additionally, traffic jam can make people developed emotional diseases, for instance, depression, which made them less effective in their living. One of the benefits of relocating the centre of business from urban to suburban areas is to reduce the transportation problem which can subsequently dwindle the consequence of the obstacle.Â 

Furthermore, most people like spacious accommodation, but unfortunately with the constricted area and crowded population in metropolitan, the residential areas are usually limited. Despite growing of flats and condominiums constructed in a crowded area, a number of population which increased every year are outnumbered. While suburban areas may have less facilities than in the urban, the residential areas are also more commodious, which is more suitable for living and better for health.

On the other hand, there are some drawbacks, notably, less convenient stores, less high-technology equipment, harder to access to airport in some areas, but when looking back to the most essential issue, which is a vitality of yourself, the cons are not a major problem.

In conclusion, there are a lot of advantages and disadvantages in the topic of changing location of business from urban to suburban areas. In spite of drawbacks which can make living quite harder, the benefits for constitution overtake it.

prompt: The use of social media ,such as Face book and Twitter ,is replacing face_to_face contact with people. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
Nowadays, there are many people who contact by using social media sites rather than contacting face-to-face. The advantages of this trend such as the connection at any time or place outweigh their drawbacks. This essay will discuss these benefits in depth in the following paragraphs.

The first benefit of the connection virtually rather than the actual method is the possibility of making a chat or call at any time. Because the users do not require anything, expect a good internet connection, to be kept in touch with their friends. For example, the possibility of contacting at any time is increasing the contact among the Facebook users according to the London City University report in 2020. Without such time flexibility, the number of online connection users may are not enhanced. Therefore, the time flexibility in the social media connection is the benefit that outweighs any impact of replacing face-to-face relations.

Furthermore,  contact in the virtual world is the easiest way to meet your international people or friends. Because in this world there are no boundaries and anyone can call or meet their public regardless their nations. For instance, each family have an online group either a massager or WhatsApp group in order to meet together, even if there are some members are living in different countries. Without a group like this, many family members may not connect for many ages. Therefore, among the advantages of replacing the direct way of contact is the possibility of gathering people together in one conversation regardless of their places. 

In conclusion, this essay agreed that the benefits of replacing face-to-face connections with networks through social media apps outweigh their impacts. The replacing of the normal connection method with an online alternative provide more connection at any time and from any site.

prompt:

Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
