On the one hand, people suggest that offspring should be punished due to their bad behaviours. In this way, they donât repeat their negative actions. For instance, when a child commits a crime such as  fighting with peers, parents can give punishment to their kid, including a restriction on video games and meeting with peers. When children get these types of penalties, they can understand that their behaviour was wrong, resulting in them tendency to leave these acts behind them. Also, little ones can learn their every negative action has some consequences. 

On the other hand, some people believe that parents should get penalties due to being role models for their kids. The children spend most of their time with their family members since they are born, and their parents become the main characters in their life. Therefore, kids tend to imitate their father and mother in terms of their behaviours and moral values. For example, if little one sees that his/her dad screams when arguing with other people, they perceive this act as normal, resulting in copying this behaviour. 

In conclusion, although some people claim that children should get penalties because of committing crimes, I believe that parents have a majority of responsibility for their kidsâ actions due to be role models in their offspring's life.

prompt: Detailed description of crimes on newspaper and TV can have bad consequences on society, so this kind of information should be banned in the media. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Firstly, I medianly agree, in our ,generation social media had taken a great place in our daily lives so what might be posted there will affect many viewers of it and  this , is the topic I'll dig into and illustrate more about this.

Moreover,posting this kind of media on social media or tv might have bad effects on the surrounding society such as the kids watching these descriptions but if you asked me  who is responsible for that, simply the answer will be the government in fact we pay for that cuz if you have a child and he saw smth like it may get him mental illness, so I recommend keeping your kids away from these kinds of social media platforms.

Another negative consequence of reporting on crimes is that it can lead to copycat crimes. Some individuals who may be inclined to commit a crime may become emboldened by the attention given to similar crimes in the media. This phenomenon is known as the "copycat effect," and it has been observed in numerous instances where the media has given extensive coverage to a particular crime.

In conclusion, while it is true that detailed descriptions of crimes in newspapers and TV can have negative consequences on society, banning such information from the media is not the solution. The media has a responsibility to report  crimes and events that occur in society, and censorship can lead to an erosion of democratic principles. Instead, we should focus on addressing the root causes of crime and implementing effective solutions to reduce crime in our society.

prompt:

Therefore, parents cannot take their eyes off their children. In such a situation, it is almost impossible to balance work and childcare. First of all, it is true that the company will be in trouble because the employees are time-off from work. When the labour force decreases, the firm has to get rid of the situation by reallocate other employees to the blank post. However, if a person who has left was an expert and irreplaceable worker, they might struggle to find a substitute people. Furthermore, during the worker is absent, the company has to support them financially even though they are not working. To sum up, parental leave might be a burden for the company.

Second of all, on the other hand, fathers are responsible to take part in childcare. In the past world, a plethora of people believed that only mothers should participate in nurturing and the responsible for fathers is little. However, in the modern world, both gender should be treated equal and it is same in a relationship of a family. Consequently, since rely only on a power of mothers is unfair, not only mothers but also fathers should take time-off and cooperate to nurture as a parent.

In my conclusion, I believe that the fathers should take parental leave even though the firm will be suffered from getting substitute worker temporarily. As a consequence, I tend to agree with the premise.

This could be more successful when we can mass produce these means of transport and make them more affordable. 

In conclusion, I do not agree with the idea that raising fuel cost is the best solution to environmental problems because this will make matters worse by damaging the economy. Rather than that, we should focus on researching and producing vehicles using clean energy.

prompt: The best way to solve the worldâs environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

If people were aware of the consequences that they made while operating in their fields, the environment would not suffer as it does now. Maybe instead of cutting down trees for residential housing, city planners can be more thoughtful by creating more green spaces for residents to live close to nature.

In conclusion, increased prices for fuel can somewhat prevent people from using their vehicles for a limited time, but we need to work towards long-term reform. I think once we educate people to be more responsible in their areas, we already help the environment not to be seriously harmed.

prompt: As well as making money, businesses also have social respinsibilities, to what extent do you agree or disagree.
essay:
Businesses are always driven by money-making pursuits, which, however, is argued that it needs to shoulder social responsibilities as well. From my perspective, I am in favour of this opinion, believing that not only should enterprises and entrepreneurs aim to make a profit but take more duties into consideration.

Living in a world full of competitiveness and stress, there is no doubt that businessmen and corporations make an effort to earn as much money as they could, thus gaining an edge over competitors. For instance, Apple's company endeavours to lower the manufacturing cost and increase the sale price so that it can reap more revenue from the market. As a result, all interested parties, such as shareholders, governments and so on, can benefit from it. Furthermore, profit-driven pursuits could fuel people and enterprises to make progress through unremitting effort, because wealth is able to make many dreams come true. For example, business persons can improve the living standard for themselves and their families, which brings them happiness and well-being. 

On the other hand, the country provides us with opportunities to do business, therefore individuals and organizations engaging in commercial activities ought to make contributions to society. To begin with, the community offers well-built infrastructure and sufficient employees for people to make a fortune, which in turn should be paid back by money-makers. Apart from paying taxes,  Apple company and other international corporations also donate a great sum of money to local charities and the less fortunate, thereby achieving higher value beyond money-making goals. In addition, the wealth in the country can be distributed more equally when individuals and enterprises take their social responsibilities, say, investing their gains into neighbourhoods to render assistance to those in need, thus building a harmonious society with a narrow gap between the haves and have-nots. 

In conclusion, while it is true that individuals and companies in the businesses should spare no pains in maximizing profit, there is a wider role to play for them in society.

prompt:

prompt:
As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. 
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
There is no doubt that businessmen aim to earn some money, while some people consider that they should take on corresponding responsibilities. In my opinion, I completely agree with this view and believe that companies ought to do more for society than simply make money.

First of all, it is justified that companies make some money and thus they can survive in fierce competition and further extend their scale. Every company need to pay for daily consumption and workers' salary, as well as building refurbishments. Therefore, it seems logical that the priority of any company should be to cover its running costs. From an opposite angle, society is more likely to fall into chaos and workers find themselves standing on the unemployment line since the company cannot afford these payments. In other words, a company can only make a positive contribution to society if it is in a good financial state. 

However, companies should not be run with the sole aim of maximizing profit; they have a wider role to play in society. One social obligation that owners and managers have is to treat their employees well, rather than exploit them. For example, they could pay a 'living wage' to ensure that workers have a good quality of life. I also like the idea that businesses could utilize a proportion of their profits to support local charities, environmental projects or educational organizations. Finally, instead of trying to minimise their tax payments by using accounting loopholes, I believe that company bosses should be happy to contribute to society through the tax system.

In conclusion, I believe that companies should place as much importance on their social responsibilities as they do on their financial objectives.

prompt:

essay:

Accruing profits should not be the only goal of any investor. The reason is that there are many stakeholders in any investment and this range from shareholders to employees to local communities hosting the business to customers. Therefore, a business owner has large responsibility of satisfying these stakeholders. Though the primary aim of shareholders is to make gains, however, the hosting land will expect some positive impacts from the business. For example, an oil mining company is expected to contribute to the growth of its local community by achieving less pollution in the environment and also providing some social amenities in order to continue enjoying the support of the local community. Therefore, as an investor is trying to make money to satisfy the shareholders, he also needs to work hard to maintain strong support from the local community.

Furthermore, a business owner also has a responsibility to customers. Customers consume the products and their aspirations need to be met. Customers can be grouped into two. There are retailers and final consumers. For instance, farmers in Australia supply to retail outlets for onward selling to final consumers or they sell directly to consumers. Therefore, a business owner must maintain a strong relationship with these groups, by making sure He is supplying quality products at affordable prices. This will make the business sustainable for its shareholders for continuous returns.

In conclusion, as much as businesses must make profits, social responsibilities cannot be avoided if a business will survive for a long period of time. Therefore, business owners must prepare for this.

Those in favour of more practical skills training point out the financial benefits. Most university graduates are burdened with student debt and face uncertain job prospects. In contrast, training schools are cheap, fast, and ease students into steady employment immediately. The jobs they train for are also most likely recession-proof and durable, including positions as cooks, hotel managers, and skilled technicians. Someone who is firmly established in such a job in their early 20s does not have to deal with the pressure associated with university life and its incumbent debts. Instead, they can begin to set aside money for a house or start a family.

Nonetheless, lacking a university degree limit one's options. The jobs available will pay well initially and be secure, but offer narrow scope for advancement and virtually no opportunity to switch the career paths. An individual with a university degree, on the other hand, might begin from a lower position, but has a higher ceiling on future earnings. It is also possible for them to explore a variety of fields. Most good jobs require at least a bachelorâs degree even for simple internship vacancies. Lacking such a degree, means restricting oneself to manual labour or service industry jobs. The actual learning that takes place at university, particularly for those with multi skills majors or studying at liberal art schools, also encourages students to consider a wide range of possible career options.

In conclusion, increasing funding for vocational training is an attractive yet short sighted approach that curbs possibilities. Governments ought to continue to support higher education even in dark economic times in order to reap future rewards.

prompt: Advertisements are becoming more and more common in everyday life. Is it a positive or negative development
essay:
There are controversial perspectives heating up a debate over the merits and demerits of advertisements ubiquitous in everyday life .Obviously, this essay is devoted to analyzing both sides, followed by parallel justification. However,  I would contend that its downsides may outweigh its upsides.

Without a shadow of doubt, there is considerable clear evidence about the tremendous benefits of advertisements. Not only does it help the companies draw their products attention to the customers, but also creates a high reputation to people about the things via technological media . For instance, the fashion brands such as Zara, H&M create a wealth of advertisement campaigns to promote their clothes collections. Apparently, that puts an immense impact on the customer, through those images , videos, people may get more acknowledgement about the products such as their price, their quality and style of collection and they will have multiple choices of shopping. The more advertisements the enterprises show, the higher percentage of consumption they get. In my point of view, the promotions do wonders for both customers and business. 

While the redeeming features of advertisements are widely acknowledged, it is unfair if its drawbacks are ignored. With a drastic increase in  technology devices, advertising is easier for everyone. There is a wealth of low quality products promoted widenly on social media such as Facebook, Instagram, Tiktok, which leads to plenty of alarming conditions .Remarkably is the cream named mixed-cream,which is unknown origin and ingredient, can be cited as an outstanding instance. Despite its latent serious dangers such as bad skin condition, or health condition, it still widely sells because of its high coverage advertising effect. That leads to a counterpart of the advertisement industry on people, who have strong trust on promotion. Thus, untruly promotion can cause a great deal of urgent impact on customers.

In conclusion, while the advantage of advertisement is proved crealy, it still does great damage to people because of its counterpart mentioned.

prompt: Advertisements are becoming more and more common in everyday life. Is it a positive or negative development?
essay:
The developments of mass media have led to the popularity of advertising. Personally, I believe this phenomenon has both beneficial and detrimental sides.

There are two main benefits of advertisements that I can point out. Firstly, the existing and newly-launched products can both be promoted. Thanks to advertisements, the goods will be widely recognized and earn a reputation through many forms such as commercials, billboards, endorsements, etc... To illustrate the point, the tech giant Apple has successfully applied the posters to advertise their brand new iPhone 13 series products and gained a higher profit by 4% than the previous year. Secondly, customers can also benefit from advertisementsâ knowledge. Specifically, commercials can supply all sorts of people with useful information about the goods, for example, regarding healthcare and eating habits. 

Simultaneously, there are still some drawbacks that advertisements bring back. Many of advertisers create misleading impressions of their goods. In reality, their items were of inferior quality but the advertisers exaggerated them for their own interests. For instance, Snapchat used to mislead customers into thinking that pictures disappeared forever. Afterwards, the company was also accused by the FTC of collecting customer data. In addition, advertising can also cause a great burden for the companies.  In other words, to be advertised on TV, businesses have to pay for a huge amount of money.

In conclusion, advertisements can have both  benefits and drawbacks to daily life. From my observation, the companies can advertise for their products but not abuse them.

prompt:

essay:
Nowadays, advertising is a vital part of modern business which allows entrepreneurs to thrive in the business sphere and to inform customers about their products. Having said that , there are some negative effects of them, as they may distract people from staying concentrated as well as lead more consumerism. 

Advertisements can be presence almost everywhere where people pay attention more or where is more crowded.  When people are watching TV or videos on social media and reading some articles online, there are some breaks which are deliberately for advertisements. Once flashy advertisements appear, people may have to their concentration. As a result, the attention spans of many people may reduce. For instance, it is much harder to teach students than ever before, since they cannot stay focused on certain tasks in longer amount of time. 

Advertising can manipulate adults and particularly children and its purpose is to persuade them purchasing certain product may assist to be more grateful. Usually, after watching those children-oriented advertisements, they might start pestering their parents to buy the products for them. Consequently, this can create consumerism from an early age. Moreover, businessmen normally hire glamorous, successful people in order to promote their company. Therefore, people are encouraged to buy the products that might not need them at all. This may lead more consumerism in some cases. 

	To sum up, existing more advertisement in our daily life has many negative effects. Hence, people should try to decrease the amount of advertisement on TV as well as on social media. Additionally, advertisements at children should be controlled or even banned.

prompt: Some people say that the government should stop TV and Newspaper from showing crimes because media coverage of violent crimes is frightening people and encouraging criminals. Do you agree or disagree with the statement?
essay: With the advancement of technology, we now have access to a variety of tools such as television, the internet, magazines, and newspapers to keep us up to date on global events. And having the breach scenes broadcast is a controversial topic as the violence can be frightening to viewers or encourage people to commit crimes. I'm inclined to agree with the mentioned opinion, but there is another perspective. I will discuss both opinions in the essay with suitable examples. On the one hand, human psychology is vulnerable to the brutality shown in programs. To begin with, the violence often frightens the viewers and affects their peace of mind. For example, the elderly feel depressed and scared after watching an episode of a story containing murder and robbery. Furthermore, if the criminal had read the detailed description in the newspaper, they would have had the idea to commit a crime against the local authorities. Therefore, the government should impose a restriction on broadcasting such brutal acts. On the other hand, some people believe that a clear, informative message is delivered to the young generation through these criminal reports. The heinous consequences of wrongdoing remind them of the critical importance of not engaging in any offense, such as drug or alcohol abuse. Moreover, many cases broadcast on TV have been explained in crime coverage, which allows viewers to know more about the criminal. Through this, they can protect themselves as well as their loved ones. In conclusion, the violence presented through any mass media has both a positive and negative influence on society. From my point of view, the prohibition on such media coverage does not serve the purpose, though some filters can be applied to make it more effective for people absorbing the information.

prompt:
Some people think  that in the modern world we are more dependent on each other, while others believe we have become more independent .

Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
In recent times, technological advancements have become booming every single day. It is believed by some that in the modern world more and more people are becoming reliant on each other while others argue that they have become more independent; I take the view with the latter notion. This essay will discuss both sides and provides support for the writerâs opinion.

On the one hand, there are those who firmly believe that these days people are relying on one another more than ever. They assume that with the accelerating rate of modernization, people will not be able to keep up with the latest electronic gadgets such as computers or cell phones. Take an illiterate person for example, it will be challenging for him to utilize his phone to contact family members and be in touch with them. In addition, when he tends to leave home and finds a way to a place where he has never been   since he cannot use mobile apps like Waze or Google Maps, he might end up getting lost and find himself in the middle of nowhere.

On the other hand, there are those who opine that humans are living in the most independent era in  history. They are deeply engaged with technology and make a determined effort to get the best out of it. This means by allocating more  home appliances such as washing machines, Food processors and blenders those who are in charge of doing the housework spend a minimum amount of time getting over  these tasks. Moreover, in terms of shopping, it is no longer necessary to get prepared and spend time shopping for clothes and groceries in high streets; that is due to the fact that one can take on the responsibility by simply pushing the buttons on his personal computer or cell phone. Therefore I honestly believe being independent is not far-fetched in today's world.

To sum up, although there are still people outside who rely on others to help with their duties and activities, I personally have a firm conviction that the globe is facing the most independent period of all time do the conveniences technology has brought us.

prompt: Some people think that in the modern world we are more dependent on each other, while others think that people have become more independent.â¨ Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
While some believe that modernisation has made us more reliant on each other, others, however, think that we are more self-reliant and free from dependency on others as time has progressed. I believe that we have become more independent than at any time in history.

People who advocate that we have become more dependent on each other in this modern era often present the idea that our necessity has increased and we need to interact with far more people due to this. This in a way requires us to rely on others for our needs. For instance, office executives mostly rely on laundry services, restaurants, housemaids, cleaning services and so on to have their necessary works done. In the past, people used to do most of these tasks on their own. Moreover, the prices of education, house, daily commodities etc. are skyrocketing day by day and we need to rely on our parents to have those needs fulfilled until we get a job. When we will become earning members, our parents and children will rely on us. Due to peopleâs busy schedules and high ambitions, they need to socialise and get to know people from different walks of life and this creates a wider circle in which peopleâs interaction and reliance on each other increase.

However, I would agree with the people who opine that modernization has made us free and less reliant on others. In most countries, young children are trying to support their education and living costs. After a certain age, they prefer to stay own their own house. The number of nuclear and single-parent families proves that people are less reliant on others. We are free to pick the school, travel to other countries and make our choices for most of the major events in our life including picking our life partners. The progress of technology has made us more self-reliant and we love to take advantage of modern tools and devices to make things of our own. For instance, many people these days pick an online lesson than getting admitted to a training institute. Many of us even have the freedom to work from home and this is a paradigm shift in the way we earn our living. Finally, the gender equality and women empowerment movements have greatly made women free from others reliance and self-dependent and this has all been possible only recently.

In conclusion, though some people think that the modern era is the time when we are more reliant on each other, I personally believe that we are more free and self-reliant instead.

prompt: Interview form the basic selection criteria for most large companies. However, some people think that interview is not a reliable method of choosing whom to employ and there are better methods. To what extent to you agree or disagree?
essay:
The interview section is the most vital part of the hiring process. It is the time for knowing the interviewee and also for the person being interviewed to learn some information about the company. But, some people think that interview is not an accurate way of selecting whom to employ. In my opinion, the interview will always be the best way of choosing the right candidate for a certain position in an establishment.

Interviewing is very beneficial not just for hiring but also for other aspects like research or healthcare setting. It is very advantageous because you will know more about your prospect for the specified job. The interviewer will have the chance to ask about the person's background  education, and work experience as well as any injuries that could hinder doing some of the required tasks. For example, a manager could ask about the hobbies of the interviewee, plans for the next 5 years and also related experience for the position he is applying. In this way, the boss will have the chance to know what kind of person will he be working with soon. Furthermore, questioning before hiring will give the person the opportunity to showcase his skills to the head of the department. This is a very crucial part for the person being interviewed because this is the time for him to sell himself to the company. He will be able to inform them of the things that he could offer and share with the company that others can't. For instance, a person could inform the company in chronological order of his experiences that will benefit the company. With this, he will be able to upsell his abilities and knowledge for the job.4

However, there are other methods that will help a company choose an employee. One of them is by providing an examination. This will help the employer know the level of knowledge and understanding of a person and hence will be helpful to match to a certain position. But, this will only show the intellectual side of a person ,not the attitude. 

To recapitulate, the interview is the best method to use when selecting staff for an institution. This will not only give you an insight into the person's attitude but also the knowledge and skills that he has. As everyone keeps saying, attitude is very important when hiring  staff because skills and knowledge are learnable.

prompt: Interviews form the basic selection criteria for most large companies. However, some poeple think that interviews is not a reliable mthod of choosing whom to employ and there are other better methods. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Many multinational companies conduct interviews in order to select the best candidates for their organisation. Although it may be argued that interviews are not a reliable method of selecting a person for a job, I agree with the premise and will substantiate my reasons in the course of this essay.

     The expression "First impression, is the best impression" comes to mind here because this is what interviews are basically about. A company gets many applications for any given job requirement. Therefore in order to "thin out the herd", firms hold these formal discussions so as to gauge the interviewees. Moreover, this way the interviewer will also be able to assess the technical know-how of the applicant and his expectations. In addition, the temperament of the applicant can be assessed along with his communication level. The communication level is a very important aspect of a job because there may be situations where a potential employee needs to speak to senior-level managers, and if they are unable to convey their message in a simplistic manner, then the message gets lost.

         Furthermore, it is an opportunity for the company to provide a potential employee with their expectations of them, and also through these discussions help them to determine whether the applicant will suit their working environment. Also, through a face to face interview, interviewers can get to know through the body language and facial expressions the exact intent of the applicant. This is very important and cannot be obtained from a resume.

         To conclude, I believe that interviews are important from a company's perspective for obtaining the best employee for their requirement. As they are going to be paying for their services in terms of salaries, it is only fair that they get to see the potential employee and understand their capabilities.

prompt: Interviews form the basic selection criteria for most longer companies. However, some people think that an interview is not a reliable method of choosing whom to employ and there are other better methods. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
There are some basic methods by which multinational , international and domestic organisations get selected of their workers like conducting written tests and verbal interviews. Some people proposed that an interview is not an authentic source of picking the employees; there are other selection criteria to qualify the candidates. I personally disagree with the notion. 

The first and foremost reason for the disappointment with the idea is that the recruitment of the employees by conducting face-to-face interviews enables the employers to estimate the personal characteristics and sophisticated cognitive skills. For example, verbal testing depicts the communication skills and fluency in the language along with the aptitude and quick response to  emergencies.Thus, the recruitment by verbal testing assures the owner about the potential of the applicant.

Moving further, some of the entrepreneurs use other options to specify the essence of human capital. The first method is written testing which helps employers to conclude the mathematical talent of the workers. Secondly, some of the multinational and international firms use  references to select the helping hands. For instance,in the food industry, most of the owners verify the references. It disseminates more accuracy and transparency as the applicant is familiar with the current working staff.

To conclude then, it is taxing work to decide which method is perfect for the vacancies. Howbeit, I think verbal testing would provide more clearance and accurate estimation regarding the potential of the candidates in comparison to others.

prompt:
lnterviews form the basic selecting criteria for most large companies. However, some people think that interview is not of reliable method of choosing whom to employ and there are other better methods. To whom
extend do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Hiring a new employee can be an excessively hard and stressful process. However, it is a crucial process for expanding the company for all organizations. And the success of any company depends on the quality of hiring staff. prompt:
The increase in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment.

What are the causes of this? What can be done to solve this problem?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
Issues related to manufacturing effects are frequently discussed these days. It is true that the increase in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment. In the following paragraph, both causes and solutions will be discussed.

On the one hand, there are a number of causes associated with the growth of manufacturing. The principal cause is that gas and pollution emissions from the producing processes directly result in the atmosphere. In other words, One of the most dangerous consequences of the consumer-making stage is the Greenhouse effect caused by Carbon Dioxide, CFCs, and Methane. For instance, Our stratum temperatures are higher than in the past because of the global warming effect. This dramatically affects climate change as a result of there are polar ice melting, wildfires, and rising seas & coastal flooding.

On the other hand, there are potential ways to tackle such problems, or at least reduce the effects. One of the possible solutions to this issue is reducing plastic usage volume. This means decreasing the number of using products with plastic packaging which is the main factor of global warming. For example, there is a campaign about preferring cloth bags to plastic bags these days. Other than that, reducing personal car driving is an efficient way to tackle this issue because we can control the gas emissions from vehicles.

All things considered, It can be concluded that the increase in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment and we can solve this problem by stopping using products which are harmful to the earth.

prompt: The increase in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment. What are the causes of this? What can be done to solve this problem?
essay:
By the present, there have been many concerns about the environment negatively affected to by human activities, and one of them is the consumer goods manufacturing. It is essential to argue how this manufacturing has negative impact to the environment and what should be done to restrict this impact. 

To begin with, consumer goods companies are responsible for the pollution. They try their best to reduce expenses to maximize profits. Because dealing with production waste is extravagant for many companies, they decide to skip this activity and emit them into the environment. There are many consequences of this decision to the environment. The majority of companies use fossil fuels as the main energy source and several toxic gases such as carbon dioxide, nitrogen oxide and sulfur dioxide are emitted into the air. Because of them, air quality can decrease, impacting to photosynthesis of plants and respiration of animals. In addition, many studies indicate that the three aforementioned gases are the main cause of greenhouse effect, resulting in global warming and climate change. Another concerning consequence is the gases can result in acid rain, destroying many species in nature. As regard to water, it can be affected by liquid waste from factories, including wastewater, sludge, oil and grease. Water species can die due to these pollutants or have to migrate to other habitats. To reduce these consequences, government should impose taxation on contaminating activities of companies and taxes should be as high as possible. By this way, factories have to consider whether not dealing with waste is still beneficial for them. If companies keep this behavior, they can face strict tax punishments, which can make their products exorbitant and affect to their profit.

However, companies are not the only factor of environmental problems. Consumers are also the accomplice in the matter. Nowadays, there is a tendency among them that they use disposable goods instead of durable goods. For instance, customers are more likely to use plastic-wrapped paper cups, not conventional plastic, glass or porcelain mugs just because they want to use once only and then throw into trash bins. The trend is also apparent in using plates, people prefer the plastic-wrapped paper, not the typical plastic or the porcelain. Consequently, landfills will have to receive a great amount of garbage of disposable goods. The problem is the majority of these goods are made of materials which are usually difficult to decompose in short periods and toxic when incinerated. Therefore, people are likely to keep garbage in landfills. It is certain that land can get contaminated due to the consumption behavior of modern society. To restrict land pollution, government should impose taxes on disposable goods. Due to taxation, these goodsâ costs increase and consumers are more likely to restrict using them. By this solution, the amount of waste from disposable goods can decline. 

In conclusion, the production of consumer goods impacts to the natural environment through companies, by waste, and customers, by using disposable goods. To reduce these negative effects, governments should impose taxes on waste and disposable goods. Due to taxation, companies and consumers have to think again about the possible benefits and losses they have, indirectly reducing their influence on the environment.

prompt: Children find it difficult to concentrate on or pay attention to school. What are the reasons? How can we solve this problem?
essay:
In todayâs modern society, it can be difficult for students to pay attention or concentrate on lessons at school. The reasons for this are diverse, and thus it requires suitable approaches for children to tackle this problem. 

To begin with, there are certain reasons why children are unable to concentrate on learning at school. First, technological advancement is one of the main reasons. Nowadays, most children have smartphones or computers to study and entertain. This is due to the fact that their parents are so busy with their work, so they cannot help their children to learn at home. Consequently, students can learn on the internet with video records and apps, which are more interesting than theoretical knowledge at school. Second, teenagers have to study long hours every day. Apart from studying at school, they must go to extra classes for many subjects such as math, literature or English. As a consequence, they cannot have a break to rest so they cannot pay full attention to all subjects at school.

To tackle this issue, some measures can be adopted. To begin with, teachers at school should make the lessons diverse for children to increase their interests. For instance, more activities and experiments should be included such as visiting the museum about history after finishing a lesson in this subject. Moreover, parents could help their children to organize a more reasonable timetable for studying. Therefore, students can pay attention and concentrate on subjects at school. Besides, if they have more time, they could develop their aptitude and find out their favourite subject.

In conclusion, there are many culprits of distracting children such as technological advancements and a hectic studying schedule, and their teachers and parents can have a lot of methods to solve this problem.

prompt: Children find it difficult to pay attention or concentrate on school study what are the reasons? How can we solve this problem?
essay:
Childrenâs education has always been a matter of great concern for parents. In todayâs world, this has grown exponentially, mainly due to the constant changing world. One of the primary reasons for this, relates to a childâs concentration and small attention span. This essay will attempt to dissect this cause and propose some reasonable solutions that could help with mitigating this issue.
Due to a childâs small attention span, conventional ways of teaching are inadequate in keeping their interest. In order to get through to a child, it is important to keep their interest for the duration of the study session or class and ensure they view it as a fun activity. Moreover, most schools find it hard to move away from traditional teaching methods such as dictation, using white boards, etc., especially in some developing countries, and as a result fail to engage their students. 
Furthermore, with massive technological growth in recent years, children are attracted towards their phones, tablets, computers, TV, etc. and provide a major source of distraction for them. Many studies have even linked the use of these devices to the release of endorphins resulting in a further dependency on technology. Combine this with the lack of engagement in classroom and education providerâs resistance to adapting to the changing world results in children having difficulties in paying attention. 
This issue needs to be tackled on two fronts. Firstly, parents need to monitor and limit the use of technology outside of school hours. A structured schedule would be a good start and usage of phones & tablets may even be incorporated into a reward system. Schools should take responsibility for the second front. It is vital for them to coach themselves on changing technology and how it can be utilized for providing quality education to children. For instance, the use of interactive applications, modern teaching methodologies or structuring and creating custom curriculum for each child, based on their learning abilities, interests, etc.
In conclusion, it is important to acknowledge and understand the problem, as well as its root cause, utilize modern solutions and creative thinking that caters for the ever-changing modern world. Parents and teachers need to understand childrenâs interests and how to keep them engaged, while delivering quality education.

prompt: Some experts believe that when a country is already rich, any additional increase in economic wealth does not make its citizens any more satisfied. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It has been claimed that economic increase in rich countries does not imply more satisfaction for their citizens. In my opinion, I disagree with this statement for two reasons. The first one is that I think that getting richer, even if the person is already rich, will probably make the person feel better, and the second one is that I do not agree with generalizing peopleâs feelings.

Firstly, we cannot deny that improving the economy in a rich country would contribute to the better well-being of people, increasing their life quality standards. One example of this is Finlandia, this country is one of the happiest nations in the world and its wealth index is enormous. People have time to dedicate to their families instead of working all day and children attend school only for three hours, having the best education system with the highest educational standards. All this contributes to an improvement of the national economy, making feel its citizens happier as their work-life balance gets better. 

Secondly, I think that the majority of citizens may be happier in case of economic improvement. However, not everything in life is about the economy, and I think that this may be related to why some people are not feeling better with this âgood newsâ. Nowadays, individuals are very confused about life, and even if they are wealthy, money cannot resolve what a person feels or desires. Statistics show the highest suicide rates in the richest countries, which proves that being economically stable and rich does not guarantee happiness.

In conclusion, even if some experts believe that an additional increase in the economy in a rich country would not make a difference among their citizens, I think that it would definitely contribute to the better well-being of most people increasing their quality of life standards and satisfaction levels. However, some sectors of society may be experiencing other issues in their lives that do not let them pain attention to other good things, like feeling happier because their country and their people are acceding to a better lifestyle standard. The economy may benefit people and bring stability into their lives but it cannot guarantee happiness for everyone.

That way, in conclusion, people from rich countries do not get any more satisfied by more economic wealth because they have already enough, but still have needs, in other scopes though.

prompt: 1.Some school leavers travel or work for a period of time instead of going directly to university. What are the advantages and disadvantages for their studies?

Despite the benefits of this situation, it also has some implications. The most important reason is that students lose motivation. In summary, it can be said that every situation has both advantages and disadvantages. It is a fair idea to take a break and find your major before choosing a university course; however, without executing a perfect plan, learners lose focus on their studies and work.

prompt: Nowadays more and more people want to get things done instantly (services, information, tasks). Why is this? Do you think it is a positive or negative development?
essay:
Advancement of technology brought a massive impact on our society by obtaining services, information and tasks rapidly. I believe this has drawbacks for every individual like decreasing the essence of humanity and being an impatient person in society. 

Other people might perceive that there are fringe benefits to this advent of technology. For example, work would be simplified in every household since the availability of equipment like vacuum cleaning would swiftly finish the task, aside from this, food delivery is accessible by using a mobile phone without delays. Thus, people would get those essential needs easily in the comfort of their homes. 

However, I strongly believe that this development of technology would diminish the essence of humanity. For instance, if an online delivery would not arrive on time at the customer's front door, they were easily annoyed to the extent that they shouted at the delivery boy. Moreover, a person became immensely impatient by not obtaining services instantly because they are living in a fast pace world where they would like accessibility in just a snap of seconds. Consequently, humanity and  patience with others are slowly vanishing from each and every one.

In our village, where technology arises rapidly, it can be seen in my neighbourhood how they transform their life through the effect of phone usage. Way back before, they would patiently wait for the newspaper to be delivered, however, these days they tend to get angry once the news on their phone is not updated. As a result, they are easily irritated and impatient in public services.

To conclude, the flexibility of day-to-day household chores can be instantly finished by using the latest technology and other commodities can be acquired swiftly as well. However, I strongly believe that the usage of technology would slowly remove the essence of humanity and society is becoming more impatient once they can not get things in an instant.

prompt:
Restoration of old buildings in main cities involves enormous government expenditure. It would be more beneficial to spend this money to build new houses and roads.

 To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Because of that , it would be irrational to spend public money to restore old buildings, when more people need to buy a place to live. For instance, Hoi An Old Quarter is one of the historical sites and beautiful places of Da Nang city and  this place attracts  a lot of tourists  from around the world every year, so it needs funds from the government to develop and protect it.

In conclusion, I agree that constructing more new roads and houses play an important role since there are some benefits that they bring and it should be prioritized over restoring old buildings, except historically significant constructions.

prompt: Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way  to live with it. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is often argued that it's not wise to prevent climate change and we must think of ways to be compatible with it. I completely disagree with this idea and I believe it's much easier to prevent global warming from getting worse, and also we cannot afford its consequences.

To begin with, dealing with global warming results is much harder, while it's easier, and more achievable to take some simple yet fundamental steps. Air pollution is one of the main factors in global warming, and to be more specific, carbon dioxide produced as a result of fossil fuels, plays a major role in this pollution. Governments can significantly reduce CO2 production by applying extra tax on fossil fuel-based cars and encourage people to purchase electric vehicles. Also, people can be a great help in this situation, by making simple changes in their everyday life. For instance, they can commute to work by bicycle instead of taking a cab or worse, riding their own car.

Furthermore, the consequences of prolonged and worsened global temperature rise are expensive, and it's too difficult to tackle. One of the first things that can occur as a result of it, is poles Ice melt, resulting in increased sea water level. This can cause lots of cities to sink, and many lives will be lost. For example,  recent research shows that if the world's temperature keeps rising at the current speed, the city of Bangkok in Thailand will go underwater by 2030. One more reason to argue is mass extinctions that could happen as a complication of global warming. Lots of species are at risk of extinction at this very moment, such as polar bears and penguins living in Antarctica.

In conclusion, I strongly believe that it's better to take steps to mitigate the world's temperature rising, because it's a lot easier to do so and we won't have to deal with its consequences.

prompt: Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way to live with it. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Climate change represents a major threat to our life on Earth. Some people argue that we need to accept it rather than try to stop it. I completely disagree with this statement as I believe that we still have time to tackle this issue by considering governments and individual contribution to it and reduce the human impact on Earth's climate.

With regards to governments, I think that there are various measures that governments can take to prevent, or at least mitigate, climate change.  Firstly, governments could introduce laws to limit the carbon dioxide emission that leads to global warming.  They should impose 'green taxes' on drivers, airline companies, and other pollutants so that they are encouraged to invest in renewable energy production from water, wind and solar power. Although energy will be produced at higher costs, but this will help to reduce pollutants in the air and clean the surroundings. Furthermore,  governments should speed up afforestation by planting more trees as they help to reduce the carbon dioxide level in air and clean the atmosphere. Hence governments and big businesses can help in various ways to reduce the impact of climate change on the Earth.

As for individuals, they can also play a vital role in preventing effects of climate change. For instance, we should use recycled products for our daily use, as plastic causes hazardous effects on the environment. I think we should use paper bags instead of plastic bags. This is because plastic causes harmful effects on Earth, especially in the oceans as  it is not easily decomposed, and impact aquatic species badly. In addition to this, we can also try to limit our contribution to climate change by becoming energy efficient, by flying less, using bicycles and public transports. Therefore, individuals should also be encouraged to help in mitigating effects of climate change as they are effective.

In conclusion, it is my firm belief that if governments and individuals come together, we can address the problem of climate change, instead of trying to find ways to live with it.

prompt: Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way to live with it. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:

While it is believed by some people that preventing such a threat to the environment is essential, others think we should just adapt to it.This essay will argue why it's totally preposterous to think that our environment could survive global warming or other climate related disasters without doing anything to prevent that.
Despite the major risks, it is believed that controlling the earth's temperature is beyond our power. Because it is connected to many other factors none of which can be stopped or even predicted. For instance, ocean levels are rising when volcanic eruptions occur which makes the temperature of the water much more higher. Therefore, climate change is not necessarily something we can always prevent.

They believe so because many attempts have been tried already with great success. prompt: Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way to live with it. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In recent decades, global warming has been receiving a great deal of media attention around the world due to its substantial impacts on human life. Although the idea of coexistence between climate change and humans appears reasonable, this cannot be viewed as the ultimate approach for humankind to combat climate change.
There are a number of reasons why the coexistence can do more harm than good. First, climate change is largely shaped by human-caused geoengineering rather than nature itself. For example, in order to produce the energy that drives the worldâs economy, most nations rely on carbon- rich fuels like coal, oil and gas, which directly correlates with the intensification of global warming. Second, even if citizens agree to keep the environment the way it is, corporations, especially in the manufacturing and mining industries, would not as that would affect their profits. Therefore, it can be implied that if corporations were not held accountable for their contribution to global warming as in the case of coexistence, the issue of climate change would inevitably be exacerbated.
It is more economically sound to actively prevent climate change than to ignore it. In fact, the costs, either financial or non-financial, of dealing with future consequences of climate change can be overwhelming. For instance, the increase in intensity and frequency of storms can cause massive destructions and deaths in many coastal areas, which would take decades to recover. In addition, rising temperatures have also contributed to the extinction of species worldwide. It should be noted that the extinction is irreversible and comes at great cost to the ecosystem and apparently humans living within it.
In conclusion, actively combating global warming must be regarded as top priority given the high urgency. Governments and corporations worldwide should take steps to ensure that climate change remains at bay.

In conclusion, public settings play an important role in the cultural development of the nation, and thus they are highly preferred tourist attractions. I believe that,Â money should be spent on both of them. Rich countries may allot more funds for the restoration, while poor ones have to focus on building these with spending the least amount as possible.

prompt:

essay:

First and foremost, space exploration has boosted scientific research. The money spent on space tourism is the key for scientists to invent new technology, which may also lead other industries to work with the space industry on research and development. For instance, smartphones, cameras, software, and robots are developed in the space travel sector. Besides, space exploration can create lots of jobs that help millions of people around the world find jobs in the space industry. In conclusion, the government can spend money in the private or public sectors in a variety of ways. However, I think the money spent on space travel is reasonable, and the government should continue to invest as it is part of its contribution to humanity.

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience
essay:
There has been much discussion revolving around the issue of whether consumers are influenced by advertisements or not, as they are faced with a maximum ratio of promotion from competing brands. In my opinion, I think clients get affected by the posters. In this essay, I will highlight how customers are influenced by the big brands marketing campaign and what solution we can take to protect them.

To begin with, advertisements plays a major role in marketing strategy as well as in the growth of  products. First and foremost, big companies hire actors and actresses for the branding of their products, as a result,as a result they not only influence individuals but also help companies financially in increasing the sales of the items. Moreover, these days organisations are more focused on digital content so that audience gets more controlled by their items. For example, Cadbury most chocolate advertisements are digital content based which influenced people to buy their product and try at least once.

However, there are several measures to be taken to be safe from them. Firstly, we should try to skip the ads while watching anything on social media ,as not only do they get us confused but also encourage us to take wrong decisions. Secondly, instead of getting influenced by the ,models we should more focus on the quality and the specifications of that products. For Instance, In a recent survey of Times of India in 2018, one-fourth of the population buys an item as they get influenced by their favourite actors and actress without checking the quality of the product.

In conclusion, individuals get influenced by increasing numbers of advertisements from competing companies whereas, before buying anything they should check the specifications and quality of the products instead of  getting influenced by the advertisements of their favourite models.

Food delivery apps such as swiggy and zomato are benefitting the most out of this.  a recent study on hunger shows that when your stomach is empty the brain does not function to its maximum capacity. When lunchtime strikes, hunger takes over and you will instantly see the application popping up notifications to take advantage of your starvation. you end up ordering online rather than eating home-cooked meals. Moreover, these apps record the time of your food order and have a history of your eating habits knowing exactly when to remind you through their campaigns so you end up spending more.

prompt: Consumers are faced with increasing number of advertisements from competing companies. To what extent do you think consumers are influenced by advertisements? What measures can be taken to protect them?
essay:
The world is becoming a competitive place. Hence, to survive the competition, businesses come up with innovative advertisements. Although it should focus on the utility of the product, nowadays it contains harmful facts. This essay will discuss that how consumer behaviour is influenced by them as well as will also discuss possible ways out to overcome this that are mainly enablement of stricter acts and educating the people.

Firstly, the advertisements have an enormous impact on the way customer behaves. The colourful digital content frequently portrays beneficial usage of the product. Thus, without much ,knowledge humans believe them. For example, although the food of KFC is labelled as unhealthy by various countries, buyers do not pay much attention to such alerts. This is mainly due to the attractive story that their advertisement communicates. Henceforth, I believe that the public receives an erroneous message from them which influence their purchasing habits.

However, the introduction of proper regulatory laws, as well as spreading awareness in  society can solve the long-term problem. The government should set up a regulatory body that will monitor all of them before they are released for the citizens, as well as they should also check the content of it. Besides that, a mass education camp about numerous daily use commodities should be launched. These events should focus on educating the commoners on the utility of commonly used things. For instance,  paracetamol tablets, are available in the market with numerous brandings. Although the work of it is same, some of them are expensive. As we are not aware of the generic names; thus, we trust the advertisements and buy the costly ones. Moreover, if we watch the TV commercials of such companies, they are misleading. Henceforth, the authorities should investigate such cases, and ensure that the fallacious facts are not getting communicated through the mass media.

To conclude, in my opinion, humans are mesmerized by things that they see visually every day. Therefore, such visuals play a vital role in their shopping patterns. Hence, it is the responsibility of the governing bodies to administer advertisement and to protect the habitats of a country by teaching them, so that they do not fall into misleading traps.

prompt:
Consumers are faced with increasing numbers of advertisements from competing companies.
To what extent do you think consumers are influenced by advertisements? 

What measures can be taken to protect them?
essay:
In todayâs world, the fierce rivalry among business entities has given rise to a proliferating number of advertisements broadcast on almost every means of media. While this phenomenon is not without positive influence, its adverse implications are more significant. Therefore, there will be some solutions proposed in this essay to  diminish its negative effects on consumers.

 

Needless to say, a rise in the number of advertisements has allowed viewers to be more well-informed of the newly-launched products. Given the unprecedented rate of technological advancement in recent years, without these means of marketing, consumers may fall behind the most innovative features introduced to the market, which may impede them from making  sensible purchasing decisions. However, such surge in adverts may bring about some underlying effects on purchasing behavior. Since consumers are constantly bombarded with advertising in various manifestations, they are more prompted to make a purchase without thorough consideration. It stands to the reason  that promotional campaigns are designed to prey on humansâ insecurities such as their inferiorities in physical appearance or their desire for social inclusion; as a result,  viewers are more liable to fall victim to buying unnecessary items out of spontaneity. Moreover, the competitiveness among companies has led advertisers to resort to dishonest tactics with the sole aim to boost sales. The most widely adopted strategy seems to exaggerate the true values of the advertised products, which induces the consumers to take preference of them and may lead to future purchases.

 

There are some possible solutions to tackle the problems engendered from such a trend. The most prominent responsibility should lie with the government since they are those who grant permission for adverts to be broadcast on mass media. Therefore, there should be a board  of experts whose job is to screen, monitor and cross-reference the advertisement contents and their actual effectiveness. The public should also take actions to protect themselves. It is recommended that before buying an item, one should do some research by either consulting the previous buyers  or taking their needs and affordability into serious consideration. With all of these measures joining forces, consumers are more liable to be well-protected from the invasion of misleading advertising.

 

In short, advertisements, with its  genuine nature , should provide useful information about new products in the market. However, given the tough competition between companies, this marketing tool may  provoke spontaneous purchasing decisions. Therefore, both the government and its citizens should take proactive measures in order to foster a healthy society.

prompt:
Some people believe that the government should take care of old people and provide financial support after they retire. Others say individuals should save during their working years to fund their own retirement.

What is your opinion?
essay:
Many argue that the government should look after elderly people and provide them with pensions after they are 60 years old. However, others say that people themselves should save money for later use. I agree with the former viewpoint because savings would not be enough to support people, and residents pay taxes to the government all their lives.

The main reason why the government must take care of old people is that their savings would not be able to support their medical bills, house rent, and monthly groceries. This is because the inflation rate has been quite high in the last few decades and there are no signs that the inflation rate will go down in the coming years. For example, a recent study in the US found that in the coming years, the prices of housing, medical and other necessary items will go so high that it would be very difficult for people to buy certain items. Therefore, it is necessary that the authorities should look after elderly people.

Another reason behind this is that people pay taxes to the government authorities while they are working. The government collects taxes from residents as an income tax, service tax, and property tax. Therefore, people already have paid enough to the state that they can pay monthly pensions to all elderly people. To illustrate, the UK government imposes a 30% tax on income, and the government earns millions of pounds. A small portion of this income should be distributed to people in the form of pensions to older people.

In conclusion, the government should take responsibility for their citizens for their health and financial assistance because monthly savings will not be able to cover their monthly bills, and taxes are paid to the taxation authorities by people all their lives.

While some believe the authorities are responsible for caring for and supporting their aged citizen financially, others suggest individuals should take  responsibility of their retirement. In my opinion, governments should offer basic care and funding to their retired population. This essay will discuss the reasoning behind my belief.

To begin with, if governments provide basic health care and financial support to the elders, it may release the pressure from the next generation who feel obligated to pay for all of their parentâs expenses. Therefore, they can focus on their production and education which will benefit the country. For example, many young people from Hong Kong contribute almost half of their income to their parentâs care due to the lack of retirement support from the government, thus the pressure of overworking reduce the motivation of citizen to pursue higher education or improvement. As a result, Hong Kong has been falling behind in educational and industrial development, furthermore, overpassed by countries like Singapore as the international financial hub. 

Moreover, the aged population was once labour resources, who paid taxes and contributed production and value to the country. Consequently, they deserve fundamental healthcare and basic needs such as housing and transportation support from their government. For instance, retired Australian citizens are entitled to pension and their medical bills are covered by the Medicare scheme. 

In conclusion, I strongly recommend governments  take care of their aged citizens and offer financial support to them. Not merely because less pressured working citizens would be more productive, moreover, secured and motivated labour would bring positive influences to the development of their state. Also, the retirees, who once dedicated themselves to the development of the country, are well-deserved  care in return.

prompt: Some people believe that government should take care of old people and provide financial support after they retire. To commence with, it is indeed an irrefutable fact that the significance of planning a retirement life is increasing each decade because of the cost of living.There are myriads of plans available in banks and other cooperative industries for retirement; these kinds of plans definitely help to maintain retirement life without any hassle and bustle.For instance, a survey was conducted by Harvard University about the pre-planned  retirement life in 1000 elderly.The result shows about 90% of them are leading satisfying life than other aged people those who do not have any plans.In light of this survey, the public has been started to support pre-planned old age life.

However planned an old age life, the authority has to provide funds for medical care of the elderly;similarly, the officialdom has to cut high taxes in their old age to reduce their agony and anguish.For instance, an experiment was conducted by the Iceland government by providing old-age pensions for their senior citizens for 2 years and watched the result.The result shows about 90% of them are happy because of this extra fund from the state as well as this is reduced their age-related stress to an extent.

In conclusion, planning retirement life from a younger age is a responsibility of people,although, public funds are also needed in their old age to get good medical care so the authority has to provide funds for elderly people.

prompt: Some think that the government should support retired people financially while others believe they should  take care of themselves. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
In modern society, some people believe that the government should financially support the retired, ageing population while others think they should be able to be financially independent. I believe that the government should definitely support retired workers, especially the ones who have had a larger impact on the countryâs well-being.

There is no denying that most people have a rough idea on when they would like to retire so planning in advance and having the ability to save money for their future is a big reason why the government shouldnât pay. Therefore, it would make sense for the government to refuse financial support in this case. However, many jobs on minimum wage, especially the oneâs directly involved with the government, do not make enough money to save for retirement. As a result, they would need extra support financially.

Now to why the government should pay, there are multiple reasons. One of them being that many individuals pay taxes and have jobs that they can only sustain during their younger years. For example, soldiers working in the army retire younger and find themselves jobless after retirement. Not to mention how much they sacrifice for their country, only to be left with nothing as soon as they finish their service. As far as taxes are concerned, most of the money that the public spend, many of them never see the impact it has on the country. 

In conclusion, the government should aim to implement schemes that give back to some of the most valuable members of our society. Without them, the country would struggle to function effectively. To give them nothing in return is a disgrace to the government.

prompt: Some countries have an ever-increasing proportion of the population who are aged 15 and younger. What is your opinion of the current and future effects it may have in those countries?
essay:
In many developing countries such as India, it is evident that there is a constant increase in the population, especially the younger generation which is under 15 years of age. The rise in population will have a greater impact on the short term and long term which will be advantageous in the former while disadvantageous in the latter. This essay discusses both the current and future implications of this scenario.

With the recent lockdowns enforced by the government, owing to the pandemic situation, the families had to stay at home which has resulted in a new society called  the COVID generation. The immediate impact because of this is an increase in sales of the child care products and their associated market. Secondly, a recent trend in the photography industry for the newborns has paved the path for a new industry. Finally, as most of the parents are working, they prefer to send their kids to the daycare centres which are now available at every corner of the street. Though there is a number of new ventures emerging due to the existing situation that increases the revenue of the government, there will be a serious impact on the economy in the future that is worrisome.

When these millennials grow older, there will be a huge impact on the democracy's economy. An increase in the population indicates that the number of jobs required in the forthcoming years will be high. In addition to this, there will be a depletion in natural resources, the agricultural lands are converted into complexes to accommodate the growing population which in turn will make the country dependent on imported goods for the livelihood  would result in inflation. With fewer jobs and more cost of living, the crime rates across the nation will increase.

To conclude, though the increase in the number of births helps certain countries' economies bloom at the moment, there will be a severe impact in the near future if proper steps are not taken by the authorities in charge. The State and Central parties must plan effectively to meet the needs of their population and the economy.

prompt: Some countries have an ever-increasing proportion of population who are aged 15 and younger. What is your opinion of the current and future effects it may have in those countries ?
essay:
In some countries, the number of young people who are under 15 years old has a significant rise in recent years. In my opinion, this trend would influence the current and future times of these countries both in negative and positive ways.

Having more young people would bring various impacts on society such as allocation of educational resources and job opportunities. Firstly, if public schools have full enrollment, parents would have to send their children to private schools. This means parents need to pay higher tuition fees than the cost of going to public schools. It could largely increase the economic burdens for childrenâs families. Secondly, in the coming decades, it might be more challenging for these young people to secure jobs, especially when governments have trouble in offering sufficient job positions.

Meanwhile, a larger population of youth may also bring advantages to the nations. On the one hand, in order to ease the current pressure, governments need to invest more money in infrastructure, including public transportation, sports facilities, and school construction. This could create a better environment for teenagers. On the other hand, the younger generation tends to be energetic and creative, which is a useful source of innovation and evolution for their own countries. Therefore, a nation would be more advanced in the upcoming years by having more youngsters.

In general, when there are more young citizens who are aged 15 and younger in some nations, it has not only drawbacks but also benefits in the present and future time.

prompt: Figures show that in some countries, there is an ever-increasing proportion of population aged 15 or younger. What do you think are the current and future effect on those countries?
essay:

The great proportion of young people will aggravate the burden of nurture in short term. To rise more kids, parents have to work harder to earn more and devote budgets, which would be spent on consuming food and beverage, to childrenâs care and education. Moreover, teachersâ workloads would be overwhelming since teachers have to take care more students now than before. 

On the other hand, the increasing percentage of teens will bring several benefits to the whole society in long term. Teens will become suitable candidates for the job market when they become adults, which provide more workforces to the industries. Great workforces would generate abundant outputs and boost growth of economy. Moreover, the number of innovations and inventions could be enlarged when more kids grow up and well-educated, since great proportion of teens means great probability of emergence of experts and innovators. 

However, the increasing percentage of teens might cause troubles to the eco-system in long term. As population growth, the amount of natural resources consumed and the amount of waste generated would be increased. Therefore, the environment may face serious threat of contamination. 

To sum up, the growth of teen population would bring significant impacts to those countries, both in positive and negative sides.
