prompt: Some people think that robots are important for humanâs future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
In the era of advanced technology, robots are more and more common in our lives. The issue of whether robotics can benefit or hurt humans is widely debated. I believe that robots are crucial to human's future development, but they can also make negative impact if we do not regulate them.

It is generally accepted that robotics can assist the advancement of mankind since they are automation tools and thus they can significantly simplify our lives. In other words, robots or machines are able to extricate people from performing regular and repetitive tasks. For example, automatic manufacturing devices can accurately form and assemble products, which saves people lots of time and energy for production. Eventually, because people spend less and less time in boring works, people will have extra energy to carry out more valuable and meaningful affairs, such as inventing new items and formulating strategies for protecting environment.

On the other hand, robots may hurt humanity if they are poorly invented and regulated. As we may know, robots or machines are basically sets of programs and mechanisms developed by people. If codes or mechanical parts in robots are not well crafted, catastrophic results are highly likely to happen. For instance, robots that serve the purpose of cleaning can hit and even impair people if their moving systems do not function correctly. More serious accidents can occur if robots are not examined and checked carefully before they are sold to the public.

In conclusion, robots are greatly beneficial to the furtherance of humanity. However, a great deal of disasters can happen if robots are not correctly designed and monitored.

prompt: Some people think that robots are important for humanâs future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay:
Since time immemorial, the invention of artificial intelligence has been man's major objective. There is an ongoing argument about the presence of robots on planet earth. Many people believe that it will be a great innovation while others think it will have adverse effects. This essay would take an exhaustive look at these views while I conclude with my own opinion. 

   One major reason why robots are important to human survival is that  they help ease labour. In today's world, many construction companies and factories tend to be more productive by introducing artificial intelligence to their daily operations which makes production and construction seamless and more effective. In 2009, Jung Sung a textile factory owner from China stated that production has skyrocketed by 200% since they introduced artificial intelligence into their manufacturing process. Robots are essential for the reduction of human labour they help increase productivity.

    The major negative side of robots' reality is that they will cause unemployment. Hence, there would be no jobs left for humans due to the inability to compete with automated technologies that are specially created to be way more effective than humans. In 2012, the Chinese government carried out  research which stated the cause of unemployment in their economy and it was concluded that the existence of  artificial intelligence reduced employment drastically. It is pertinent to say that introducing robots to planet earth will reduce job opportunities.

   Conclusively, robots can be a source of unemployment for humans but we can say that the existence of robots has lots of merits such as high productivity in labour and effective operations due to the way they have been programmed to work tirelessly without rest. The invention of robots would aid growth which would help factories, construction sites and other related organizations beat their set targets due to the initiative.

prompt: Some people think that robots are important for humanâs future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society.  Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Robots now play a vital role in people's lives, thanks to advances in science and technology. Some people believe that robots have harmful impacts on society. However, robots, in my opinion, are more on the side of liberating humanity from monotonous jobs and unleashing our creativity.

People have negative thinking about robots for a variety of reasons. First, it must be mentioned that automation could eliminate jobs that can be done by robots instead. So that, a large scale of unemployment could happen. Additionally, investment in the robotics field makes the budget for other important areas limited such as healthcare, scientific research. Furthermore, mechanization has deskilled many workers which could delete some specific jobs. For example, the baristas become less valued at work by virtue of being replaced by coffee machines.

Besides these above human concerns, the vision of a new modern world where humans will take the role of creators, and artificial intelligence will create machines to realize those creations. One of the benefits that robots bring to people's lives is that they are programmed to perform tasks with high precision such as performing surgeries. Plus, they can increase proficiency at work thanks to higher speed and consistency. For instance, instead of using one hundred employees working in a production line, businesses only need 1 to 2 robots to operate that whole line with a shorter time or even many lines at the same time. Finally, artificial intelligence enables robots to learn from experience, adapt to new inputs, and execute human-like activities thereby boosting the quality of life.

To conclude, albeit disadvantageous in some cases, I believe that robots will not take over the majority of employment. By using them wisely and with precaution, robots will not only support humans but also create a desirable world.

prompt: Some people think that robots are important for humansâ future development. Other think that robot have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Some people would argue that robots are imperative for the future and enable people to save more time; however, some think robots negatively impact society and make people less social. Although robots may have made people technology-dependent, I believe that the quality of work will improve and be error-free with robotics.

On the one hand, using robotic technology, people become more dependent on machines and lazy. People spend more time watching TV or browsing the internet rather than doing their day-to-day work as robots work for them like a robot vacuum cleaner. As a result, people become more reclusive, less social, and lazy and will potentially get into several health concerns such as obesity and overweight related health diseases.

On the other hand, some people believe that robots enable people to work effectively and provide error-free results. Robots are programmed which minimize the errors humans usually can make. That degree of error can be minimal, like a typo error or massive during some surgeries, which can be fatal. In my opinion, I agree with this viewpoint as robots minimize mistakes; therefore, one can save time and energy to rectify the error. For example, recent research found that humans perform some surgical procedures that take 5-8 hours; when experimented with robots, scientists found a reduction in time by 1-2 hours with almost zero errors.

In conclusion, although robots make people lazy and less social, I believe robots save time and minimize human errors; therefore, they are beneficial for the future.

prompt: Some people think that robots are important for humanâs future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay:
One of the most interesting topics to discuss in current times is how automatic machines are taking over the future inventions. While Scientist's from across the globe argue that this is a right time for Artificial Intelligence to start control the world. However, others argue that giving complete authority to the machine can have some serious drawbacks, which will risk human's life at workplace. I strongly believe that there should be balanced automation technology for better future, which human can control if it is necessary. However, I will explain the both sides of the question with examples. 

There is an ample evidence to show that automated machines can produce significantly more amount of production when compare to humans. Which means, automated machine can do 5 people's work in one hour with less manpower. In the same way, R&D departments form various industries providing more employment opportunities for graduates to develop advance machines. For example, economically developed countries like the USA, Germany and UK already deployed automated machines in manufacturing industries. As a result, more production can be done in short time. 

On the other hand, some commentators suggest that too much of automation technology at workplace can lead to serious outbreaks. For instance, machines have no control of taking decisions on their own, unless someone can programme them to do so, mistakenly, if a person is standing at the machine operated location, he can be injured. While recent study from the University of Melbourne states that, if automation technology started expanded, unemployment rate will increase more likely to 25 percent in Australia. 

In conclusion, I strongly recommend that automation machines at industries will provide large amount of production in short time. However, too much of automation will make humans lazier in future. There should be balanced workload where machine and human can do.

prompt: The best way for a country to prepare for the future is to invest more resources in its young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay:
Itâs an undeniable fact that todayâs youth is the future of the nation. However, I agree to a large extent with this opinion that for growth and development, it is important to invest more resources in its youth is the best way for a country to prepare for the future. This piece of writing will explore various dimensions and elucidate distinctive assumptions regarding the statement in the looming paragraphs.

First and foremost, investing in the education of young people should be the primary focus. Educated people will be an asset for economic growth. Secondly, schools should focus on educating children making them career-driven and preparing them to learn financial management. Furthermore, this will foster innovation, responsibilities and creativity which is quintessential for the country's growth. Additionally, not only education, health and well-being should also be the primary focus area. Despite the fact, focusing solely on young people may not be enough. For instance, investments in infrastructure can facilitate trade and improve access to services, boosting economic growth. Moreover, investments in technology can increase productivity and create new industries. Lastly, investments in healthcare for all age groups is essential for a healthy and productive population.

To conclude, different people have different notions regarding the statement, but I have a plethora of reasons to advocate that although investing in the younger generation has huge benefits however, investing in other resources should not be overlooked.

prompt: Children find it difficult to pay attention or concentrate on school study what are the reasons? How can we solve this problem?
essay:
Learners discover it hard to focus on school lessons. The aim of this essay is to find the causes and how to fix this pain point.

There are many reasons why pupils cannot concentrate on their institute studies. To begin with, some teachers' method is not attractive to the children's purpose. To illustrate, students would like to join the online class but it is only an onsite lesson for them to choose from. Secondly, some coursework cannot apply to daily life such as advanced physics and maths. Then, many lessons are full of details to memory. For instance, pupils have to read more sources to find the right answer for the test. Moreover, in one semester, children have to learn more than 6 or 7 coursework. More of them affect students' leisure time. The effects are kids cannot find the proper break to rest and some teenagers have to use their personal hours to review the book.

In terms of solving the significant issue, both family and school have to corporate and give advice to the pupils. First, institutes should hold an annual meeting between parents and principle. For example, parents could share their kids' behaviour with teachers. Next, the lessons have to be varied for students to choose up to their interests. More sports and arts curricula must be included. In addition, schools must provide many methods to adapt to these days' lifestyles. Typically, providing hybrid courses for learners to pick from and let them be part of the selection processes.

To sum up, it is difficult for many learners to focus on school subjects. However, offspring, parents, and schools can be working together for solving the issue.

prompt: Children find it difficult to concentrate on or pay attention to their studies in school. What are the reasons? How can we solve this problem?
essay:
It is often argued that more and more children facing difficulties to pay attention to their studies in institutions. In this essay, I will explain why the case is so, and give some possible suggestions to eliminate this problem effectively in the following paragraphs.

To begin with, there are many reasons why students are facing difficulties to concentrate on their studies in classrooms. First and foremost, due to enough sleep and lack of nutrition are the one causes of this problem. To illustrate this, nowadays, students are busy solving their assignments, this is because they got more homework from school, and as a result, they have no sufficient time to sleep. In addition, children are more aware to eat fast-food beverages instead of healthy foods for that reason they fall  sick and do not focus on their studies in institutions. For example, fast food like burgers and rolls are more popular food and liked by billion of children but it affects negatively  their health. Also, due to electronic devices students are spending  more time  watching phones and tablets, which is  another reason for this problem.

On the other hand, there are some solutions to eliminate this problem. Firstly, students should take nap properly, which will be helpful for their studies. For example, it is scientifically proven that for better focus on work and study people should sleep at least 8 hours, which helps to relax their mind and grow effectively. Secondly, children should it more healthy foods like apples and oranges which contain more nutrition. Furthermore, teachers should give the minimum amount of homework to their students, which helps children to free and relax their minds and pay better attention during  class periods.

In conclusion, due to lack of sleep and nutrition along with using more electronic devices children are lacking to concentrate on their studies in the classroom. However, taking more healthy food and a proper nap helps them to focus on their studies in school.

prompt: Children find it difficult to concentrate on or pay attention to their studies in school. What are the reasons? How can we solve this problem?
essay:

 First of all,  youngsters finding it difficult due to the use of methods while teaching nowadays, in most of the  Western countries they follow modern ways of teaching along with different techniques to uphold their focus in education, therefore, management should include animations, effects to make the class more interesting. prompt: Children find it difficult to concentrate on or pay attention to their studies in school. What are the reasons? How can we solve this problem?
essay:
Not being able to focus on class is one of the main concerns in the early-age learning journey. From educational perspectives, there are two main reasons which are the mismatched learning styles, and long-term exposure to poor nutrition and lack of sleep. 

Firstly, it is irrefutable that we all learn differently, and so do children. Some learn best by seeing, hearing or doing. Therefore, if the teachers only emphasize a specific learning style and apply it to all the children, this can result in a lack of focus and understanding. In this case, the solution is to ask the teachers to observe what are the options that they can choose to engage children in their learning experiences. For example, inquiry-based learning projects can be planned and adapted to search for the right methods. 

Secondly, it is sad to state, but, indeed, children cannot focus on their studies simply because they do not get enough sleep or nutrition. In fact, there are circumstances where many children do not have enough recommended sleeping hours or have to skip breakfast to be on time. Consequently, these children do not have energy and become distracted in class. As adults, we need to take our steps to reduce the numbers of children who have physical disadvantages. Government, schools and families have to work together to build up better schedules so children can have more time to sleep. Besides, they also must have free-food programs for poor children to make sure they are full when they study. 

In conclusion, there are many reasons which could lead to the failure of paying attention in the classroom. However, from my perspective, mismatched learning styles and lack of nutrition and sleep are the main causes. Together with families, governments and schools have to work on their policies in teaching methods and free-food programs to support children more.

prompt: In recent years,â responsible touristsâ have paid attention to preserving both culture and environmrnt of the places thay visit. However, some poelpe say that it is impossible to be a âresponsible touristâ. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In recent years, the concept of "responsible tourism" has gained popularity, as more and more people have become aware of the impact that tourism can have on both culture and the environment. Responsible tourism is defined as tourism that takes into account the social, cultural, and environmental impact of travel, and seeks to minimize negative effects while maximizing positive effects. However, some argue that it is impossible to be a "responsible tourist" due to the nature of tourism itself.

On one hand, it is true that tourism can have negative impacts on both culture and the environment. For example, in areas where tourism is concentrated, local cultures can be threatened by commercialization and homogenization. Additionally, tourism can lead to overcrowding, pollution, and the degradation of natural environments. It is also true that many people travel to popular destinations without considering the impact of their visit on the local community and the environment.

On the other hand, it is also true that tourism can have positive impacts on both culture and the environment if it is done responsibly. Responsible tourism can help to preserve and promote cultural heritage, by supporting local communities and promoting sustainable practices. It can also help to protect the environment by encouraging sustainable travel and reducing the impact of tourism on natural resources.

In conclusion, it is not impossible to be a "responsible tourist". While it is true that tourism can have negative impacts on both culture and the environment, it is also true that tourism can have positive impacts if it is done responsibly. By being aware of the impact of travel and taking steps to minimize negative effects while maximizing positive effects, tourists can play a role in preserving and promoting culture and protecting the environment.

prompt: In cities and towns all over the world the high volume of traffic is a problem.What are the causes of this and what actions can be taken to solve this problem?
essay:
It is undoubtedly the case that the urban areas are suffering from high volume traffic congestion. There are many arguments for this problem and plenty of solutions to mitigate this issue. In this essay, I will discuss the criterion and also highlight some solutions that should be taken by the government authorities. 

The very first step is to find out the argument behind a wide range of gridlock. In brief, there are several reasons for the rising traffic jams. Firstly, one of the major causes is overpopulation of the city areas. Most of the offices and factories are situated in urban areas which is why job opportunities are comparatively higher in the towns than in rural areas. For this instance, most of the village people migrate to the city space for the sake of getting a job. Secondly, cars are now more affordable for massive consumers. Most of the job holders are trying to reach the office by the car without any co-passenger except the driver , therefore, roads are blocked with cars in office hours and cause serious movement issues. Thirdly, the roads and lanes are not well constructed. The unorganized roads are a great reason for high-rise traffic.

To solve this critical problem the government should take some necessary steps. Some of the factories should be shifted to different rural areas therefore, many people will also shift to those areas for their job purposes. The tax rate on cars should be increased. If the tax rate is high then it will not be so easy to maintain the cost of a car and there will be fewer cars on the road. Eco-friendly vehicles like bicycles can be used for easy transportation instead of cars. Finally, the authorities should construct the road in a proper way and develop separate lanes for trucks and buses. 

To sum up, traffic jams can be caused by many reasons. If the government and general people work in a proper way to solve this problem then it is possible to get rid of this high volume of traffic.

Lastly, the concerning bodies should promote public transport in the nation. In addition to that, there should be a limitation on the usage of private vehicles. To exemplify, the Chief Minister of Delhi introduced an Odd-Even policy that allowed only odd and even car numbers to run on alternate days respectively. This resulted in bringing down the traffic.

To conclude, the unexpected growth in traffic congestion is due to lenient rules and overpopulation. To manage the chaos on roads, the governing bodies should impose adamant traffic rules and exorbitant penalties.

prompt:
In cities and towns all over the world the high volume of traffic is a problem. 

What are the causes of this and what actions can be taken to solve this problem?
essay:
It is undoubtedly the case that huge number of cars is moving in the highways and this is causing problems for many communities. There are several reasons for this problem and various measures can be taken by both induviduals and governments to imrove this problem.

There are two main factors that have led to the rise in traffic in towns and cities. One of the major causes is that the ownership of cars have been increasing in many societies, which means the vehicles become more affordable for the average people and they are no longer a luxury item, but something that most families expect to own. The second reason is that public transport has become increasingly unreliable and uncomfortable because many bus and train services are often delayed and not frequent. As a result, there has been a rise in the use of private cars, leading to the high volume of traffic, especially in rush hours.

Despite the obvious reasons above,there are several actions that governments could take to solve the problems.Firstly, a simple solution would be to improve the reliability of public transport to encourage people to take the bus or the train rather than driving their own car. The second measure would be for governments to discourage people from driving to work by imposing special tariffs on using the roads, especially during peak periods. A successful example of this is the congestion fee in London which has certainly reduced the level of traffic in the city centre.

In conclusion, despite some obvious reasons, various measures can be taken to tackle the problem of rising levels of traffic in urban areas. While it may not be possible to find a complete solution, any action should probably involve encouraging greater use of public transport and making it more expensive for people to drive in urban areas.

prompt: Most of the urgent problems can only be solved with international cooperation. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
When it comes to emergency issues, some said that they should only rely on help from other nations to solve the problems, while other individuals think that the incidents can be deal with by supports in the country. I personally disagree with the statement that we depend on global scale cooperations to solve the crisis, since there could be drawbacks to counting on foreign supports.

Firstly, it takes more time for anther nationsâs support to arrive. Since the problem is urgent, counting on help from other countries could lead to miss the best opportunity to deal with the situation immediately. Also, local support team who are located closer to the site can respond to the issue immediately by gathering up resources and planning the solutions. All in all, local people can respond to the problem more quickly in order to mitigate the situation.

	Secondly, it is hard to organize support teams and resources come from different countries when an emergency crisis occurred, since the situation could be chaotic with  the spread of misleading informations. Also, the language barrier could be a difficulties since not all foreign personnel familiar with the local language and customs, so it might be difficult for them to support in the site. On the other hands, local emergency services personnel can communicate directly with the victims using their native language, which can speed up the processes and avoiding misunderstanding. As a result, domestic rescues are more supportive due to familiarity of local culture and language.

	Overall, I support that urgent situations can be solved by national emergency services with faster respond time and the knowledge of local environment.

prompt: Some peole think that parents should read or tell stories to their children. Others think parents needn't do that as children can read books, watch TV or movies by themselves. Discuss both views and give your own opinions.
essay:
Never before has the public been so concerned about early-age education. Some people argue that the involvement of parents in story-reading is necessary while the rest believe that children benefit more from gathering information on their own. From my perspective, although the guidance from family to form a reading habit is indispensable, it is more beneficial to read independently. 

Without doubts, parents play a significant role in the early development of children. Generally speaking, story-telling empowers children to become curious. By listening to fairy tales from parents, children can learn about  nature and  history. They would also generate various questions about the society that they are living in from these tales, which helps to develop their creativity. Another point worth mentioning is that it takes time and efforts for children to be mature enough to read the storybooks or to understand the contents from the TV show, thus the supports from family at an early stage become more important.

Despite the difficulty for children to acquire information from books and TVs directly at an early age, it is still indispensable to develop their learning skills. First of all, reading independently is the best opportunity to form a reading habit for children, and their reading and writing skills can be trained during their self-reading. By contrast, only listening to stories may ultimately lead to  over-reliance on parents, and it is detrimental to their future study in school. In addition, stories from parents are prone to be limited to their own knowledge, while tremendous helpful and fresh information, such as stories that can trigger childrenâs interests in math, can be found in books, which contributes to a more balanced development for the youngsters. 

To put everything into consideration, supports from parents in story-telling promote creativity and curiosity for children at young age. However, not only does independent reading contributes to the writing and reading skills of children, but also it enables them to get access to a wider range of knowledge, which leads to  more balanced development.

In fact, some anti-fans or uncivil people can unconsciously post some negative comments which make loyal fans become angry. This would be worse if those people have heated debates and intentional insulation, which leads to utter chaos in society to some extent.

Having said that, I still argue that the personal lives of famous people should not be published in the media due to tremendous negative effects on their mental health. In conclusion, because of the aforementioned reasons  in terms of human rights and detrimental effects on celebritiesâ mental well-being in particular and society in general, I disagree with the view that famous people should accept privacy invasion as a part of their reputation.

prompt:
Some universities offer online courses as an alternative to classes delivered on campus. 

Do you think this is a positive or negative development?
essay:
In a modern and high-tech society, some universities and colleges choose online classes as a substitution for face-to-face courses, which has both advantages and disadvantages. In this essay, I will discuss both positive and negative aspects. 

To begin with, there is no doubt that with online courses, students are allowed to study at home or wherever they feel comfortable and suitable. It is easy to attend in virtual classrooms  their technology devices with a strong internet connection anywhere in the world. For instance, some prestigious universities, including Harvard University, and Cambridge University have online courses, both free and pay fees, in many fields. They also provide specific curriculums and learning paths. Not only the convenience but also students are possible to save time on transport when participating in online classes. Besides, the availability of online learning tools can promote students' independent learning. It creates good habits and motivates students, especially freshmen, to feel familiar with self-study - a popular learning method in tertiary education. 

In contrast, online learning might not offer learners face-to-face interaction. Firstly, students might find it uninteresting when experiencing a lack of interaction and engagement because of the limitation in providing activities or group work. Consequently, students can easily lose their concentration on the lessons and the effectiveness of their learning is decreased. With classes on campus, the more activities can be created in class, the more attention of students have and also more learning efficiency. Secondly, with some professional or key courses, teaching and learning online might not deliver full knowledge. Students become more passive when attending virtual classrooms and then receive the basic and fundamental, not acquire the core knowledge abundantly. Lecturers or teachers also might find it difficult to deliver the lessons and interact with students. As a result, students will not have a good day learning, and lecturers will work unproductively.

To sum up, online learning has pros and cons. Universities and colleges should balance between two kinds of classrooms to offer learners flexible learning opportunities, which one they feel is beneficial and convenient.

prompt: It is more important to spend public money promoting a healthy lifestyle in order to prevent illness than to spend it on the treatment of people who are already ill. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Having a healthy way of living indeed plays an integral role in a happy society. Because of this, allotting public money to promote a salubrious lifestyle has always been a topic of public interest and has a remarkable ability to alleviate severe health issues. However, some people argue that time and general finance should be diverted to cure ill patients which directly benefits human health. While this thinking is somewhat justifiable, I would contend that it is the interest of humankind to put more effort into boosting balanced nutrition for citizens generally.

 

It is understandable why some people think that it is essential to protect public health, which is absolutely in dire need of community funding. First and foremost, advocates may argue that according to a hectic pace of life, individuals are more inclined to consume unhealthy food and rarely spend their time cooking nutritious meals. This trend is followed by those devoting their whole time to earning their living. Therefore, eating fast food becomes their priority choice, leading them to live a sedentary lifestyle with obesity and also diabetes. As a result, the government has to pay attention to tackle this terrible tendency by providing more information about health issues and disease prevention campaigns. Forbidding junk food restaurants is a telling example, the authorities should establish more local markets where selling a variety of packed fresh meals is synonymous with an affordable price. This is a compelling testament to encouraging busy individuals to consume more good food.

 

Nevertheless, there is indeed a necessity to treat people suffering from a severe health cognitive. I believe it would be unwise to ignore the unshaken importance of this point. In fact, due to the lack of financially viability, many people who live in underprivileged areas do not have sufficient opportunities to cure their disease. They are in dire need of financial support. This means that instead of spending big bucks on other things, public money should be invested in saving human life. Additionally, a host of dangerous epidemics such as ebola and coronavirus may stand a chance of spreading and destroying peoples lives. Consequently, almost all the countries in the world must pay attention to prevent these circumstances by using national funds to support a compulsory, free vaccination for their citizens.

 

In conclusion, it seems better to use federal finance to raise the widespread concern about a healthy lifestyle. I am convinced that infectious disease outbreaks will have a toll on economic prosperity if the authorities misspend to protect their ill inhabitants.

prompt: Some people think that newspapers are the best way to learn news. However, others believe that they can learn news better through other media. Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay:
It is unequivocal that people hold different views about the means of getting the news. Although some people maintain that newspapers are the best way to learn news, I hold a belief that  people can learn news better through other types of media since these methods are easily accessible and more economical compared to the conventional newspaper. 

Admittedly, there are some rationales why people believe that newspapers are the best way to learn the news. Chief among these is that reading newspaper has high levels of accuracy because it is strictly censored by the state. One of the most appealing illustrations is  Thanh Nien newspapers which provides a host of thoughtful topics so many people enjoy reading this newpaper. Added to this, when you learn news by newspapers, you can practice concentration skills, while other types of media can make them distracted, they are not focused on the topics. Moreover, this can make us practice more reading skills, some people are not good at technology so it is hard for them to choose suitable sites to read news.

Notwithstanding the above-mentioned justifications, I still gravitate towards the view that people can learn news better through other media. one of the most compelling reasons is that, when we learn new through other types of media, it will be more diverse in topics. it bears witness to foreign news, we can get high-accuracy information, these are easily accessible and more economical compared to conventional newspapers. to add further credence to my assertion. all types of media are  free, we can be read easily with the click of a button. it brings convenience for people.

In conclusion, although there is no doubt that reading newspapers is still a ubiquitous type of getting informed, reading news types of other media is the best way to learn news in the modern times

prompt: Some people think that newspapers are the best way to learn news. However, others believe that they can learn news better through other media. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
In the world of growing advanced technology, the role of newspapers as the best means of transferring information has provoked considerable controversy. While some people still support this opinion, others have found other media more useful to obtain information. thus, this essay is going to weigh up the pros and cons of both sides, then showing my perspectives on the matter.

To begin with, there is no room for doubt that newspapers have long been a widely popular news channel for their reliability. The information in the newspaper is likely to be verified carefully before being published so as to minimize the risk of faulty news that would possibly ruin the reputation of the publishers. The checking process with various steps and people involved will investigate the authenticity of sources of news, the writing style of articles, relevant illustrative images and so on. thus, it may take more time, making newspaper less up-to-date than other digital media, which can immediately spread news when they happen.

On the other hand, there are many other types of media emerging in  modern life, especially, social media, which are claimed to be the fastest-growing in popularity. Since social networking sites are sharing platforms, users can post any news they encounter in their daily life at the click of the mouse, thus making social media a fertile source of news. due to their ease to use, the news can be spread easily and widely at an astonishing speed. For example, Facebook is now becoming one of the most effective ways to get information thanks to its billions of users, or in other words, billions of amateur âjournalistsâ. However, due to the lack of verification, the news on social media may be manipulated for several personal benefits. More seriously, some distorted news can even trigger adverse effects or great losses to  society.

By considering both views, it is reasonable to state that every media has its own advantages and disadvantages. thus, from my point of view, news learners should smartly utilize all media at their disposal by making the best use of the strong points and overcoming the drawbacks of each channel. For example, they should use social media to stay updated but still remain conscious by checking the news again in the newspaper to prove its authenticity. By using media effectively, people can obviously become more knowledgeable and up-to-date.

prompt: In many countries, people are deciding to have children at a later age than in the past. Why? Advantages outweigh disadvantages?
essay:
In these days and ages, in some nations, residents have changed their minds when choosing to have offspring at a later age compared to the past. This essay will find out the reasons and clarify why the drawbacks outweigh the benefits.

Firstly, when life costs increase, people decide to shift their priority from starting a family to establishing financial security which helps them to pay off basic needs including housing, food, transportation and healthcare services. Secondly, whereas women in the past were attributed as ones taking on roles of giving birth at the âright ageâ, this perception now has changed. In other words, females opt to pursue their careers, and personal goals and seek gender equality leading to a delay in starting a family. For example, a study conducted by the Demographic paper revealed that 7 in 10 women aged 30 â 35 said that they would not be ready to become moms unless they achieved their professional aspirations.

Despite the aforementioned grounds, it is undeniable that raising children at a later age has some disadvantages excelling advantages. On the one hand, having offspring when getting older that individuals achieve financial stability and a strong financial foundation facilitating them to create a better environment for adolescentsâ development and growth. It means that, their babies can join private schools with advanced education systems, resulting in positive performance which contributes to a qualified national workforce. On the other hand, giving birth late might cause some consequences related to childrenâs physical and mental health. Furthermore, it may result in a huge generation gap between parents and their sons or daughters, who are prone to be influenced by outside factors such as social media. As a result, parents need to talk to them regularly to provide appropriate guidance and advice helping to steer them from negative factors which older parents might struggle to solve.

In conclusion, although selecting to have offspring at a later stage in life is based on reasonable factors such as establishing strong financial backgrounds, it has some detrimental effects on childrenâs lives which outweigh the positive aspects. It is predicted that if governments have appropriate assistance in raising children, communities will re-consider giving birth at a more suitable age due to the decrease in childcare burdens.

prompt: People nowadays tend to have children at older ages. Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
In todayâs world, having children at older ages has become increasingly popular in recent years. Although this can have certain demerits, it is my firm belief that the merits of having children later in life are more considerable.

On the one hand, there are some drawbacks when having children at older ages. One of the most significant negative impacts is that it may create a generation gap. This is mainly because parents may be too old when their first child enters puberty, which is when there is a great change in their attitude. As a result, there may be a lack of mutual understanding between the parents and the children. Another negative effect is that having children at older ages may lead to an ageing population. As a consequence, senior citizens may have to work full-time even though they are too old to work. For example, in Japan, one of the countries with the highest ageing population rate in the world, the government has increased the retirement age from 60 to 65.

On the other hand, I personally believe that the benefits of having children later in life are more significant. To begin with, parents can choose the most appropriate educational style for their children. The main reason is that before having children, people have enough time to investigate the advantages and disadvantages of parenting methods. Also, many parents may observe and receive advice from friends, their parents and other experienced people, so this may help them become wise parents. Moreover, people may have the financial ability to raise their children. As a result, the children can fully develop intellectually and healthily. For instance, in recent years many parents have babies at a time when they did not have enough finances so their children may not receive the best benefits. 

In conclusion, while there are certain downsides of having children later regarding the generation gap between parents and their children and an ageing population, I am firmly convinced that the upsides in terms of being able to choose the most appropriate educational style and having the financial ability are weightier.

prompt:
some people believe that a greater difference in age between parents and children is more beneficial than less of a difference. 

Do you think the advantages of a greater age difference outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
The age difference between parents and their children has been a topic of debate. Some argue that greater differences in age can be more beneficial than smaller ones. In this essay, we will examine the advantages and disadvantages of varying age gaps between parents and children and discuss whether the benefits outweigh the drawbacks.

One potential advantage of a greater age difference between parents and children is the wealth of experience and wisdom that older parents bring to their child's upbringing. They may have a more stable financial situation and be better prepared for the responsibilities of parenthood. This can create a secure and nurturing environment for the child's development.

Furthermore, older parents may have a more patient and understanding approach to parenting, which can contribute to a child's emotional well-being. The experience gained over the years can help them make informed decisions and offer valuable guidance.

However, there are also disadvantages to consider. A significant age gap can result in a generation gap, leading to potential differences in values, beliefs, and interests. Communication may become challenging, as the generations may struggle to relate to each other.

In conclusion, while greater age differences between parents and children can offer some advantages in terms of experience and stability, the disadvantages related to potential generation gaps and health issues should not be overlooked. Whether the advantages outweigh the disadvantages largely depends on individual circumstances. Effective communication, understanding, and support within the family can mitigate many of the challenges associated with age differences between parents and children.

essay:

prompt: The best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Team sports at school are believed to be the most optimal way to teach children to cooperate. Personally, I disagree with this notion. In this essay, I will explain my justification in detail.

Admittedly, team sports are incredibly effective when it comes to teaching youngters to cooperate with others. Through a competive environment, players can develop problem-solving skills, self-esteem and strategizing. For example, they can recognize the strengths and shortcomings of each teammate which can be used better to compete against their opponents, especially in sports which have more than 5 participants such as football, volleyball and basketball. In addition, team sports provide a working environment where players work together to achieve a common goal. This can be achieved through verbal communication, body languages and hand signals. In other words, regularly participating in team sports enables teenagers to develop their communication skills which are essential to cooperate effectively.

However, it is important to acknowledge that cooperation skills can be cultivated by other activities beyond team sports. Firstly, communitive learning strategies, group project, community activities and even creative activities like theatre and music can also provide valuable opportunities for young people to develop their collaboration skills. In fact, these activities promote cooperation and ability to work effectively in a group setting. They encourage youngsters to understand different perspectives, value teamwork and appreciate the benefits of collective effort. Secondly, not only children may be inclined toward or have the opportunity to take part in team sports. Thus, it is crucial to create a range of activities and environments that cater to diverse interest and ability, ensuring that everyone has a chance to develop their cooperation skills.

In conclusion, while it is true that team sports can help children to develop their cooperation skills, I believe that this skill be developed through a variety of activities and environments . By providing a balanced approach that contains all activities, we can effectively nuture the value and skills in cooperating among adolescents.

prompt: The best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

prompt: News media is important in our society. Why is it so important? Do you think its influence is generally positive or negative?
essay:
With the advances in communication, the distribution of information is significantly faster and globalized. Many people, all around the world, rely and believe everything they read, hear or watch on news media. In this essay, I will explain the importance of this and why I believe it is mostly changing negatively how we behave. 

These days, the whole society gets informed by reading the news, listening to the radio or watching tv, as a way of being part of what is happening worldwide and not becoming isolated from reality. It makes people aware and conscious of the decisions made as well. In this manner, if prices go down on certain articles, people could choose to buy in advance and save for the future. 

Nevertheless, there are some drawbacks to news-media influence. It makes people scared of going out on the streets by streaming only violent and sad news. When it only shows, for example, robberies and homicides instead of the increase in volunteer work or special musical events, it can make the audience lose perspective about reality. Another serious issue regarding the media is fake news. These can create misconceptions, wrong needs and increase violence between citizens.  For instance, a lie about the spread of a particular disease will make people buy, steal and fight for a bottle of sanitizing alcohol without an actual real need. 

In conclusion, whereas being informed may feel essential to feel part of this globalized world, we should be cautious about what we see, hear or read. The media show exactly what it wants us to see and consequently changes and may mislead the way we feel and act daily.

Especially, dangerous criminals such as murderers or rapists have to be imprisoned for their heinous actions. Furthermore, severe prison sentences act as a deterrent against crimes. In conclusion, I believe there is no absolute way to deduce whether imprisonment policies or better education would take the dominant role in dealing with crimes as they both tackle the problem just in different ways.

prompt:
Public health is becoming an urgent issue nowadays. Some argue that governments should create nutrition and food choice laws to improve public health, while others believe that it is a matter of personal choice and responsibility.

Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
These days, general well-being has become a public concern. It is believed by many that authorities are entitled to issue food-regulating rules in order to ameliorate public health. However, others discern that individuals are responsible for their choices, and they do not have to be obliged to consume certain types of diet. Whilst I firmly believe that governments ought to intervene to a certain extent, I also believe that citizens have to be at liberty to choose from different options according to their health conditions and appearance preferences.

On the one hand, one reason why states should intervene in civilians' food choices relates to their power of supervision over various health-influencing sectors. In other words, some food corporations tend to mislead consumers by providing them with illusive images regarding their products as being healthy while they are loaded with palm oils and refined sugars. Since states are able to censor such erroneous data, they would be adjusting citizens' options by discarding such produce. One further reason why governments ought to participate in the selection process is that they are armed with nutrition experts and researchers who are able to provide citizens with the proper and up-to-date options according to universal health organisations and the latest recommendations around the world. In Egypt, for instance, public education campaigns against the dangers of obesity have been launched which have been based on the latest findings of WHO regarding  food choices.

On the other hand, one evident merit which proves the necessity of personal choices without governmental intervention relates to medical reasons. In other words, in certain medical conditions, regularly do patients require a specific style of diet in order to override the complications of such an ailment. Patients , therefore, have to adjust their intake and opt for suitable choices, the thing that cannot be actualized by governmental intervention. An eminent example of this is diabetic patients who are obliged to cut sugar and carbohydrate intake as their bodies are not able to eliminate simple sugars from their bodies. From a physical perspective,  civilians should be given the right to choose their preferable body shape. This is mainly due to the fact that what an individual is keen to consume usually reflects back on their appearance and physique. Bodybuilders, for instance, who choose to have such an iconic body image opt for a high-protein diet which helps them augment their solid muscles. Subsequently, any roles may be considered to be a violation of their rights of having a particular body appearance. 

In conclusion, despite the previously-mentioned benefits of authoritarian intervention on food options, I am convinced that individuals should be given the choice to adjust their intake for health and preference reasons.

prompt: Some people think the primary purpose of schools is to turn the children into good citizens and workers, rather than to benefit them as individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay:
People have different views about the main purpose of schools. While some people believe that schools should focus on professional skills, I believe that helping children to become a person is more important.

On the one hand, schoolsâ aim should be to prepare children to become successful future employees. children need to gain educational qualifications to pursue a career that has a high salary and insurance. In this way, they can buy their own houses and cars and start a family. For example, in the US, an increase in living costs shows that people need to earn large amounts of money so that they can have a good quality of life. thus, those who have great school grades may have more chances to enrol in university degrees and could face better job opportunities with higher wages.

On the other hand, despite the arguments described above, schools have a significant role to help children to create their personalities and to contribute positively to society. Moreover, they would learn about their responsibilities towards the environment and how to protect natural habitats. Furthermore, educating pupils could involve moral values like showing respect to different cultures and religions. For example, in the UK, secondary schools have some extended programs related to discussing the standards of peopleâs behaviour in society with students.

In conclusion, while I accept that schools should make children ready for their working life, I think their responsibility to provide social skills for students is undeniable.

prompt:
Some people think the main purpose of school is to turn children into good citizens and workers, rather than to benefit them as individuals.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Many are of the opinion that the primary role of schools is to create good citizens, instead of simply working towards individual betterment. In my opinion, schools should aim to elevate the individual, not impose conformity.

Those in favour of this statement argue the value of a well-functioning society. As the world develops and there are advances in medicine, safety, working conditions, and so on it is easy to forget that this level of comfort requires sacrifices for the common good. Individuals must work at companies to stimulate the economy and the public must have a basic sense of community in order to live peaceably with oneâs neighbours. School is where this education can begin. Teachers can explicitly and implicitly guide students to socially beneficial behaviours and educate them well enough to establish a viable future career.

However, I would argue that focusing on the individual will accomplish the goals detailed above but also be mentally healthier. Students who are taught to share, work well in teams, and develop their talents will contribute to society as a byproduct of pursuing their own seemingly selfish interests. Moreover, there may be times when the focus on society will come at the cost of the mental health of individuals. For instance, students who are taught to withhold their personal viewpoints in school, as is common in many authoritarian nations, may harbour resentment and not feel they can fully express themselves in a free environment. Psychological research has shown that the key to healthy growth is feeling safe to express oneself without fear of reprisals and repercussions.

In conclusion, although there is a valid argument in favour of social stability, schools should aim to produce healthy, industrious individuals. Naturally, these goals are not mutually exclusive and the overlap should be emphasized.

prompt: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example for young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay:
It is a fact that some celebrities become more popular for their luxurious lifestyles and possessions these days rather than for their mesmerising accomplishments. To a certain extent, this kind of popularity tends to lead young people in the wrong direction. However, there are also some celebrities who got to the place that they are at the moment for their actions and accomplishments.

On the one hand, some celebrities pursued easy ways to get famous such as getting married to a popular or rich person, living a fancy, shopaholic lifestyle or even doing unbelievable things and streaming live sessions. Moreover, it has become easier as social media platforms such as TikTok and instagram turned into a spotlight especially for those kinds of people. For  instance, the Kardasian family members are now billionaires with all the money gained from their reality show and hot topics of Hollywood despite the fact that not even one of them has a talent such as acting, singing or doing sports. Additionally, a group of TikTokers named Hype House is such a hit and on the tip of the tongue of every teenager these days but what they are doing are inappropriate performances, dances, partying and even breaking rules and restrictions during the pandemic. Such kinds of influences only aim to gain publicity and send a wrong message to the youngsters that successful life means wealth and accessories and it does not have to be meaningful.

On the contrary, it is great to have such kinds of famous people who live with compassion and put their great efforts to gain success in life. From their perspective, a way to success is a combination of passion, hard work and strong determination. Those are the people who apply themselves in developing their skills and abilities through perseverance. As an example, a korean boy band named BTS is nowadays among the most famous celebrities in this 21st century. They came all the way from South Korea and broke amazing records one by one in a way that no South Koreans have ever done before. All the members came from rural areas of their country to Seoul and worked so hard even before their debut. As a result, now theyâve become a tourism ambassador of their country and worked with the United Nations to help improve the mental health of youths under the program called âLove yourselfâ. Due to their hard work, now, theyâve set a great example and become idols to young people all over the world and made those youngsters believe in themselves and their worth.

In conclusion, it is true that as various types of social media platforms are being accessible these days, children are likely to be influenced by the so-called celebrities. Anyway, there are still some famous people who can make young people believe that their dreams could come true with hard work and passion. Thus, in my opinion, I think it is best if young people become more selective with choosing their role models.

prompt:

essay:

First of all, the government is the only way to fix this problem since it has taxes to build more house. It is well known that it causes a lot of expenses in order to build a plethora of houses. If the government builds houses by tax, they can lower the number of people who does not have a house and receive money when citizens purchase homes. For instance, my house in South Korea, which is located in a heart of city, is built by the government as our area had a lack of residential houses. Due to the government action, our place has enough place to reside now. All in all, due to money, only the government can solve this issue. 

Furthermore, the government have a power to held a campaign to make citizens transfer to rural areas to live. In order to lower the percentage of the shortage of housing, the government can distribute money for those who relocate their place in countryside. If a lot of citizens move their place to suburb areas, there will be many house that is vacant. For example, South Korea recently gave money to the people who transferred their house to rural place. After this campaign, there was a abrupt increase in the rate of people who started to reside in a countryside. Furthermore, youngsters also started to relocate in suburban areas and seek a job there. To sum up it is clear that a campaign can be held to fix this issue, which only the government can do.

In conclusion, the government is the only hope for the metropolitan cities to solve their issues about decreasing amount of a number of houses in cities where people can live since it has money and power.

prompt: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a  successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after  school. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: There has been much discussion revolving around the issue of whether students should  focus on further education in universities and colleges or it is better to let them apply for a  job straight after school. In this essay I am going to present both views and give my opinion.  Some people tend to think that it is better to continue your education in higher institutions,  because of the higher employment opportunities. One of the first things we need to take into  consideration is that universities and colleges give you more understanding and knowledge  in the sphere you are studying in, that helps you become a better specialist and most of the  employers search for well trained workers. For example, nurses and dentists are required to  have special training, which can take for about ten years, without it they wonât even be able  to become a simple doctor. But not only students of medical specialisations take further education, designers, managers, writers and others do it too, thatâs because often students  donât have enough knowledge to start their career, but with the help of professors, they have  a lot more chances to become professionals and it will be easier for them to get a job.  However, others insist that itâs better to get a job, because you can earn money and not  spend it on expensive learning. For instance, university prices go higher every year which is  not affordable for every family to let their children apply for one, so as we can see from the  last trends, it becomes more common for students to start their own business, build career  as a photographer, freelancer or etc. and make good money out of it.  To conclude, I consider learning at high education institutions is a good base for future  career and improvement students will get is indispensable, but in my opinion it is not a  necessity and it would be nicer to put less pressure on those, who have chosen not to take  this path and got a job straight after school.

prompt:
Some people think that charity organizations should only offer help to people of their own country. But others believe that these organizations should give aid to people in great need wherever they live.
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Nowadays, the governments and public developers have been working hard to determine the mix charity allocation among all citizens  around the world. Although some individuals believe that the citizens in the country are the ones who need the most help from their governments, however others, including me, believe that the governments still cannot ignore people from the rest of the world.

On the one hand, there are two main reasons why all types of assistances of the government must go towards own residents. Firstly, since the financial matter is essential for charities, financial management could be more effective by giving aid to domestic citizens who are having difficulties in their lives. In fact, not all charitable organizations have massive scale and abundant source of finance, therefore they cannot take care of both the poor people in their country and others being out of their national border at the same time. Secondly, it may be a pragmatic strategy for charity funds when they focus on providing aid to their residents because it allows their country to be less reliant on foreign subsidies in case of emergency. For example, there would be a beneficial effect on some countries which often suffer from natural disasters, such as Vietnamese, Philippine, Japan, etc. If their charities afford to rescue local people instead of expecting outside support.

On the other hand, it has been true in many cases that the prolonged poverty cannot be solved without the assistance from foreign humanitarian organizations. First, the product of poverty is the hunger, causing millions of deaths all around the world every year. As a result, if outside governments have steps for finance towards residents, who have been living in other countries,  which would save the lives of humans. Second, governmental organizations can help provide the education and skill for those citizens. As a result, plenty of evidence suggests that the most effective way to overcome poverty is education.

In conclusion, although some think that domination systems must only support the poor dwellers, but I think other nations should receive assistance because of above-mentioned reasons, and this method can reduce the financial pressure of international organisations.

prompt: Some people think news has no connection to peopleâs lives, so it is a waste of time to read news in the newspaper and watch news programs in television. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
News helps us to be updated about things happening around the world. However, some highlight that media companies prefer to show what is profitable to them, therefore news is just another way to kill our time unnecessarily and there is no direct relevance to people`s lives. In my perspective, I strongly agree with the statement and the reasons for this will be discussed in the forthcoming paragraphs. 

Firstly, there is no difference between a manufacturing company and a media company when it comes to their ultimate goal which is profits. Therefore most media companies prefer to show news which has little or no connection with people`s lives. For example, suicides and political dramas. Sadly, most people are interested to know such news simply to gossip with another or to kill their time, despite such news won`t bring any good for them. 

Secondly, media companies are reluctant to show good things happening around the world because they feel such news will make their customers bored. Therefore they prefer not to show them even if such news could help people to improve themselves. 

  A recent survey done at Melbourne University  found  that 80% of the news is either sad or depressing which clearly indicates that reading articles or watching programs is just a waste of time. 

In summary, all the media companies are money oriented and because of ,that they tend to show what excites the people even if that news has no value whatsoever. I strongly agree that news has no connection with the population`s lives and it is just another way for  people to kill their time.

prompt: Many customs and traditional ways of behaviors are no longer relevant to the modern life and no worth keeping. Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Human society has evolved substantially over the last centuries, and with such considerable changes come opinions that the old way of living has lost its relevancy and should be terminated. I cannot entirely agree as many traditions remain their acute importance in shaping generationâs behaviors and community. 

There are numerous conservative etiquette and concepts that appear unworthwhile to follow in the modern era. As the world is changing quickly, modern lifestyles differ significantly from the conventional ways of living. Therefore, the young generation with their forward-thinking ways should diminish those traditional cultures and even explore new cultural norms instead. The tradition of valuing men above women, for example, conflicts with feminism today. Those conventional concepts, furthermore, defer individuals from pursuing their freedom, in contrast to the centric lifestyle of young people. Gender stereotypes such as the belief of women's bias in housework, thereby preventing them from chasing their dreams is a salient instance of this. Accordingly, the young should have the freedom not to follow outdated customs and establish practices that are more appropriate for their time. 

. 

However, continuing to uphold social norms contributes to cultural preservation and civilized society. In simple words, if young people follow social traditions in activities that are different between cultures, they would probably preserve the uniqueness of their heritage. It means that those practices give rise to cultural conservation. Adhering to social traditions, furthermore, could educate younger people to have appropriate manners and morals. Traditionally minded Vietnamese parents, for instance, instill in their children the value of bowing to their seniors, displaying their deep respect and appreciation. Therefore, teens are raised to be reliable and generous, creating a quality society with mannerism.

In conclusion, although the young should be selective in choosing the social traditions because of out-of-date conceptions, upholding customs and traditions aids in conserving national heritage and educating civilized residents for society.

prompt:
The typical teaching situation of a teacher and students in the class will not exist by the year 2050.

TO WHAT EXTENT DO YOU AGREE OR DISAGREE?
essay:
It is clear that development in technology is playing a major role in delivering education today. There is a view that by the end of year 2050, the typical presence of teacher and students in classroom will cease to exist. However, In my opinion, I agree with mentioned statement to certain extent as their will still be certain scenarios that shall remain as it is.

Firstly, the pace with which education infrastructure is growing and adapting, it can be established that societies are accepting the virtual education platform. For instance, over the duration of past decade, fifty percent of the total academic degree's are now being offered online and by the end of next decade, it will be one-hundred percent. Recent technological advancements, such as virtual laboratories, assessments through artifical intelligence, certification exams being proctored using web-cam has left presence of individuals in classroom redundant. Evidently, with all the news ways of teaching, the typical presence of the students and a teacher in school classes is questionable.

However, I believe certain scenarious between teachers and students are most-likely to remain unchanged for possibly the next three-decades. As an example, childrens will still be asked for regular home-work, assignment submission and regular examination. Failing to which, they could face same consequences. Furthermore, the most obvious problem of childrens being unattentive in classes and facing punishment would stay unchanged, even if the lectures are delivered virtually. Although there might be changes in the way childrens are punished so as to motivate them to study, but that shall not hinder the regular arguments between them.

To recapitulate, with the advancement of technology and changing behaviour of education delivery by 2050, In my opinion, certain, traditional scenarios between teachers and pupil, such as arguments, and punishments shall stay unchanged.

prompt: People nowadays tend to have children in older ages. do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: The grown-ups nowadays have this decision as parents to get kids in their middle ages. There are numerous advantages and disadvantages to have kids in older ages which will be discussed on the following paragraphs. As far as I am concerned the benefits outweigh the drawbacks. The paramount benefit of this choice is having less difficulty feelings in parents. As a proof, you can refer to all young mothers and fathers around you. Most of them feel tiredness and they always think they lost something about their youth. Regrettably, they are not wrong. For an example, imagine a young mommy and daddy who have an adventurous life with lot of hobbies and entertainments before they become a mother and a father. Now they should get their mama and papa roles and skip some of their fun times. In addition to that, the next profit of this chosen option is about the life experience. As life goes on, you become more experienced. You have more involvements with different issues and as a result you learn a lot from them. So according to that process, an older person may be a better mom and dad in wisdom aspects because she or he has more maturity than a younger person. On the other hand, we might see some cons in that situation. Age difference problems are not the things that you can ignore. Too much age differences can cause a lot of conflicts in a family and the most important one is the elders are not able to understand the youngers needs and thoughts. For instance, I invite you to depict a family who the mom and dad are in the age of 50 and the children are about 15. How a 50-year-old man can understand a teenager needs? It is mostly impossible. To sum up, beside that the decision of the good age for having children depends on the owner, it has acceptable benefits to have kids in old ages. You are suitably mature and you have enough knowledge to raise and educate a child by yourself.

People nowadays tend to have children at older ages.

Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages.
essay:
The question about the perfect time to have children is debatable. In recent times, the trend of having children has increased significantly. This essay will discuss both the positive and negative outcomes of having children at older ages, while also explaining why the advantages tend to outweigh any perceived downsides .

To begin with, one of the main benefits is stability and maturity. Many individuals often lack sufficient time for their children at a young age due to career commitments and an unstable income. After having a great career, they can easily afford the best and the stable life for their child. According to a recent survey at Cambridge University, in developed countries, 80% of respondents plan to have children after the age of 35 years old. Furthermore, more mature parents tend to possess financial stability and independence. This stability can create an environment where children's needs are consistently met, improving their overall upbringing.

On the other hand, it is essential to emphasize potential disadvantages. To commence with, complications during pregnancy can be increased by advanced maternal and paternal age, such as gestational diabetes, hypertension, and genetic disorders. In addition, older parents might have concerns about being able to provide for their children throughout their lives, especially if health issues arise later on.

 Also, the generation gap between older parents and their children might cause communication problems and difficulties in relating to each otherâs experiences.

In conclusion, despite several downsides, this trend should be welcomed and encouraged. Older parents might have more time to spend with their children, but the quality of that time might be influenced by physical limitations or generational differences.
